story:
BONJOUR!

TVCK a besoin de ton aide afin de continuer sa mission. On veut continuer à découvrir, comprendre et imaginer le Kamouraska avec toi. 

Que se soit 2$ ou plus, chaque don nous aide à produire des belles émissions comme celles-ci :

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ppDjG6fFrjA

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iwmqrHjFFmk

Et à réaliser des projets comme ceux-là : 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nWbM31-LnvM

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d8hR0GsVGQI


On t'invite à visiter notre page facebook et à regarder notre chaîne youtube. 

https://www.facebook.com/tvck.media/

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCsP3iVIbObAluXSyu0hDhpw

story:
Northside

Artists have been given the gift of Creation, the power to Reform, and the mission to Inspire. 

Our goal within creative communities is NOT to shrivel into a box labeled for safety, but to be creative and involved with the world around us. As we create, we will NOT conform to the constructs placed on us by society but reform our culture to one that is free and liberating. We will NOT be satisfied with the status quo but inspire those around us to reach for excellence.

The Space

We want to promote local music, and art, so we are opening a storefront to do just that. Our goal is to have a massive selection of LA, Long Beach and OC artists. Primarily focused on musicians we will specialize in selling vinyl records and band merchandise. Because of our passion for music we will offer a wide selection of vinyl outside of just our local artists. 

The space will act also as a place for Art Shows, Screenings, Performances, and Community Events. Growing up in the SoCal music and arts scene, we fully recognize the importance of creating a space for artistic expression. 

Thirdly the space will act as a lounge to listen to music and network with other local artists. Tutorials and how to's will constantly be happening to push forward our creative agenda. 

The Challenge

We need your help raising money to get us started. The doors (quite literally) are waiting to be opened and money is our final challenge. We have been networking and communicating within the local community and it is buzzing. We need your help to cover the costs of building out a space that will inspire our vision for North Long Beach. Often known as a "rough" neighborhood and undesirable place, North Long Beach is filled with potential. We want to see this place shine and promote the goodness within our community. You can help us magnify the voice hiding within these walls.

story:
We are Emily and Iain. She used to be a primary school teacher, he used to be a tech guy. We are leaving our lives in the UK and moving to France to see if the good life really exists.

In April 2016 we bought an old farmhouse in rural Brittany with one simple aim; to live a slower more self-sufficient lifestyle. We don’t seek a grand design, merely modest surroundings to feed and house ourselves.

In the year we have owned our house we’ve developed plans to share our space and lifestyle with friends and strangers.  So we're converting our barn and garden into the most wonderful, tranquil space to host retreats and co-working.

 

  1. We’ll hire our venue to instructors or colleagues to host their own courses or events.
     
  2. They’ll invite their guests to come and stay, selling tickets if required.
     
  3. We’ll feed everyone with food grown in our garden.

 

Our tiny problem is Chef de Ville is a long way from perfection! Right now:

  • the barn is a shell of a building,
  • the garden is an overgrown mess, and
  • the business idea needs time to develop.

 

 

What We Need

Our life-savings are invested, every penny we’ve earned and saved. We’d love it if this was enough, but sadly it isn’t. So we’re throwing ourselves open to ask for help.

While money is important, it isn't the only thing we need. So asking a bank for a loan will only go so far. We also want people to invest in our first season, by signing up to host events or commit to come and co-work in France next summer.

Bookings will mean we have guaranteed guests next year and any money raised will help us to fund the three aspects of our project:

 

We have recycled materials. Our approach from the outset is to reuse as many things as possible, to repurpose, upcycle and make do. But we need specialist materials. Things made to measure or complement the missing materials we don’t yet have.

We have volunteers. Friends and strangers are queuing up to help get stuck in. Some with special trades, some with special hearts. But we need a living fund. To help buy food to feed them while we’re still establishing our garden and petrol to collect them from the ports.

We have great ideas. To turn an old, derelict and overgrown space into a tiny parcel of paradise. But we need some start-up funds. To help us develop the business so it can become sustainable and pay us for future phases of the project.

 
 

The Impact

Crowdfunding will help show there’s an interest in our project, because right now we’re a gamble. Who would possibly book to stay in a derelict barn and wander an overgrown garden?

Yet with our surplus energy and countless ideas, and your generosity and commitment you’ll help us take our much-needed first steps.

 

  1. We’ll use our savings and crowdfunding to renovate the barn and garden so we can attract instructors and their guests to come and stay.
     
  2. Steadily easing the retreat into life we’ll build a sustainable business to bring us an income to reinvest into future developments.
     
  3.  Finally, we’ll use profit from the business to develop our house so we can live in modest comfort and welcome family and friends to stay.

 

Let’s face it, the good life might not exist! It’s going to be an uphill struggle, against time, against budgets, against the odds, to get this done.

Yet none of us want this to be true, do we! Not without giving this all we’ve got, and that’s precisely what we’re planning on doing.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course, not everyone can donate money. Plus, many people we know have already donated other things to help, and we're really not expecting more. But what you can do is...

 

  1. Tell your social networks (online and offline) about our plans
     
  2. Volunteer your time and come stay in France
     
  3. Come and be a guest when we're open

 

Lastly, keep an eye out on how we’re progressing by signing up to our mailing list. Thanks for reading, we really do appreciate your interest and support.

story:
Women learning skills                                       

                                                         Eunice

 

Short Summary

“Behold, I am doing a new thing; now it springs forth, do you not perceive it? I will make a way in the wilderness and rivers in the desert.” Isaiah 43:19

Have you heard? Women in Malawi contribute about 70% of the labor force in smallholder agricultural sector. However, many of them drop out of school, are poor and subject to abuse such as forced early marriages and rape. Others are widowed through HIV/AIDS and left with children and no hope. This leaves many of them living in economic and social slavery. This tragedy happening to 52% of the population is not consistent with Malawi, known as "The Warm Heart of Africa."

Eunice, the founder of Zayane Creations, personally experienced this tragedy. At age 15, she was sexually abused and gave birth to her first child. She experienced rejection, shame and dropped out of school. Later, however, she was given an opportunity to continue education, become employed and learned skills including jewelry design.

She is now married to Sam, the company’s managing director, and have a second child. Her story inspired the couple and one other Malawian Evelyn, to start Zayane Creations. The company will produce and distribute jewelry and bags with packaging reminiscent of The Warm Heart of Africa. The company's business model will give similar opportunities to vulnerable women.  

10 vulnerable women will initially be employed to create our products. By the end of the first year, these women will begin training 10 new women. In the next five years, we target to reach and train 400 women as well as give part of our company shares some of them for more economic empowerment.

The word “Zayane” means “to feel at home,” and is spoken by a person who is warmly welcoming someone into their home. Zayane Creations is desiring to not only empower the women economically and through skill development, but also to point them to the heavenly home through sharing of the Gospel of Jesus Christ and discipleship. 

Partner with us in restoring The Warm Heart of Africa through one product at a time!

PRESENT CONDITIONS

Sam, Eunice and Eve are currently students at African Business Institute (ABI) in Uganda since January until December, 2017. ABI is a business incubator training Africans to establish businesses that are run with integrity and excellence to contribute to the development of their countries and Africa. Sam, Eunice and Eve will be going back to Malawi in December to set up Zayane Creations which will commence its operations from January 2018.

KEY PROCESSES

Zayane Creations aims at making of jewelry and bags that are of high quality and in a variety of custom designs to give customers a variety of chose and satisfy their desires.  It also seeks to become a leading company in attractive packaging that identifies Malawi as "The Warm Heart of Africa." The company's products will be sold to Malawians, tourists and exported to the international market. Zayane Creations will utilize a number locally processed eco-friendly materials in making products and packaging. 

MARKET

Our customers appreciate art, high quality, creativity, durability and have a heart for people.

Zayane Creations has the following market segmentation:

Special Events

Special events makes up 66% of our target market. The special events include birthday parties, Christmas celebrations, anniversaries celebrations, graduations, engagement and wedding parties and bridal showers.  Women aged 25 to 45 years is the company's main target group.

Export

We intend to export 9% of our products to foreign markets in America and Europe. Discussions to establish markets are in the pipeline. 

Tourists and Expatriates

They comprise 25% of our target market. They love eco-friendly jewelry. They buy it on impulse for themselves and as gifts and souvenirs for themselves and others. 

PROMOTIONS

Zayane Creations has different ways of reaching its target market. The remaining months in Uganda are being used for researching ways of how to better approach customers, discover what is trendy on the market in our industry and how to customize our products to our customers satisfaction.           

The company will run different ads online; website & Facebook and in our local Newspapers to let people know what is new on the market. Zayane Creations will also put fliers in all the popular and strategic sites in Malawi. The fliers will have all the necessary information about the company. Word of mouth will also be utilized in our marketing campaign. The company will ensure that custom made, premium quality products are being made to establish customer loyalty and be attractive to new customers. 

What We Need & What You Get

Zayane Creations will need an investment of $24,000 broken down as follows:

Procurement of materials and tools                                                  $ 12,210

Office equipment                                                                                            2,565

Website development                                                                                       140

Marketing and Distribution                                                                         2,000

Training                                                                                                              3,295

Workshop setup                                                                                              1,890

Licenses/taxes and other documentation                                               600

Administration                                                                                                 1,300

Total                                                                                              $ 24,000

If we do not reach our entire goal to raise $24,000, we will still launch our company, scale down our product line and employ fewer women as funds permit. We will continue to raise funds while building up the business to reach our desired goal.

If we get more than our desired goal, we will be able to procure more tools and materials thereby employing more women. We will also develop a training facility to accommodate more employment and production. In 5 years we intend to give part of ownership of the company to some of the vulnerable women to empower them more.

DONATION        PERK

  • $5                    Thank you
  • $20                  1 pair of earrings
  • $50                  1 bracelet
  • $100                1 bracelet and set of earrings
  • $200                1 necklace and set of earrings
  • $500                1 necklace, 1 set of earrings, 1 bracelet
  • $1,000             1 necklace, 1 set of earrings, 1 bracelet, 1 hair clip
  • $2,000             1 jewelry set (1 necklace, 1 set of earrings, 1 bracelet, 1 hair clip), 1 clutch bag
  • $3,000             Jewelry box and clutch bag
  • $5,000             Jewelry box, jewelry set and clutch bag

Each perk listed will have a likely shipping date attached. We have placed these dates fairly into the future to make them reasonable, and we believe that in most cases we will be able to beat those estimates. In the unlikely event of any delays, we will be certain to notify you at least one week before the end of that month.

It is said: "a woman with a vision empowers an empire of women to do more, see more and be more.” Through your contribution, we will mitigate the tragedy that vulnerable women are facing in Malawi. They will regain their lost dignity and have income to take care of themselves and families. You will also help them to be given opportunity to hear the Gospel of our Lord Jesus Christ and to be discipled. Ultimately, families and communities in Malawi, the Warm Heart of Africa and the world will become will be more empowered holistically through one product, one woman at a time.

Track Record

The directorship of Zayane Creations consists of three Malawian nationals. We come with an abundance of experience in different areas.

The Managing Director, Sam, has served for 21 years in Christian ministry; held key leadership positions; managed major local and international projects and is a board member to three reputable organizations. He holds a Bachelors degree in Biblical Studies and Mass Communication and an advanced diploma in Telecommunications Technology. He and his wife, Eunice, also managed a successful pre-school for 6 years. Currently, he is an adjunct lecturer in Christian Ministry at African Bible University in Uganda and at Bible College Berea in Blantyre, Malawi.

Eunice, the Operations and Human Resources Director is multi-skilled in jewelry making and other products. She has served disadvantaged women for the past 17 years and seen positive transformation in their lives. She has also worked in various local and international jobs for 22 years such as project and human resource management, administration, lecturing and managing street children. She hosts a number of radio and TV programs that focus on women and youth. She has also won various awards related to her skills. She is inspired by her own abuse story to make a difference in the lives of other women. Eunice holds a Bachelor’s degree in Social Science. Currently, she is working at African Business Institute (ABI) in Uganda as Administration Manager.

The Finance and Marketing Director, Evelyn Kachule comes to the team with a Bachelor of Arts degree in Communications and three years job experience as Finance and Administration Manager. She is also experienced in jewelry and bag making. Currently, she is working as an Online and Marketing Manager at ABI in Uganda.

We are currently pursuing a Post-graduate course in Business Administration at ABI in Uganda. Our combined skills and experiences will be particularly relevant to Zayane Creations. These will be fully utilized to relate with and equip vulnerable women to lead better lives and the company succeed to the glory of God and to the good of the communities.

The Zayane Creation team includes the following advisors and consultants:

  • Deus Byebiroha, Consultant
  • Wilson Okot, Consultant.
  • Marcelo Vieira, (African Business Institute Director), Advisor.
  • Jun Shiomitsu, (African Business Institute President), Advisor.

Within our limited time as students at ABI, we have tested our business model and skills through production and selling of products; to customers from Uganda, Malawi and 3 other countries.  During this testing phase Zayane Creations achieved tangible results from micro scales.  A shop at a nearby upmarket shopping mall has purchased and is selling Zayane Creations' products. The company has 17 pending orders from customers from USA, Brazil, Japan, Netherlands, Uganda and Malawi.

Risks & Challenges

We are aware that in life unexpected things; risks and challenges are inevitable. Zayane Creations will do everything in our power to ensure that we execute our business plan without being sidetracked by risks or challenges that may arise. As a team we are determined to face challenges head on and with the greatest transparency. We anticipate risks and challenges such as:

  • New entrants - Zayane Creations will develop customer royalty and retention through maintenance of production of high quality, custom made products and appropriate customer care. The company will engage in continual research to maintain product innovation and relevance. 
  • Training of vulnerable women taking longer than planned. - Professional trainers will be engaged to have minimal training period and start production with the women by February 2018.
  • Market penetration taking longer. - Zayane will market its products aggressively on line through our website; by word of mouth; partnering with relevant stakeholders; fliers’ distribution; selling at tourist destinations and exporting to foreign markets.

Zayane Creations have already been successfully producing and selling products at a micro scale and competing favorably in the saturated Ugandan market. There is scarcity, therefore high demand of the company's products in Malawi because it is an un-penetrated market. The forecast for Zayane Creations product demand is favorable.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute financially, but want to support this campaign, here are a couple of ways to do so:

·         Use the "share" option here on this page to spread word of our campaign.

·         You can pray for the campaign and for the successful implementation of Zayane   Creations.

Thank you for believing in Zayane Creations; supporting this work transforms lives of women one product at a time.

In 5 years we intend to give part of ownership of the company to some of the vulnerable women to empower them more.DONATION        PERK
$5                    Thank you
$20                  1 pair of earrings
$50                  1 bracelet
$100                1 bracelet and set of earrings
$200                1 necklace and set of earrings
$500                1 necklace, 1 set of earrings, 1 bracelet
$1,000             1 necklace, 1 set of earrings, 1 bracelet, 1 hair clip
$2,000             1 jewelry set (1 necklace, 1 set of earrings, 1 bracelet, 1 hair clip), 1 clutch bag
$3,000             Jewelry box and clutch bag
$5,000             Jewelry box, jewelry set and clutch bag
Each perk listed will have a likely shipping date attached. We have placed these dates fairly into the future to make them reasonable, and we believe that in most cases we will be able to beat those estimates. In the unlikely event of any delays, we will be certain to notify you at least one week before the end of that month.It is said: "a woman with a vision empowers an empire of women to do more, see more and be more.” Through your contribution, we will mitigate the tragedy that vulnerable women are facing in Malawi. They will regain their lost dignity and have income to take care of themselves and families. You will also help them to be given opportunity to hear the Gospel of our Lord Jesus Christ and to be discipled. Ultimately, families and communities in Malawi, the Warm Heart of Africa and the world will become will be more empowered holistically through one product, one woman at a time.Track RecordThe directorship of Zayane Creations consists of three Malawian nationals. We come with an abundance of experience in different areas.The Managing Director, Sam, has served for 21 years in Christian ministry; held key leadership positions; managed major local and international projects and is a board member to three reputable organizations. He holds a Bachelors degree in Biblical Studies and Mass Communication and an advanced diploma in Telecommunications Technology. He and his wife, Eunice, also managed a successful pre-school for 6 years. Currently, he is an adjunct lecturer in Christian Ministry at African Bible University in Uganda and at Bible College Berea in Blantyre, Malawi.Eunice, the Operations and Human Resources Director is multi-skilled in jewelry making and other products. She has served disadvantaged women for the past 17 years and seen positive transformation in their lives. She has also worked in various local and international jobs for 22 years such as project and human resource management, administration, lecturing and managing street children. She hosts a number of radio and TV programs that focus on women and youth. She has also won various awards related to her skills. She is inspired by her own abuse story to make a difference in the lives of other women. Eunice holds a Bachelor’s degree in Social Science. Currently, she is working at African Business Institute (ABI) in Uganda as Administration Manager.The Finance and Marketing Director, Evelyn Kachule comes to the team with a Bachelor of Arts degree in Communications and three years job experience as Finance and Administration Manager. She is also experienced in jewelry and bag making. Currently, she is working as an Online and Marketing Manager at ABI in Uganda.We are currently pursuing a Post-graduate course in Business Administration at ABI in Uganda. Our combined skills and experiences will be particularly relevant to Zayane Creations. These will be fully utilized to relate with and equip vulnerable women to lead better lives and the company succeed to the glory of God and to the good of the communities.The Zayane Creation team includes the following advisors and consultants:
Deus Byebiroha, Consultant
Wilson Okot, Consultant.
Marcelo Vieira, (African Business Institute Director), Advisor.
Jun Shiomitsu, (African Business Institute President), Advisor.
Within our limited time as students at ABI, we have tested our business model and skills through production and selling of products; to customers from Uganda, Malawi and 3 other countries.  During this testing phase Zayane Creations achieved tangible results from micro scales.  A shop at a nearby upmarket shopping mall has purchased and is selling Zayane Creations' products. The company has 17 pending orders from customers from USA, Brazil, Japan, Netherlands, Uganda and Malawi.Risks & ChallengesWe are aware that in life unexpected things; risks and challenges are inevitable. Zayane Creations will do everything in our power to ensure that we execute our business plan without being sidetracked by risks or challenges that may arise. As a team we are determined to face challenges head on and with the greatest transparency. We anticipate risks and challenges such as:

New entrants - Zayane Creations will develop customer royalty and retention through maintenance of production of high quality, custom made products and appropriate customer care. The company will engage in continual research to maintain product innovation and relevance. 

Training of vulnerable women taking longer than planned. - Professional trainers will be engaged to have minimal training period and start production with the women by February 2018.

Market penetration taking longer. - Zayane will market its products aggressively on line through our website; by word of mouth; partnering with relevant stakeholders; fliers’ distribution; selling at tourist destinations and exporting to foreign markets.
Zayane Creations have already been successfully producing and selling products at a micro scale and competing favorably in the saturated Ugandan market. There is scarcity, therefore high demand of the company's products in Malawi because it is an un-penetrated market. The forecast for Zayane Creations product demand is favorable.Other Ways You Can HelpIf you cannot contribute financially, but want to support this campaign, here are a couple of ways to do so:·         Use the "share" option here on this page to spread word of our campaign.·         You can pray for the campaign and for the successful implementation of Zayane   Creations.Thank you for believing in Zayane Creations; supporting this work transforms lives of women one product at a time.

story:
Who and Why?

The soil-slinging crew from Compostwheels and frozen treat-making team from King of Pops have joined forces to fight the food waste revolution with an epic community composting effort called King of Compost. Together we aim to turn thousands of tons of landfill-destined food waste into finished compost every year - an amendment our local farms and gardens need to grow the best food possible.

It may seem small, but we're confident this change will not only improve the vitality of our soil and strengthen our local food system but build healthier, stronger communities as well - in an impactful and measurable way.

85% of food waste occurs downstream at consumer-facing homes and businesses. Atlanta alone wastes thousands of tons of food each year and lacks the composting infrastructure that many other cities have put into place to reclaim these valuable nutrients we need to strengthen our soil and grow good food.  

Together we're going to build it from the ground up - literally. And help increase the production of real, good food and healthy communities. Let’s grow better compost together!

What the heck is a "windrow turner"?

Now that you are inspired, you must be wondering where exactly your money is going. The windrow turner is front and center. This piece of equipment will help us compost more efficiently and produce a better product for local farms and gardens. It essentially turns the big compost piles and is propelled by the tractor. In order to leverage this awesome machine, we need to prep our site at King of Crops, get a tractor, and also make sure the finished compost is well sifted.

Here’s the break out:

Windrow turner (you’re going to want to see this transformer-esque machine in action): $50,000

Site prep: $10,000

Tractor (can’t do a proper hay ride without it): $30,000

Sifter (wait until you hold a handful of sifted finished compost): $30,000

The Impact

We believe with this equipment we can turn 2,400 tons of food waste into beautiful, nutrient rich compost annually. That's enough compost to supply many of the Atlanta area farms, community and neighborhood gardens, education gardens, and home gardens in Atlanta. Just picture all of the happy plants and people. To see the impact up close and personal, join us in celebrating the soil at the 2018 Soil Festival hosted by our incredible partners at Food Well Alliance. Don’t worry, we will send a reminder, as the event gets closer. Probably the coolest way to see the impact is to pick up one of the bags of compost at the Soil Festival and plant a thing or two in it. You will then experience the pure magic of growing your plants in compost.

Risks & Challenges

A big risk and challenge is if we don’t raise enough money. Without the funding to purchase this essential equipment to scale our operation, we won't be able to handle the overwhelming volume of food waste our city throws out each year. So……help us knock this out of the park so we can get turning.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this with your friends on social media. Go to your local farmers market. Or eat at a local restaurant. There you will see what is possible with healthy soil. Together we can grow better compost.

What is Compostwheels

Check out their website here to learn more. 

 

What is King of Pops

Check out their website here to learn more. Or watch the video below.

story:
Short Summary..

In 2016, GalleryRetail, a prosocial creative service agency, created the Newark First Fridays concept and engaged Newark Arts for promotional assistance, the host of Newark’s longest running arts festival, Open Doors, to bring to fruition a regular renowned art, music, food and cultural community event in the Newark area. (GalleryRetail aims to become a bcorp this year.)

Newark First Fridays is an all inclusive, safe and vital community-driven platform to showcase emerging artists, makers, artisan food vendors, musicians, and many uniquely talented street performers and vendors. There are no regular flea markets like Brooklyn, nor festivals throughout the year like New Orleans; Newark needs to both activate the streets and properly present all its talents and offerings, regularly.

On the first Friday of each month a downtown artwalk will host dozens of artisan food and art & crafts vendors, street performances (amplified and non), and workshops, while highlighting the local businesses, galleries, and creative spaces that will open their doors during these evenings.

We strive to be a premier arts experience as the epicenter for the community and guests to come together to celebrate, sustain & support the arts. Each month we aim to attract thousands to Newark to see and explore the city while seeking to incubate and support hundreds of artists and small businesses each year.

What We Need & What You Get

We need a minimum of $20,000 ; and as we all know, with more funds you can host a cooler party.

With the funds raised, it will be allocated as follows:

  • Artist Compensation + Workshops 16%
  • Event Support 17%
  • Safety + Security 20%
  • Maintenance 1%
  • Event Day Services 12%
  • Stage + Sound 7%
  • Permits + Admin 16%
  • Marketing 11%

By the Perks

If we do not reach our goal we will keep the show going with the funds we did raise and tailor the experience to still host a monthly artwalk. If needed, reduce the number of first Fridays during this inaugural year to properly plan for 2018.

The Impact

Supporting Newark First Fridays = Supporting Newark

Newark First Fridays seeks to bring needed business and exposure to Newark as a complete city. Business creation, transforming underutilized streets, hyper local business marketing, and documentation of our impact are essential services we seek to provide.

Expected Monthly Stats

  • Thousands of event attendees (2K-5K)
  • 5+ Music Acts
  • 50+ Artisan Food, Arts & Crafts vendors
  • 20+ special events in the area
  • 5+ non-profits
  • 30+ restaurants & bars impacted

This is not only essential to the growth of the city and community but a true passion of ours and crux of our work.

As the Outreach and Administrative Director for Newark Celebration 350 (NC350), a year long celebration of Newark's founding, it was my responsibility to develop and implement a plan to evaluate the effectiveness of the NC350 programming. I also served as lead to enhance NC350's relationship with arts and community organizations, government, social service agencies, businesses, interest groups, and the general public: including over 250 program presenters, 50+ volunteers, and press. 

Newark Arts was founded in 1981 to advance and expand the artistic and cultural resources of the City of Newark, New Jersey. Starting 2001, Open Doors Citywide Arts Festival is New Jersey's largest multi-day celebration of the visual and performing arts, occurring over four days in the great city of Newark. Now in its 15th year, the festival draws thousands of visitors, as more than 40 venues join forces to showcase visual, performing, and literary art.

Until then check out Oakland or Philly’s renditions, even Raleigh has first Fridays.

Risks & Challenges

RISKS

The key risks are:

  • not reaching our financial goal
  • attracting and coordinating a large number of artists/creative spaces and small businesses to sustain the experience
  • need for public-private partnerships

How we'll overcome this: As a native Newarker, former public servant with the City of Newark, experience with Newark Celebration 350, and artist-entrepreneur, I understand the city's ecosystem and how best to leverage resources to deliver effective programming. Newark Arts has a long track record in engaging government and foundation partnerships to provide an array of programs and engage artists across many media. 

Most importantly, with the inclusion of the community we will have your support to adjust the Newark First Fridays experience to our need and grow it to collaboratively. Via regular surveys and community feedback sessions we will heed comments of all stakeholders and have methods to express areas of need to stakeholders.

Other Ways You Can Help

We need collaboration and your support, talent or dollars, to bring this experience to fruition.

Can't contribute $, there are other ways to help make this happen:

  • Volunteer. We dozens of volunteers to work our monthly festival. Help us greet people, manage our street stages, and set up and break down. The best food, a lot of fun, and new friends provided!

  • Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram, then invite all your friends, family, and fellow -ists to do the same.

  • Share, share, share this campaign. Anyone in the Tri-State (and beyond, EWR is International) !

story:
Short Summary

How do food trucks, fathers and city transformation converge?  Read on!

Vocation is the place where our deep gladness meets the world's deep need.

- Frederick Buechner

Alastair Rundle's deep gladness is being a father figure to fatherless children and young adults.  Over the last two decades he’s been able to live out this vocation in inner-city Los Angeles and Houston with his wife and two children.  Alastair has consistently mentored many children and youth by enfolding them into his family life, equipping them in healthy relationships, listening and counseling them through family crises, helping with homework, training them in simple entrepreneurship and encouraging them to realize their dreams.

But it’s not enough.  The need is urgent.  Consider this:

Currently one quarter, or 17 million*, American children are growing up in homes without their biological father.  This reality is devastating our cities as these children account for:

  • The majority of incarcerated youth*
  • 63% of youth suicides*
  • 70% of teenage pregnancies*
  • 71% of high school drop outs*
  • 85% of children with behavioral disorders*
  • 90% of homeless and runaway children*
  • 4 times more likely to be raised in poverty*

In 2009 Alastair received a brutal stem-cell transplant to cure him of cancer.  While some died from this treatment, Alastair experienced a sort of resurrection as the medical community and the powerful presence of a loving God raised him to life.  During this year he heard God whispering to him:

What I’ve done in you, I want to do in cities.

Fatherlessness is a cancer in our cities, and God, as the loving Father, wants to resurrect our cities by healing this cancer.  He began to give Alastair a vision to do this:

A movement of food trucks called Vida (meaning: Life) as an incubator to heal and apprentice fatherless youth.  By working alongside them as a father-figure, Alastair will equip them to become father-figures and entrepreneurs in their own community.

The first truck will be launched by Alastair in Redding, CA, where he now lives, but as these restored young adults are equipped and catch the vision, they will start the second, third, and fourth restorative Vida trucks in other cities. 

As a two part hospitality suite the Vida trailer will serve a menu oriented around delicious superfood pancakes.  Alastair designed these as a simple, familiar food to restore health to customers.  The Vida truck (TM) will be outfitted as a multi-purpose mobile hospitality room and will partner with local businesses that will use this space in creative, context-specific ways.  (For example: barber shop, medical clinic, mobile library, children’s education space etc.)

Vida will become know as a catalyst of hope within our cities and as an agent of restoration.

Vida: Restoring food, restoring people, restoring cities.

What We Need & What You Get

The Vida Truck (TM) is already under construction.  In order to complete it and launch as a successful business, we need to raise $45,000.  The breakdown looks like this:

What if…?

If this goal is exceeded the extra will go towards paying off the original loan that got the Vida Truck (TM) this far.  Anything above that will be seed money to generate a movement of Vida trucks.

If this goal is not reached a loan will be taken out to make up the difference.

Risks & Challenges

I have completed numerous projects that required considerable risk, but this is my first time creating a business.  Previous projects have succeeded because of perseverance and because I led/was part of a team or because I built a synergistic partnership with a group that provided complimentary skills.  These groups helped to provide momentum. 

These past experiences included:

  • Beating cancer twice.  My team included my family, local church and excellent health care professionals.
  • Creating an urban garden in an overcrowded neighborhood in inner city Los Angeles by partnering with the Los Angeles Neighborhood Land Trust. (https://www.yelp.com/biz/unidad-park-los-angeles)
  • Working with a constellation of mentors to bring about academic success in numerous urban youth.  One of them has gone on to become an ambassador for the United States to Armenia!
  • Building a community center to empower youth in a poor Houston neighborhood by partnering with a local church.
  • Being part of a team that planted two inner city churches.
  • Leading a team of inner city missionaries that brought transformation to multiple families in one of the worst neighborhoods of Los Angeles. (http://www.innerchange.org/team/losangeles.html)

Obstacles within these projects and events were overcome by perseverance and finding the right people to help.  I have found this quote from Goethe to be true:

Until one is committed, there is hesitancy, the chance to draw back — concerning all acts of initiative (and creation), there is one elementary truth that ignorance of which kills countless ideas and splendid plans:  That the moment one definitely commits oneself, then Providence moves too.  All sorts of things occur to help one that would never otherwise have occurred.  A whole stream of events issues from the decision, raising in one’s favor all manner of unforeseen incidents and meetings and material assistance, which no man could have dreamed would have come his way.  Whatever you can do, or dream you can do, begin it.  Boldness has genius, power, and magic in it. Begin it now.

I am committed and I have begun, and I am finding that local entrepreneurs are available to encourage and guide me, local contractors are volunteering their time and skills to help build the Vida truck, and now there’s an opportunity for you to lend your strength to this project, too!

How Can You Help?

By giving.

By getting the word out through your social media networks.  (Remember to use the Indiegogo share tool.)

 

* (Sources: U.S. Census Bureau – Table C2. Household Relationship and Living Arrangements of Children Under 18 Years, by Age and Sex: 2014;  http://www.politifact.com/truth-o-meter/stateme...; National Center for Fathering; National Principals Association Report on State of High Schools, Center for Disease Control, U.S. Dept of Health and Human Services.)

Being part of a team that planted two inner city churches.
Leading a team of inner city missionaries that brought transformation to multiple families in one of the worst neighborhoods of Los Angeles. (http://www.innerchange.org/team/losangeles.html)
Obstacles within these projects and events were overcome by perseverance and finding the right people to help.  I have found this quote from Goethe to be true:Until one is committed, there is hesitancy, the chance to draw back — concerning all acts of initiative (and creation), there is one elementary truth that ignorance of which kills countless ideas and splendid plans:  That the moment one definitely commits oneself, then Providence moves too.  All sorts of things occur to help one that would never otherwise have occurred.  A whole stream of events issues from the decision, raising in one’s favor all manner of unforeseen incidents and meetings and material assistance, which no man could have dreamed would have come his way.  Whatever you can do, or dream you can do, begin it.  Boldness has genius, power, and magic in it. Begin it now.I am committed and I have begun, and I am finding that local entrepreneurs are available to encourage and guide me, local contractors are volunteering their time and skills to help build the Vida truck, and now there’s an opportunity for you to lend your strength to this project, too!How Can You Help?By giving.By getting the word out through your social media networks.  (Remember to use the Indiegogo share tool.) * (Sources: U.S. Census Bureau – Table C2. Household Relationship and Living Arrangements of Children Under 18 Years, by Age and Sex: 2014;  http://www.politifact.com/truth-o-meter/stateme...; National Center for Fathering; National Principals Association Report on State of High Schools, Center for Disease Control, U.S. Dept of Health and Human Services.)

story:
Let's start from the beginning 

Vulva is part of NUWA, a Peruvian Association that works with women who belong to low-income households in Peru. Nuwa's mission is to improve their economic income and boost their personal development to reassure them as agents of social change in their lives and their communities.

 

Let us tell you about the product 

 

Why vulva?

Our brand is the result of a introspective look into what does it mean to be feminine in a traditional setting as Peru. Here, underwear brands for women that are available have a very strong personality, classifying women into two categories: the sexy one, who loves lace on everything, or the boring one, who wears granny panties. And as we know, there are so many more types of women; like you, like me or your girlfriends.

 


So where does that leave us?

The ones that don’t want to wear push-ups or the ones that don’t want to adapt our bodies into molds that clearly haven’t thought about our real bodies. Well, we’re the ones looking for a new proposal that will makes us feel comfortable in our own skin.

 

What do we mean by comfortable?

Underwear that will fit in just right in every size and body;  no matter how curvy or thin you are, Vulva will make you fall in love with you again on a daily basis.

And how? With cotton underwear, that will makes us feel much freer than ever!

 

Ps. Don't mind about the color, those are our prototypes. We'll bring so much more attitude with our designs; we'll keep you posted on that, too.

And now about the girls who will turn their lifes around

 

Why women from prison?

Because we believe growing up and learning from our mistakes (and because believing in second chances it’s so cliché). The Virgin of Fatima prison is not like a regular penitentiary facility. It’s actually a place for women who have committed minor crimes, with short sentences and, that above all, want to learn and overcome their current situation.

 

These women, despite being held in Virgen de Fátima penitentiary; are not deprived of learning new things. Vulva exists for them, as an opportunity to develop skills and to turn them into a product that will contribute to the lives of many more women.

Your impact

By contributing to Vulva Underwear you’ll change the lives of these women and ours. A day of work with Vulva for them will mean: an opportunity to learn and grow and continuous income to help themselves, their families and to save up for the future.

Your contribution will allow us to set up our workshop in Virgen de Fátima and also  carry out other workshops that will help the women improve their social and artistic skills such as  painting, music, reading and management that will be helpful in their reinsertion process and to prevent them from making the same mistakes from before. You’ll be changing their life path for good.

 

Get in(v)olved

We’d love to get in touch with you or  anyone you think can help us or would be interested in working with us. Don’t forget to:

  • Send to share with them this campaign 
  • And reach out to us at nuwaproyectos@gmail.com 
 

Hope to hear from you soon!

And thanks for taking part in this adventure with us!

story:
Short Summary

43.4% of the total land area of Liberia is covered with rainforest from which about 30 million dollars worth of timber is exported annually to Europe and China. Yet, more than 60% of wooden furniture used by the working class citizens, business owners, hospitals, NGOs, and the government in Liberia are imported at high cost. This creates a huge gap in the furniture industry in Liberia.

The LACK OF EQUIPMENT (especially kilns) to efficiently produce kiln-dried, quality, standardized and customized furniture is the cause of this lopsided import/export gap. The need to remove this obstacle is our greatest goal as we run this campaign.  

We are citizens of Liberia who grew up in our country going through the 14 years of civil crisis. Now we are on the stage to improve the lifestyle of our citizens and grow our economy. Mr. Chris Mendin (CEO) was raised by an unemployed single mother which delayed his education. At 14 years of age, he was taken to a woodwork shop to acquire carpentry skills and later enrolled at a vocational school where he studied General Construction with an emphasis in woodwork. This knowledge supported Mr. Mendin to complete secondary education and get a college degree. Chris has worked on various projects with national and international organizations such as Serving in Mission (SIM), Samaritan's Purse, and the African Bible College University in Liberia. Chris is working with six additional team members. Five of whom  are well skilled carpenters while one is skilled in computer knowledge such as designing, building database, and online services. Chris has decided to use his skills and the rest of the team to build this company and train youth in Liberia for self-sustainability.  

Your support to this campaign coupled with our skills, we all transform the furniture industry and train youth for self-sustainability in Liberia. Join us to bring great transformation in Liberia and be a part of training youth for self-sustainability.   

 

What We Need 

We need $40,000 USD to start Diligent Hands Furniture. About 83.6% of this amount is to be used for purchasing equipment; and the balance 16.4% will be used to cover insurance, construction of production site, and begin our operation. However, we seek to raise $25,000 USD through this campaign and the rest ($10,000 USD) will be raised from external investor.  

List of Equipment

Item                                           Qty                      Price 

Kiln                                                1                  $4,000.00

Table saw                                     2                 $4,590.00

Drum sanders                              1                 $2,095.00

Bandsaw                                       1                  $1,175.00

 Power planer                               1                  $3,000.00

chop saws                                     2                  $1,000.00

Router                                            1                   $260.00

Dust collector                              1                    $1,500.00

Wood Mortising                          1                    $2,000.00

Wood Jointer                               1                  $2,400.00

Drill press                                     2                  $400.00

Silent Generator 25Kva           1                   $10,000.00

Desktop Computer                   2                    $400.00

                                                           

Where the funds go if we don't reach our entire goal.

Focusing on our primary target, we will use the funds for purchasing some of our most important machineries such as a kiln, table saw, power planer, and wood jointer. Indeed, it be will be challenging, but we will surely begin with what we can raise and with the equipment we can purchase.

The Impact

The success of our campaign will impact citizens of Liberia in the following  areas.

We are seeking to solve the long standing problem of Liberians struggling to purchase imported furniture with high cost regardless of  the available resource in our country.

Most importantly, we are on the way to facilitating skill training for at-risk youth to promote self-sustainability. Your support to this campaign copule with our skills, we build Liberia together and train youth for self-sustainability. 

Risks & Challenges

 With our skills  and knowledge, we still anticipate challenges with legal process, setting up equipment, and capturing the minds of our customers. However, Diligent Hands was registered and has been operated as contracting company for the past three years. Moreover, we are presently negotiating for production as we relocate our company to the capital. Regarding our target market, we have worked in the past three years for residential owners, profitable and non-profitable organizations as mentioned in our personal story. With such record, we presently have pending contract. Therefore, we anticipate these challenges, but we are prepared and working to overcome them. Please let us know of concerns you might have because they will be useful to us in our preparation. Thank you for your support.

Other Ways You Can Help

We highly appreciate your time and interest in reading our story. If you are unable to contribute financially for any reason, donate any equipment on our list. Please also share our story with friends, family, workmates who can help, or share on social media. If not, pray with us and make comments.

story:
Créez votre business avec iceRoll, le nouveau concept de crème glacée.
Un concept complet avec tout ce dont vous avez besoin pour réussir.
Lancez votre activité et réalisez vos glaces sur notre plaque à -30°!

 

C’est lors d’un voyage en Thaïlande que nous avons découvert la préparation des aliments sur plaque réfrigérée. De retour en France, nous avons décidé de partir de zéro pour développer notre propre machine pour réaliser des glaces gourmandes et 100% naturelles !

 

 

 

Nos trois ans d’expérience et d’utilisation du stand en boutique et en événementiel nous ont permis de développer des outils adaptés à ce nouveau procédé de fabrication. Nous avons pensé à tous les détails nécessaires pour optimiser l’expérience iceRoll et vous permettre une rentabilité optimale. Avec tous ces outils, vous réaliserez une glace en 45 secondes (temps d’encaissement compris). 

 

 

Rejoignez la Family et accédez à tous les outils sur la plateforme myiceRoll. Ce qui est inclus dans la Family pour 250€/mois à partir de la réception du package stand et équipements :

— Les droits d’utilisation de la marque
— Des outils de communication & visuels
— Les recettes 
— La formation
— Une communication au niveau national
— Un réseau Family qui compte déjà 15 icerollers
— Tout le soutien d’une équipe jeune, cool et aux multiples compétences (vente, ingénierie, pâtisserie, design, graphisme, gestion de projet événementiel, marketing)

 

 

Vous aurez accès au e-shop exclusif pour commander vos pots, serviettes, cuillères, mix à glace et accessoires. C’est facile, centralisé et expédié sous 48h (France métropolitaine).

 

 

 

Une équipe jeune aux multiples compétences :  vente, ingénierie, pâtisserie, design, graphisme, gestion de projet événementiel & marketing.

story:
Short Summary

I’m Jane Yuen-Lin Mahowald, owner of Assure Quality Painting, the only minority-, woman-owned paint contracting company serving industrial and commercial markets in Minnesota and much of the upper Midwest.  I've spent almost 20 years in the paint industry as well as 8 years as Office Manager/Regional Trainer for a business serving 12 states, managing a staff of 75.

AQP is a young business created to help lift minorities and women out of the cycle of poverty.  Our business is a means of achieving that end.  We have 15 highly skilled employees, 13 of whom are minority and/or women.  We have been very successful thus far by working on important, highly visible projects, ranging from the US Bank Stadium housing the Minnesota Vikings football team to a new city water treatment plant and much more.   You can see many of the projects on our web site:   www.aqpainting.com   Initially we did not make much money because we were learning how to estimate large projects.  We also invested in obtaining every certification required to work on government projects from federal to local projects and employee training.  Now we have experience and are in a mentoring program to make sure our estimates include reasonable profit, we have skilled, professional employees, exceptional project management and all certifications.  We receive requests to bid on every government funded project and major private construction projects in Minnesota with several million dollars-worth in hand.

But we have a serious barrier to overcome.

We must fund equipment, materials and salaries for a minimum of 90 days - - for every job - - before we can submit any invoice for work done.  That continues throughout the course of the contract.  It means having lots of money up front before we can submit a bid.  Being a minority and women-owned company, we do not have access to funds from banks and other traditional resources like other businesses (a nationwide problem).  Funds have been exhausted getting the company running and training people to become skilled professionals.  So, we are trying something different: crowdfunding.

Your contributions will enable us to bid on some of these requests, demonstrate the capabilities  of our employees, perform high quality work and create sustainable cash flow. We also will expand our efforts beyond Minnesota.  Our goal is to train and hire 100 minorities/women within two years.  Every penny contributed to our Indiegogo campaign will go toward that effort.

Of course we appreciate and want to recognize everyone who helps us achieve this goal.  Here is how we will do it.

We will donate $1 to 1 of 3 women's empowerment causes for every contribution made, no matter how small.  You will also be recognized on our website.  Contributors of $30 or more will also receive a T shirt with an empowerment theme.  For $150 we'll add an insulated steel travel mug, and for $300, a Bluetooth selfie stick.  Everyone gets our undying gratitude.

Whether you can contribute to our success or not, please, please tell everyone you know about our campaign who believes in helping minorities and women rise from the cycle of impoverishment and attitudes of worthlessness. 

Together we can take a small step forward by building confidence, creating skills, offering equitable jobs, reducing unemployment, shrinking the skills gap, helping rebuild and improve our infrastructure, empowering women and minorities, and most important, creating hope.

With determination and hope anything can be accomplished.  It will be a brighter future.

story:
WHY A MUSIC VENUE?

Hello fellow music lovers! My name is Brittany Crooms, Owner and Managing Director of Gypsy Rose Music. First, a little bit about myself. Sweet and simple, my happy place is dancing at a show. The outside world just fades away and I become fully and joyfully enmeshed in the present moment. It is truly my soul food, and I love to ride that beautiful post-show high for days! Music has the unique ability to transcend language, bridge multiple generations, cross boundaries & bring people together like nothing else. I wanted to create community where the music lovers and musical magicians UNITE, immerse themselves in the music and forget about the rest of the world for a while. I fully support the dreams and growth of musicians who are dedicated to crossing these boundaries, thereby enriching the community and culture in the city that I love; the community that has become family to me.

I have often craved somewhere in this wonderful community where my love of music can come to life. Roswell does not currently have a venue devoted specifically to original, live music… so the seed was planted. The more this plan grew, the more the community came together to support the idea, demonstrating a high demand for this type of establishment in our community. The support and positive feedback from roswell citizens and business owners has been overwhelming, not only on social media, but in person as well. The general consensus is that we can't open fast enough! 

It is also important to me that the team working together at GR feels like a family… all working toward a common goal, each passionate about music, musicians, our community unification and positive vibes!

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

Here's where we need your support! In order to enrich and unite our community through the art of music, we need to raise funds which will go directly towards necessary building renovations costing upwards of $150,000. The interior requires full renovation to optimise the music experience for both our patrons as well as our musicians. This includes custom stage and lighting, state of the art sound system, 24ft custom bar, new flooring, electrical, HVAC, sprinkler system, and additional insulation for optimal sound. On the exterior, we will build a new deck and landscaping for enjoying food, beverage and music outside. 

We are passionately committed to making this dream a reality for our incredible city. Our goal is to raise $100,000 from generous members like you, who share in our vision of bringing live music and amazing energy to this community. Your contributions are what will ultimately bring this vision to life!

When you contribute to Gypsy Rose Music, you will receive a variety of high value perks including but not limited to VIP access, FREE admission, HUGE discounts on venue rental for private events, Gypsy Rose gift cards, and of course, all kinds of fun swag! 

We, here at Gypsy Rose, embody the community spirit by serving local, craft beers, cross promoting and supporting businesses around us, hosting community events, workshops and being a place for musicians to come and practice on our off hours, all while operating in a way that has the least impact possible on the natural environment.

We are incredibly grateful for whatever amount you are able to contribute to making this dream a reality. If you are unable to support financially, please pass this along and help us spread the word. Thank you, your support so so greatly appreciated! The value this venue will bring to Roswell will be immeasurable.

"Music gives a soul to the universe, wings to the mind, flight to the imagination, and life to everything." - Plato

 

In Gratitude,

The Gypsy Rose Team
story_txt:
WHY A MUSIC VENUE?
Hello fellow music lovers! My name is Brittany Crooms, Owner and Managing Director of Gypsy Rose Music. First, a little bit about myself. Sweet and simple, my happy place is dancing at a show. The outside world just fades away and I become fully and joyfully enmeshed in the present moment. It is truly my soul food, and I love to ride that beautiful post-show high for days! Music has the unique ability to transcend language, bridge multiple generations, cross boundaries & bring people together like nothing else. I wanted to create community where the music lovers and musical magicians UNITE, immerse themselves in the music and forget about the rest of the world for a while. I fully support the dreams and growth of musicians who are dedicated to crossing these boundaries, thereby enriching the community and culture in the city that I love; the community that has become family to me.
I have often craved somewhere in this wonderful community where my love of music can come to life. Roswell does not currently have a venue devoted specifically to original, live music… so the seed was planted. The more this plan grew, the more the community came together to support the idea, demonstrating a high demand for this type of establishment in our community. The support and positive feedback from roswell citizens and business owners has been overwhelming, not only on social media, but in person as well. The general consensus is that we can't open fast enough!

story:
The Museum of Beer San Diego

Community. Pride. Passion. Collaboration. These are the elements we love most about San Diego brewing (other than the beer, of course!). And we want to celebrate and share San Diego's story with you and the rest of the world.

Museum of Beer will be downtown San Diego’s “Beer Welcome Center,” the central hub and first stop that everyone comes to when they want to begin the ultimate hands-on San Diego beer journey.

Museum of Beer will provide an inspiring and exciting experience for every kind of guest—from the longtime craft expert to the novice who’s never tasted a craft beer. 

Museum of Beer will support San Diego’s vibrant beer community. We will feature exhibits and technology that promote the San Diego Brewers Guild and will drive business to all of our local independent breweries. 

Museum of Beer San Diego will be made up of eight core exhibits that represent the most important and engaging topics related to beer and San Diego craft beer. Each major exhibit will be supplemented by a variety of supporting exhibits and experiences, all designed to maximize guest interaction, immersion, and enjoyment.

Exhibits will include: The Science of Beer • The Beer Universe • America’s Hoppiest City: The Story of San Diego’s Craft Beer History • Be the Brewer Experience • Getting Beer to You • The Art of Craft: From Can to Canvas • The Sun, Surf, and Beer! San Diego Experience • Beer for Breakfast with 91X Media Center

The Museum of Beer will also include: A full Tasting Room with 65 exclusively San Diego taps; an artisanal pizza kitchen; an unparalleled bottle list featuring rare and limited release bottles; a barrel-aged experience; a killer Merch Tank;  a private event space; and an outdoor Beer Garden with a stage and live music.

The Goal 

We’re asking for your support to build a 10,000+-square-foot venue that will be the downtown jewel of San Diego’s craft beer scene. The crowd-sourcing goal of $150,000 is only a small portion of the overall budget, but it's one of the most important components of our project. From the beginning, our mantra has been that the museum is going to be "Built by Craft Beer Lovers for Craft Beer Lovers," and we need your help to fulfill that mission!

Your contribution will go to physical construction of the venue and exhibits, educational operations, bar/restaurant infrastructure, stage/sound and lights, a VW Bus promotional vehicle, graphic artwork, marketing, and—most importantly—the small 3-barrel brew system we will use for collaborations and demonstrations on how to brew beer like a pro.  

Help us build a place that celebrates the craft!  Let's build the Museum of Beer!

 

Team Museum 

Anthony & Molly Ridenhour and Mike & Christine Kociela are longtime friends, co-workers, and the founders of Museum of Beer San Diego.  Combined, they have decades of experience in the fields of museum construction and administration, venue management, promotions, and entertainment production.  The museum's Curator of Craft, Bruce Glassman, is a longtime San Diego beer writer and industry expert who brings many years of content creation and communications experience to the mix.

Please let your friends and family know about this campaign!  

Visit our website: www.museumofbeer.com

Like us on Instagram @museumofbeer, and share this campaign on Facebook.

There are quick and easy Indiegogo share tools for your convenience right here on this page as well!

Thank you sooooo much for taking the time to learn about the Museum of Beer San Diego. We look forward to seeing you there!

Hoppy People Unite!

Cheers,

Twon, Molly, Mike, Christine, and Bruce  :)

 

CHECK OUT THE AWESOME PRESS WE HAVE BEEN GETTING!

NBC NEWS

FOX 5

10 NEWS

TRAVEL + LEISURE

SAN DIEGO MAGAZINE

PACIFIC SAN DIEGO

WEST COASTER

SANDIEGOVILLE

SAN DIEGO UNION TRIBUNE

SAN DIEGO BUSINESS JOURNAL

TIMES OF SAN DIEGO

story:
Cafe, Bike Shop, Showroom

We are transforming the 4000 sq. ft. space in downtown Fairfax (formerly Fairfax Cyclery) into Splitrock Tap & Wheel! The SF Bay Areas newest destination bike shop.The new store will comprise of 3 main operations:

Showroom and demo center for Whyte Bikes, our exclusive brand from the UK, as well as a carefully selected assortment of parts and accessories from brands we know and trust.

Best in class service and repairs for all bikes

Cafe featuring pizzas, sandwiches, Beer, Wine and Coffee drinks.

We need your help to finish the kitchen so we can start the taps flowing!

Marin County is a challenging place to start a new business.  While we started with a good plan and a solid budget, we could never have anticipated quite the number of flaming hoops the different agencies here would make us jump through

Our building is solid, and reasonably modern, but adding the cafe to the space triggered a list of required upgrades, including upgrades to the sewer system, fire sprinkler system, and HVAC system

These additional requirements have delayed our opening by several months

All funds raised through this campaign will go directly into finishing the kitchen and the dining space, assuring we get open and serving you ASAP.

Your contribution is worth every penny, and more.

If you look at all of the tiers available in our fundraising campaign, you will see that in each case you will get perks in return that are at least as valuable as your investment, and in many cases much more than your contribution.  Basically our intent is to pre-sell food, drinks, service and store items so we can get across the line, and get the store open.

Your contribution will be instrumental in getting your new favorite place for food and drinks open, and will give you a reason to come down and meet friends.

Of course, not everyone can contribute

...and we understand, but you can still help.  Tell your friends about our project, tell them how cool it will be, share it on social media.

Thanks for checking in on our project!  See you in the shop soon ;)

story:
Hello everyone,

I'm Boris from Mauritius Island and after a brief trial in the “modern working world” I realise that it's not my cup of tea and I started to work for myself and I would describe me as an "artisanal entrepreneur". I'm part of a team working on the reborn of a bookshop in the center of the island. I have a small bistro just in front of the bookshop and now I'm half way on the project to open the natural ingredient grocery, bakery and pizzeria I ask you to contribute for.

Amandine, my wife is together with me in this project and also supports the rebuilt of the bookshop. 

In this place, people will be able to buy all the natural ingredients they need, pay for the ingredients and no more for the "packaging nor the branding" and only the amount they need.

We want also support local farmers which start organic permaculture bringing their products to customers and use it in the bakery and pizzeria. The aim is to propose good quality products at lower price and contribute to a greener planet. 

Imagine a place attracting you with the warmth of the atmosphere combining elegant rustic wooden furniture, green plants, the smell of the bread just baked and the fresh brewed coffee. Inside you discover a variety of bags and jars full of 100% natural products such as : rices, grains and nuts, spices, coffee beans, teas, herbs to infuse, olive oils, vinegars, natural shampoo and body wash, cleaners for the house, and lot of more products. A one stop shop offering a bakery corner with artisan breads, varieties of pastries, tarts, pies and Italian pizzas (with gluten free, paleo, dairy-free options) made with good quality ingredients directly taken from the bulk grocery.

We are half way from our objective and we need your contribution to achieve this project. Crowdfunding is unknown by the majority of people living in Mauritius and we think that it's a really nice concept to help to start small business or social campaign. We need you!!  ;-)  

What We Need & What You Get

We are half way to the opening, we already finance $ 25 000 with all our economy, and contribution of our family.

We have the location and we started to pay a rent since September 2017, we did all the work (renovation of the premise, plumbing, electricity, lighting system, wood recycling furniture, bought some jars and accessories) and it took a very long time as we were supposed to open in November 2017, we target with your help February 2018! 

We already bought some kitchen and bakery equipment (second hand small electric pizza oven, planetary mixer, fridge, freezer, built in gas stove and oven, some inox table, sink and a refrigerate show case).

We need help to buy:

  1. a small gas bread & pizza oven
  2. a second hand commercial convection oven 
  3. an extractor system
  4. a inox table top fridge
  5. a Spiral mixer
  6. a rolling mill machine 
  7. all small furniture : saucepan, etc.
  8. a warm showcase
  9. air conditioner for cold pastry kitchen
  10. awnings for shop front & logo signage
  11. racks and shelfs for storage and kitchen
  12. roller shutter for the windows security
  13. some chairs for sitting customers
  14. POS system
  15. Scale for weighting products
  16. water tank 5000L and filter for rain harvest system
  17. Jars and recipient for food display and storage
  18. The inital stock to start !

This list isn't exhaustive, there's so much hidden little things that we didn't consider. But we are motivated by our dream and each dollar will serve to bring this project alive. Small steps count! 

The Impact

We want to give to this place an heart and make people confortable to come and see that buying the essential could be an enjoyable thing at a right price. It's time to stop feeding the big industries, the big commercial center and we need to go back “earth to earth” and start participate with small steps to save our planet and our soul.

We think that being the first to do this in Mauritius will give other people the kick to do the same and make more people concern about this way of living, it’s also an opportunity to offer the already concern people an easier way make this change…

Risks & Challenges

The risk is that people are perhaps not ready to make this move, it will be easier for them to keep their habits and buy prepacked foods (or foods with lot of artificials as they don't really read or understand the ingredients on the package). 

To overcome this, we think that the best way is to communicate, using Facebook, our Web site, e-mailing, writing article in local newspapers, organise in this place around our big central table some workshop and projection on recycling, environment, permaculture and how to go green.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us making some noise about our campaign, sharing our Facebook page, using the indiegogo share tools & sending us good vibrations by air ;-)

Many many thanks for the time spend reading our story!!!

story:
Roam Playspace 

Roam Playspace is  an intentional indoor play space created for kids AND parents to have fun and to grow increasingly grounded, empowered, and free. While children play,  parents step into relaxation, community, and can choose to explore and grow their vision for parenthood and life— all in one space. Offerings include top notch toys,  a beautiful space, community tables for a picnic, and an innovative style of interactive opt-in workshop learning for parents. Roam Playspace is a space designed by a team of experts in discovery-based, child directed free play. It is also a place to find community and  be cheered on as a parent!

What We Need

By supporting Roam Playspace you are investing in:

  • an indoor play structure 
  • stations designed for open-ended play
  • innovative and developmental toys
  • unique, discovery based workshop series for parents and families
  • a space that addreses the needs of both children and parents in Shasta Co

 

The Impact: Addressing ACEs

In recent years, the concept of Adverse Childhood Experiences (ACEs) has been a hot topic when it comes to child development and the well-being of a community. Experiences like incarceration of a family member, mental illness or substance abuse in the home, and abuse of any kind have a direct impact on the life outcomes of the children who experience them.

The number of ACEs a child endures correlates directly to an increased risk of many diseases and causes of early death. Children in Shasta County experience more ACEs than most children in the state.

Shasta county has some of the highest ACE statistics in the state. Here are a few of the statistics

  • 17.1 % Have an incarcerated family member 
  • 29.7% Have witnessed domestic violence
  • 54.5 % Have experienced verbal abuse
  • 57.7 % Have experienced family substance abuse

The good news is that kids who experience these things CAN heal and have a bright future.  In addition to healing, studies have shown that there are some specific protective factors against the impact of ACEs in a community. 

Roam Playspace will directly address ACEs through the protective factors of: 

  • Social Connections: Roam will be a place where families can connect, create, and strengthen the social connections that are integral for strong families and communities 
  • Knowledge of parenting practices and childhood development: Opt- in workshops at Roam Playspace will come from a variety of community voices and focus on many aspects of parenting and development 
  • Social and emotional competence in children: Learning to interact with and navigate relationships to other children and adults is key to a child's development, and this happens naturally through open-ended play. 

About the Founders

Alan and Anna have been on the parenting journey for 5 years and on a personal level have seen the force of a parenting community,  the lifeline of experts to support during challenges, and the power of intentional play. 

Alan studied medicine with an emphasis on the low-income families of Appalachia. He has been a physician assistant for 8 years, and he especially enjoys connecting with kids in the ER. He has worked mostly in emergency medicine, with some of that time in the ER of a children's hospital.  He feels honored to be connected to a community of people addressing child development and ACEs in Redding.

Anna was trained as a life coach in 2007 and has been a practicing doula since 2013. She has developed materials that guide women in utilizing the experiences of pregnancy, birthing, postpartum, and early motherhood as a catalyst for their own personal and parenting growth.  Anna saw the power of play and movement in trauma recovery  using swim and art therapy with children who lost their parents in the 2004 tsunami. She leads an international team that resources people in emotional and physical wholeness.

Alan and Anna are consulting with a team of individuals who are incredible thinkers and practioners in the areas of play, the use of space, child development, parent resourcing, healing, and community needs.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We love consulting with experts in the fields of childhood development, fun, parenting, and child-directed play. We are also creating a line up of workshops with a variety of voices. Be in touch if you would like to be involved! 

Thank you to our amazing design team:

Photo Credit: Rebekah Troll

Video Credit: Nathan Pruzaniec / Pru & Drew Inc. 

Logo and Website Design: Eric Hurtgen
