In recent years, the concept of Adverse Childhood Experiences (ACEs) has been a hot topic when it comes to child development and the well-being of a community. Experiences like incarceration of a family member, mental illness or substance abuse in the home, and abuse of any kind have a direct impact on the life outcomes of the children who experience them.
The number of ACEs a child endures correlates directly to an increased risk of many diseases and causes of early death. Children in Shasta County experience more ACEs than most children in the state.
Shasta county has some of the highest ACE statistics in the state. Here are a few of the statistics

17.1 % Have an incarcerated family member 
29.7% Have witnessed domestic violence
54.5 % Have experienced verbal abuse
57.7 % Have experienced family substance abuse

The good news is that kids who experience these things CAN heal and have a bright future.  In addition to healing, studies have shown that there are some specific protective factors against the impact of ACEs in a community. 
Roam Playspace will directly address ACEs through the protective factors of: 


Social Connections: Roam will be a place where families can connect, create, and strengthen the social connections that are integral for strong families and communities 

Knowledge of parenting practices and childhood development: Opt- in workshops at Roam Playspace will come from a variety of community voices and focus on many aspects of parenting and development 

Social and emotional competence in children: Learning to interact with and navigate relationships to other children and adults is key to a child's development, and this happens naturally through open-ended play. 


About the Founders
Alan and Anna have been on the parenting journey for 5 years and on a personal level have seen the force of a parenting community,  the lifeline of experts to support during challenges, and the power of intentional play. 
Alan studied medicine with an emphasis on the low-income families of Appalachia. He has been a physician assistant for 8 years, and he especially enjoys connecting with kids in the ER. He has worked mostly in emergency medicine, with some of that time in the ER of a children's hospital.  He feels honored to be connected to a community of people addressing child development and ACEs in Redding.
Anna was trained as a life coach in 2007 and has been a practicing doula since 2013. She has developed materials that guide women in utilizing the experiences of pregnancy, birthing, postpartum, and early motherhood as a catalyst for their own personal and parenting growth.  Anna saw the power of play and movement in trauma recovery  using swim and art therapy with children who lost their parents in the 2004 tsunami. She leads an international team that resources people in emotional and physical wholeness.
Alan and Anna are consulting with a team of individuals who are incredible thinkers and practioners in the areas of play, the use of space, child development, parent resourcing, healing, and community needs.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
We love consulting with experts in the fields of childhood development, fun, parenting, and child-directed play. We are also creating a line up of workshops with a variety of voices. Be in touch if you would like to be involved! 
Thank you to our amazing design team:
Photo Credit: Rebekah Troll
Video Credit: Nathan Pruzaniec / Pru & Drew Inc. 
Logo and Website Design: Eric Hurtgen

story:
SOUTHBOUND misses you! 

Even though it's only been a few days, we can't wait to open our doors again and welcome our community back.  We're coming up on our 6th year anniversary, and having to temporarily close our doors due to COVID-19 was definitely our saddest day yet. But, we are NOT letting it get us down - our team is still working to make improvements and complete projects around the building to make it better for you.

Just think: when all of this over and you can make up for lost time with

friends and family, it's going to be spectacular!

We created this campaign as a way for you to plan for those good times ahead by pre-purchasing an activity at Southbound (at a discount!).  This, in turn, helps us to support our staff during this down-time and make the process of re-opening much quicker.  

To be clear: We would never ask for a hand-out or donation - we want you to get exactly what you pay for (and then some!).  Our team has created various events for you to choose from.  Whether you're planning a meal for 2 people or a party for 75, we've got you covered!   We simply ask that you take a moment to browse the options and consider supporting Southbound by pre-purchasing a brunch, lunch, dinner, party, or class.  Make it an epic shindig, a romantic gesture, a surprise party, a birthday celebration, an event just because, or a one-of-a-kind gift....you can't go wrong here, folks!

​Thank you for taking the time to consider Southbound!  

Feel free to share our campaign and help us all focus on the future fun!

story:
The Cup of Hope Project

We will make a coffee bar that is a safe place for those suffering from mental health challenges and 100% of the proceeds will benefit mental health education and suicide prevention.

We are working to bring the Cup of Hope to Tampa / Wesley Chapel, FL area!

Brought to you by the Defeat Suicide Foundation, a 501(c)3 registered non-profit, the Cup of Hope will be a coffee bar where 100% of the proceeds support mental health education and suicide prevention.

This will be the perfect space where mental health counselors will be available, volunteers can hang out and enjoy meeting new people, those in need of finding someone to talk to can find people ready to talk, and an overall safe place for everyone to enjoy some great coffee.

ALL Cup of Hope baristas will be trained in recognizing and assisting those with signs and symptoms of mental health challenges as part of the hiring process!

We will continue to share the message that it's OK to not be OK while breaking the silence around suicide and mental health challenges.

We get it! Life can throw us curve balls and some days we need a cup of coffee, somedays we need a bagel with our coffee, and somedays we need someone who cares to speak into our lives so we can get through the day.

The Cup of Hope will be designed to promote conversations because suicide prevention starts with a conversation and we will be in place for that conversation to start here.

 

Join us bringing hope and help to those in need!

story:
Become A Midway Member

First and foremost, we’d like to sincerely thank each and every one of you who came out and ate, drank, and danced with us during our Outdoor Dining hours. Your support allowed over 50 Midway staff members to remain employed when it felt like there was little to no hope or safe space for the arts in San Francisco. Your willingness to trust us, and follow our health and safety guidelines at these experiences literally - not figuratively - LITERALLY kept us alive. Our iron gates stayed open, and the world felt that much lighter at a time when bad, and then worse news pinged our phones every day. 

 

With a gleaming track record of 95+ unique dining experiences and several hundreds of local and independent artists booked, we are equal parts grateful for our solid community and proud of what our team can accomplish with your help. At this point, you’ve seen what we can do with a little elbow grease and your support but winter is here, and our dining hours have come to a screeching halt due to many different factors all beyond our control. Due to the new restrictions on outdoor dining, we will be closed until early January and this could potentially drag on for longer. Here at The Midway, we have become quite familiar with pivoting and adapting to the times and this winter is sure to be no exception. 


If The Midway is to continue booking the caliber of artists and providing the full-scale production that we have been offering guests up to this point during the coming winter months, we need to call on our community one more time. We’re re-releasing an extension of our membership program that allows patrons to pick perks like lifetime tickets and tables for our events, meals, and drinks on us, VIP upgrades, & more. Explore Membership options below, and if you have any questions please reach us through our DMs or at ticketing@themidwaysf.com.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal with extending the Midway Membership program is to raise $50,000. This will ensure our rent and employees are paid in the event that we need to reschedule outdoor dining hours due to harsh weather conditions, and of course, continued lockdowns. Buying in now means that we will be able to come back stronger and continue to give SF’s arts a home.

Become a member now and enjoy some of the following benefits later on when we are back in action.

Packages Include: 

* (Lifetime) Free Tickets to Events 

* (Lifetime) Free Drinks

* Free delicious meals from our one-of-a-kind cafe & much more!

story:
Short Summary

CP Barbell Athletics and Barbell Athletics, LLC in conjunction with Josh Lambert (USAW Advanced Weightlifting and Master Level Barbell Athletics Coach) are teaming up to lift for Autism Awareness during the month of April. Coach Josh vowed to lift 500,000 lbs alone in April but has upped the amount to 1,000,000 lbs in April. We are taking lifting totals from anyone out there who wants to submit their totals for the month. Send all lifting totals to www.babrellathletics@gmail.com. 

Autism is very special and dear to Coach Josh because his favorite niece was diagnosed with Autism years ago. Tyler (TyTy) is now 21 and the light of her families life. This lifting is the least that the Coach can do but it is a step in the right direction. Please donate what you can and for every dollar you donate (up to $60, although you may donate more) equals one Free day of Open Gym/Lift with Coaching at Barbell Athletics, LLC. 566 N. Indiana Ave Crown Point, Indiana 46307 (219)742-2712 www.barbellathleticsllc.com 

    Thank you for your support

story:
Two months ago, we began transforming three acres of neglected land into a sustainable farm. After seeing our dedication and hard work, veteran and wheelchair-bound cancer survivor Jack Manahan generously offered his land to us for a lifetime lease. Now we're asking for your help as we fulfill Jack's dream of starting a fully-functional farm; which happens to be our dream, too.

—Jani Benjamins and Kipp Koren, co-founders, Leaping Bridge Farms


We're an integrated polyculture farm located in Paonia, Colorado, using sustainable techniques and innovative green technology to raise organic crops, perennial plants, and herbs. Our mission is to grow highly nutritious, organic food by utilizing no-till methods pioneered by Masanobu Fukuoka, along with passive solar geothermal greenhouses and the heat from compost piles, which will allow us to grow specialty crops year-round. Along the way, we intend to work with nature, restoring wildlife habitat.

We plan to produce and offer fermented foods, skin products, gourmet and medicinal mushrooms, perennial trees and shrubs, organic fruits and vegetables, along with bees for honey production.


What We Need 

To bring our farm to fruition, we're raising funding for:

  • solar panels: $2,000
  • basic tools like broadfork/chainsaw/harvesting clippers : $500
  • soil amendments and compost: $1,500
  • potting soil, plants, shelves, and seeds: $2,000
  • labor: $4,000
  • bee hives: $350
  • additional irrigation infrastructure: $200
  • composting toilet materials: $1,500
  • biogas generator: $1,500
  • building materials/plumbing work/electrical work: $2,500


The Impact

We're trying to have a positive influence on the land, and to help people access healthier foods and safer products by focusing on soil health and a diversity of plants. Having a great diversity of plants helps pollinators like bees acquire more beneficial pollen which they turn into a healthier, more nutrient-dense honey. In addition, we're creating our own microclimate by incorporating beneficial soil amendments and plants in the fields, in order to increase the overall biodiversity on the property.


Risks & Challenges

Two months ago we did not have running water, electricity, or proper irrigation.   Plumbing pipes and irrigation pipes were broken everywhere, the roof was collapsing in the barn, and our cabin was in complete disarray. The land was neglected and run down. Slowly, we've pieced this property together and remodeled a derelict cabin into something habitable, and planted 50 different types of annuals and perennials in an attempt to transform Jack's land into a diverse and thriving farm. But we still have so much work to do. While we continue to improve infrastructure, we'll be preparing hundreds more plants and seeds to start in our nursery and plant in our fields. By ensuring we have the resources needed to cultivate this first year's round of crops, we'll establish a working foundation for a sustainable livelihood now, and for years to come.


Community Starts with You

We are striving to strengthen community by giving people an opportunity to work on something they are passionate about. From our local community in Paonia to our global network, we have many collaborators, partners, and specialists who'd love to work with us on these projects—yet we're short on the capital needed to lift these projects off the ground. We're putting every dollar toward our dream and are grateful for any help you may be able to offer: please consider making a small donation, and please help us spread the word by encouraging others to learn about our farm and this campaign. Through word of mouth and your support, we can create a model for small businesses to revitalize local economies and strengthen communities.


Thank you,

Jack, Jani, Kipp and all of us at Leaping Bridge Farms

story:
WE LOWERED OUR GOAL!!

After crunching some number and moving a few things around, we lowered our target! Thanks for all those who have helped us so far!


Our Story: Just a couple of kids with a dream

Our passion is food. Not just good food but amazing made by hand, 2nd and 3rd helping kind of food! Over the years, we have perfected an arsenal of recipes that have our friends and family coming back for more! Our dream is to bring our passion to the people of our great state and local communities.

We want to bring the HANGRY Food Truck out swinging and bring the delicious goodness to Utah!

Here’s what we are doing:

We have perfected our recipes (our friends and family were willing participants!) and decided on a name that we reflect our personalities. We've also done all the research on permits, licenses, trademarks, patents, logo design and so forth so we have a game plan of what we will need to get us on our feet.

Here’s what we need:

I bet you're asking yourself, "How are these crazy people going to spend these incredibly generous donations?" Well, I'll tell ya! First, we need to purchase a truck/trailer, fix it up and get the rubber on the road! We don't need, or want, anything brand new, we just need something that won't leave us on the side of the road. By our estimates, this is where the majority of the donations will be dedicated. If the trailer isn't fully equipped, we will need to purchase remaining equipment for setting up shop. We want to get our hands dirty, really make this business our own and make you all PROUD! 

We really want to create a space that’s fun and really reaches out and grabs you by the eyes and taste buds!

We come to you in hopes that you will assist us in getting our family business off the ground. We are hardworking, honest and are determined to be a success if given the opportunity. We won't let you down.

What’s in it for you:

Swag, recipes, truck tattoos? What’s NOT to love?! This is your chance to help make our dreams come true. Snatch up on of our awesome perks to bring a little HANGRY home.

What We Want To Offer Our Community: A Love Story

  • Our love of good food is transcendent. Our greatest wish is to bring that love of good food to our community.
  • Bringing the power of locally sourced ingredients to the streets. We can’t think of anything better than using the freshest ingredients from our own backyard.
  • Great food doesn't have to be overpriced. We want to feed the masses and we feel that great food doesn't has to cost an arm and a leg.
  • Support the Local Food Truck team. We have some downright awesome food trucks in Utah and we want to join the ranks!
  • WE WANT TO FEED YOU! Have you ever had a Bacon & Meatloaf sandwich smothered with Grandpa’s Sauce in your face? Great food is an experience!

Fresh batch of Grandpa's Sauce! We put it on everything!

Your funding means the absolute world to us. We cannot express how much this will do to help us get started. If you help us reach our goals, not only will be feed you (either in person or with our great recipes), we will put your name and location on our truck and show it off! Like that tribal tattoo that you got in college, we will  wear it proudly and show it off to everyone!!

We’ve all heard the saying, “Do what you love & never work a day in your life”. Well, we’ve found what we love to do. Thanks for making this all possible.

Like us on Facebook at: https://www.facebook.com/hangryfoodtruck

Follow our Indiegogo progress at: https://www.indiegogo.com/campaigns/let-s-get-hangry-mobile/
Tweet us on Twitter at: https://twitter.com/hangryfoodtruck

story:
The Savannah Mini Golf Rental Story 

   My name is Joshua Holz and I am the founder of Savannah Mini Golf Rental. You could say the company has passed it's storyboard stage. We have all of our ideas on paper and we need YOU to make this dream a reality. I served in the Army National Guard for 6.5 years and have been a Police Officer for the last 2.5 years. During these years, I have developed a real connection with the people of the community. One of my goals for Savannah Mini Golf Rental is to create a fun, entertaining and philanthropic setting for people in and around the area.  I have always wanted to start my own business and Savannah Mini Golf Rental is the perfect opportunity to launch my entrepreneurial career!   

What is Savannah Mini Golf Rental?

   Savannah Mini Golf Rental is a portable mini golf course rental company. The market is for corporate events and parties, churches, birthday parties, community events, charity events, and many more. Even if there are no reservations during a day, Savannah Mini Golf Rental will be used in local malls and establishments for year round entertainment. The course will only require a minimum of  1,500 sq. ft. with the largest space being 2,450 sq. ft. for 9 holes. 

    Savannah Mini Golf Rental will also donate rentals to charities throughout the year to help raise money and provide entertainment for the community. Your contributions will help us with a down payment for 9 portable holes (expansion possibilities), putters, balls, an enclosed cargo trailer for transporting the course, a graphic wrap that will be placed on the trailer for advertising the company, along with the strong possibly of increasing local employment as the business continues to grow. 

Why we need YOU!!!

   We need the help of YOU and YOUR friends to help us reach our goal of $5,500 for a down payment on the loan for Savannah Mini Golf Rental. This loan will help cover costs for the course itself, an enclosed cargo trailer with graphic wrapping advertising 'Savannah Mini Golf Rental' and, of course, the mini golf equipment. If this goal is reached, we will be able to have everything up and running by late August, along with getting our name out there for next season! 

   If the goal is not reached we may spend $2.00 on a box of tissues to wipe our tears but we will still succeed! Whatever portion of the goal we receive from you to invest with, will still be put towards the loan. We are trying to have a cash pool for immediate expansion and purchases that will move the company forward, based on demand.  

 We know that not everyone lives in beautiful Savannah, Georgia to enjoy the fun that Savannah Mini Golf Rental will offer. However, you will still be able to tell your friends and family that you helped fund a company that will not only entertain thousands of people in the area, it will also create an impact in the community by generating money for several known charities around! PLUS we send you the swag to remind you of that too!!!

Making a Footprint

     This type of business has been proven to be a highly successful fundraising tool used for providing increasing amounts of money to major charities. Everyone enjoys mini golf and this will also be an easy way to bring mini golf to people who are less fortunate and have never had the opportunity to play. Its a great icebreaker and entertainment option for corporate events, parties, community outings, and many more. 
       During the first months this will be a two person operation. When business increases to two or more appointments in a day, we will be able to increase the number of employees . We already have a great customer service/public relations team member and would love to have more team members with equally great skill sets. 

The Not So Scary Risks

     So there is good news... and good news! If Savannah Mini Golf Rental were to average 2 reservations a month, the monthly loan payment would be completely paid for in addition to making a small profit. If Savannah Mini Golf Rental does not average at that rate, the loan will still be paid for from the cash pool and/or personal savings. That will be a very, very rare situation since we have already created promising relationships with a few companies that would use Savannah Mini Golf Rental's services multiple times a year. 

Other Ways You Can Help

    We know that not all of you reading this can help us financially, which is OK because we still love you! But, you can still help us by telling your friends, family, and coworkers about Savannah Mini Golf Rental. Just like Mom used to say, "Use your words and talk to your friends, or at least share it on Facebook or Twitter." Okay, Mom never said this but, you get the hint...

    A very strong handshake, and a sincere THANK YOU from your friends at Savannah Mini Golf Rental!


"If you can dream it, you can do it." 

-Walt Disney

During these years, I have developed a real connection with the people of the community. One of my goals for Savannah Mini Golf Rental is to create a fun, entertaining and philanthropic setting for people in and around the area.  I have always wanted to start my own business and Savannah Mini Golf Rental is the perfect opportunity to launch my entrepreneurial career!   
What is Savannah Mini Golf Rental?

story:
***update** This project is bigger than we thought it would be, requiring a grand amount of money, time and building, so while we search for investors/business partners we will take a few steps back and start small.  Julie will be incorporating Himalayan Salt into some of her Sound Healing events, combining the elements of Earth and Ether for a blissful experience.  She will also soon offer Himalayan Salt products such lamps and candles, and she will combine essential oils to create spa and wellness products such as bath salts and nasal inhalers.

My Salt Story

Last year while visiting my sister in Arizona, we took a little shopping excursion to a Himalayan Salt Lamp store.  We were going to stop in, check it out and then grab some lunch.  While in the store, I stumbled upon a small, cave-like room with the floor and part of a wall laid in Himalayan Salt bricks that beckoned me in with their glow.  I wandered in, sat in one of the chairs and announced that I would be resting in there for a while.  The energy in the room drew me in and instantly relaxed me. I emerged after about 20 minutes ready to shop, and three hours later we were loading up the car with lamps, salt bars, bath salts and much more.  I already knew that Himalayan Salt Lamps created a blissful environment, but learned so much more just by experiencing the energy shift and relaxing feeling from being in that room.  The store clerk explained how the Himalayan Salt emits negative ions when lit and heated.  These negative ions are actually a good thing because they help dissipate disharmonious energy given off by wifi, computers, cell phones, etc.  

(The Inspiration Salt Room)

I truly felt a rebalancing of my my body and mind while I was in that room, and I wanted more!  I came home to San Diego and began my search for a salt cave here that I could go chill in, but to my dismay, the closest ones I could find were in Burbank and Santa Barbara.  I was bummed for a while because I would have to road trip to experience that again, but then I was inspired.  San Diego needs our own Himalayan Salt Cave and I wanted to make that a reality.  I have partnered with two incredible local business women, Jennifer Opaka and Elaine Davis, and we are bringing the bliss to San Diego!

Bliss Cavern

Bliss Cavern will be a unique healing space with dedicated rooms for massage, private yoga, Roll & Release therapy, and a Himalayan Salt Cave.  The heart and soul of Bliss Cavern is the Halogenerator, which grinds salt to nanometer size and pumps it into the room, emulating the conditions inside a natural salt cave, creating a calm, relaxing environment.  Dry salt therapy has been used for years to help people alleviate different types of respiratory and skin conditions.  Himalayan Salt is naturally anti-bacterial, anti-fungal, anti-viral, and anti-microbial and gets deep down into our lungs, so that it cleanses the entire respiratory system including mouth, sinuses, nasal cavities, throat and lungs. The tiny particles of salt will help flush impurities and are perfect for respiratory health.  Originating centuries ago in the natural salt mines of Eastern Europe, salt therapy has spread worldwide and is expanding into the United States....and now to San Diego!  Step into the Bliss Cavern - Salt & Sound Sanctuary for salt therapy sessions, sound healing events, yoga and meditation classes, massage/energy healing and more!


Bliss Cavern Details:

Bliss Cavern will be approximately 500 square feet in size which is large enough for 15-20 people to sit in the zero gravity reclining chairs, which we will be using for our Relax and Renew sessions.

With your support we will be able to do the following:

  • Redesign the space and make structural changes to the existing building that will allow us to build out private therapy rooms, as well as the salt cave that will have enough space to fit up to 20 people inside at a time.

  • Purchase Himalayan Rock Salt to build the internal structure of the salt cave, add a special Halogenerator, and build a dedicated ventilation system that will ensure the air inside the room remains clean and pure.
  • Install a sound system for all of our service rooms, including the salt cave.
  • Expand our services to offer a multitude of options, which will include but in no way be limited to, community acupuncture, specialty yoga, meditation, healing movement classes, aromatherapy workshops, sound healing, and vibrational energy workshops. The possibilities are endless

  • Provide Himalayan Salt retail products including salt lamps, decorative decor, relaxation items, food grade salt and much more.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread The Word - Use the Indiegogo share tools to share it on social media (Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, Instagram), e-mail the link or even just speak about it with others.

INFINITE LOVE AND GRATITUDE!!!

Here are some of the perks:

(natural candle holder)

(mini usb lamp)

(yin/yang candle holder)

(OM candle holder)

(salt bars/deodorant bars/massage stones)

(abundance bowls)

(salt lamps)

(bath salts)

(pre-release copy of DTO's new album)

(Reiki infused, hand-crafted quartz crystal pendants)


What Other Blissful Services Will We Offer?

Roll & Release Method - Rolling on a ball?  Really?  Can this seriously help alleviate pain? Can it help improve athletic performance? Can it help with weight loss?  The answer to all of these questions is yes. All from rolling on a ball?  The key word is HELP.  Strategically rolling on a ball can assist your body with many changes.  While nothing can replace the amazing work of a massage therapist, a pilates trainer, a yoga teacher or a chiropractor, rolling on a ball is a supportive tool that complements the work that these practitioners do with you.  Jennifer Opaka has developed the Roll & Release Method from her experience of over 20 years of working with thousands of clients.  This method truly helps you help yourself. 

(Roll & Release Method with Jennifer Opaka)


Massage - Long used as a means to relieve physical and emotional tension, massage is an ideal way to relax and to feel rested and pampered. The advantages of a good massage go much further than relaxation. Known benefits include the reduction or elimination of pain, relief from sore muscles, improved sleep, greater flexibility, better skin tone, increased energy and much, much more. Choose from a variety of massage techniques to relax and restore.  Find what your body is begging for to melt away into BLISS!

(massage with Himalayan Salt stones)

Sound Healing - Shift and renew with a  fusion of energy healing modalities, including intuitive bodywork, yoga, Reiki, Tibetan singing bowls, tuning forks, and vibroacoustic sound therapy.  Release physical and emotional blockages for the ultimate healing session to help bring your body, mind and soul into ease and balance.  Experience a therapeutic relaxation session on the sound healing table, melting into bliss as low frequency audio waves pulsate throughout your body bringing restoration and healing.  Singing bowls and other instruments have been historically used to alter consciousness taking you into a deep, meditative state where our body can heal itself.  Comprised of a combination of  sound therapy, yoga and intuitive energy work, Julie Johnston tailors sessions to meet your individual needs helping you release blockages and emerge transformed.  

(Vibro-acoustic sound healing table)

(crystal singing bowls - sound healing)


Private Yoga Instruction - Elaine Davis, Julie Johnston and Jennifer Opaka all offer personalized yoga classes.  Whether you want to develop awareness, strength and flexibility, or simple relaxation, they will plan and individualized yoga session to meet your unique needs.  Through alignment and mindful actions of the body, you can bring balance, strength, and a sense of well-being and bliss to your body, mind and soul.

(Elaine teaching yoga)

(yoga in the salt cave)

story:
Where it began...

In 2003, I was looking for a job in Fine Dining after having working in Fine Dining for three months during the summer.  I couldn't get hired because I didn't have enough experience (by a long shot), but Harbor House Seafood Restaurant hired me for their main dining room and welcomed me onto the team.  I was so happy to be working and having a place to call home that I put up a sign welcoming 10 of my new teammates to a rustic Italian dinner at my home.  The group was pretty skeptical of "the new guy" who wanted to break bread with his new teammates... but 10 brave souls agreed and came over.  We all ate from about 5pm until 10pm, course after course...  Bruschetta Caprese, Stuffed Mushrooms, Asparagus Frittata, Shrimp Scampi, Chicken Fettucine Florentine, Linguine with a rich Marinara which had meat braising in it all day, then Meatballs, Sausage, Spareribs all fork-tender, a little Swordfish Picata, Caesar Salad, Garlic Cheese Bread, Stuffed Peppers, Eggplant and Zucchini Stew, and then... after I forced them to eat a little fruit (most looked at me like I was sadistic...), I brought out dessert...  Bananas Foster, Turtle Brownies and fresh coffee....  Well, they talked about it for weeks and the Manager, Jim Murphy, came to me one day and said "So, I hear you like to cook?"  I smiled and said "Yes sir!  Love it."  "If Harbor House paid for the food, would you prepare another party?"  Without even a thought or hesitation, I said "I would be delighted."  "Great!!!  We're auctioning you off for St. Jude's."  That led to 6 years of being auctioned off to raise money for St. Jude's.  Each year the amount raised increased.  Our last year we raised $5000 for a meal for 20 prepared in their home.

In 2005, I was participating in an exercise in Poland with the Marines.  We were working side by side with the Polish Air Force and they invited us to eat in their chow hall.  I asked to be able to cook for them during our cultural exchange/party.  When I went into their kitchen, there were no large freezers or refrigerators!  I asked and they tried to explain to me (language was an issue for both sides..) that they ordered what they needed, it came in, they prepared it fresh and served it that day.  There was no need for large refrigerators or freezers!  And the food was great!!!  It got me thinking that we should be doing this in America.

I want to cook each day for my neighbors.  I want to be able to offer fresh food that is handmade to people at prices that are meet or beat fast food.  I want to have a team who is commited to feeding the people of the community even in tough times because in America we are supposed to invite everyone to the table.  People matter, money comes and goes... and tough times don't last, but tough people do.

This food truck is designed to be a community partner that serves food of the people, by the people and for the people.


Help us and help yourself too!

Overall we are looking for $100,000 in investors.  For this campiaign however, we are setting our sights on something very specific.  $15,000 is our initial outlay to purchase food from Performance Food Group and our local organic farm "Lester Farms"  What we raise from this crowdfunding campaign will go to paying for the food we will be using as we begin our business.

Perks will include items that help us spread the excitement about breaking bread together and taking a personal hand in taking care of our community and nation.  We will have one of our static cling vinyl appliques to let you show your support, a collectible coin that can be used to enjoy two meals with our food truck, a matching set of flexible cutting boards that will make preparing meals for family easier and quicker (and don't forget we are sharing recipes!!), a cheese cutting board with tools to help you effortlessly entertain friends and family, a deluxe picnic basket that allows you to enjoy some free time with three friends or family members and a foldable picnic table that you can put into your car and use whenever you are traveling or enjoying a day off!  At the very top is me, Mark Daemon, coming to your home and preparing a multi-course meal of your choosing for a group of your friends, just like the experiences that were offered to support St. Jude's Childrens Hospital.


The Impact

 

At the end of the day, this food truck might just be a single entity that proudly serves the people of Lebanon, TN.   If all it ever is is a small business with a small team of Veterans who feed our neighbors, I will be satisfied.  If, however, it is wildly successful, we will offer to share the blueprint and the experience with others who wish to have a smiliar community supporting food truck for their own community.  Our first planned growth is in San Diego partnered with the Veterans Village of San Diego.  There are numerous communities that could benefit from having a team of Veterans who can offer fresh meals that can compete with fast food.

 

Risks & Challenges

 There are always risks in any venture.  We are under capitalized... but we are in a community that is fiercely proud of its independence and support each other.  We might have unforseen expenses and obstacles.  We are not going to be deterred by things that might happen.  We are committed to making this happen and finding ways to make this work because it is an idea that's time has come.  With your support, we will be capable of having a little more of a buffer for our initial launch.  We will only be successful if our food is good, our prices are resaonable and our business  is transparent to our community, our investors and our supporters.  We are sure that we can keep our business clean, feed our community and share the news about how we are doing to all those who are interested and following our progress. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes we cannot help... we are stretched as far as we can go ourrselves and one more straw will break the camel's back (so to speak).  Have no fear, if you cannot help, just keep in contact with us on our Facebook page and we will share recipes and information that is good for saving you a little more and pointing you towards better health and thrifty ways to feed yourself and your family in a more natural, healthy way.   Spread the word!!!  Share with your friends!!!  The purpose of this business is to help people eat healthier, break bread together and to strengthen our bodies and to refresh our spirits.  Together, we can do anything!

Overall we are looking for $100,000 in investors.  For this campiaign however, we are setting our sights on something very specific.  $15,000 is our initial outlay to purchase food from Performance Food Group and our local organic farm "Lester Farms"  What we raise from this crowdfunding campaign will go to paying for the food we will be using as we begin our business.   Perks will include items that help us spread the excitement about breaking bread together and taking a personal hand in taking care of our community and nation.  We will have one of our static cling vinyl appliques to let you show your support, a collectible coin that can be used to enjoy two meals with our food truck, a matching set of flexible cutting boards that will make preparing meals for family easier and quicker (and don't forget we are sharing recipes!!), a cheese cutting board with tools to help you effortlessly entertain friends and family, a deluxe picnic basket that allows you to enjoy some free time with three friends or family members and a foldable picnic table that you can put into your car and use whenever you are traveling or enjoying a day off!  At the very top is me, Mark Daemon, coming to your home and preparing a multi-course meal of your choosing for a group of your friends, just like the experiences that were offered to support St. Jude's Childrens Hospital.    The Impact At the end of the day, this food truck might just be a single entity that proudly serves the people of Lebanon, TN.   If all it ever is is a small business with a small team of Veterans who feed our neighbors, I will be satisfied.  If, however, it is wildly successful, we will offer to share the blueprint and the experience with others who wish to have a smiliar community supporting food truck for their own community.  Our first planned growth is in San Diego partnered with the Veterans Village of San Diego.  There are numerous communities that could benefit from having a team of Veterans who can offer fresh meals that can compete with fast food.    Risks & Challenges  There are always risks in any venture.  We are under capitalized... but we are in a community that is fiercely proud of its independence and support each other.  We might have unforseen expenses and obstacles.  We are not going to be deterred by things that might happen.  We are committed to making this happen and finding ways to make this work because it is an idea that's time has come.  With your support, we will be capable of having a little more of a buffer for our initial launch.  We will only be successful if our food is good, our prices are resaonable and our business  is transparent to our community, our investors and our supporters.  We are sure that we can keep our business clean, feed our community and share the news about how we are doing to all those who are interested and following our progress.     Other Ways You Can Help Sometimes we cannot help... we are stretched as far as we can go ourrselves and one more straw will break the camel's back (so to speak).  Have no fear, if you cannot help, just keep in contact with us on our Facebook page and we will share recipes and information that is good for saving you a little more and pointing you towards better health and thrifty ways to feed yourself and your family in a more natural, healthy way.   Spread the word!!!  Share with your friends!!!  The purpose of this business is to help people eat healthier, break bread together and to strengthen our bodies and to refresh our spirits.  Together, we can do anything!

story:
Rhode Island's First Cat Cafe!

The Purrfect Cup  will be the purrfect place for customers to enjoy Rhode Island’s favorite beverage, coffee, with America’s favorite animal at their side. We're hoping to provide a cat lovers paradise for one of America's best cities.

    


Hello! We are Zack and Sarah, passionate cat lovers and the creators of The Purrfect Cup. In August 2014, we moved to South Korea to teach English. We expected to soak up the culture and experience a whole new and unique world. We knew that cat cafes were all over Korea and Japan and, being cat lovers, we knew we would love them. What we didn't expect was that we would fall in love with the idea of opening our own. 


The minute we went to our first cat cafe we both knew this was what we wanted to do. 

Making friends at our first cat cafe


We spend much of our free time researching and planning our dream. We've also made sure to visit as many cat cafes as we can...for research of course >^..^<

We hope to open The Purrfect Cup Cafe and Cat Room side by side in downtown Providence in early 2016. Our goal is provide a safe and happy space for cats and cat lovers. 
We are planning on rescuing 10-20 cats from local animal shelters to provide them with a forever home in our kitty oasis. Our goal is to work with great organizations such as the Providence Animal Rescue League to not only rescue cats for our cafe, but also encourage and increase adoptions!


Share our Dream

Starting any business is no easy task, we are prepared to invest our time and money into creating our dream. We'd love for you to be able to share the dream with us by supporting our campaign.

Your gracious contribution will help us with many of our initial costs, including:

  • Renting & renovating a space.

This is the biggest obstacle we expect to face in our initial start-up phase. We need to find two suitable spaces near, or ideally adjacent to each other, and we also need to renovate the space for The Cat Room to the highest of kitty cat standards. We want The Cat Room to be a safe and comfortable home for our feline friends, and a relaxing and fun environment for our visitors (that's you!).

  • Cafe equipment

Our second biggest cost will be purchasing a quality espresso machine. These babies can be as much as $15,000! We think those ones must also make gold...We're looking for something a little more affordable but without the added rare mineral production functions. Jokes aside, we want to provide our customers with quality coffee. As coffee lovers ourselves we know this requires a commitment to quality machinery, and beans. We've spoken to several local roasters and equipment dealers and look forward to working with other local businesses. 

  • Adopting and providing for 10-20 cats

Depending on the size of the Cat Room, we will be adopting 10-20 cats from local animal shelters. There are a lot of costs that come with adopting so much cuteness including veterinarian check ups, cat supplies and of course loads of fun interactive cat toys.  While this is not the largest expense, it is certainly the most important!  


FAQs


1. What is a cat cafe?
Cat cafes are awesome places where people can order a coffee and then enjoy it in a room filled with cats. Initially popular in Asian countries like Taiwan, Korea, and Japan, they have become increasingly popular in the last year, popping up in California, Portland, London and New York. 

2. Is that legal?
The Rhode Island Food Code does not allow animals on the premises of any food establishment. In order to comply with this, The Purrfect Cup will have two separate locations. The Purrfect Cup Cafe will be cat free and solely focus on churning out delicious cups of quality java; while the The Purrfect Cup Cat Room will be your spot for kitty action. By completely separating the food establishment from our feline friends we will ensure compliance with The Code.

3. Will it be sanitary?
Yes! As we mentioned all food and drink preparation will be completely and totally separated from the cats. It will be your choice as to whether or not you bring your beverage into The Cat Room. As a matter of fact if you're not a coffee fan and just want some straight up kitty lovin' you don't even need to visit The Cafe. The safety of our cats and the cleanliness of our facilities are our top priorities, and we believe they go hand in hand. We promise to provide a safe, comfortable and clean space for you and for our cats!  

 4. Is this safe for the cats?
This is really important to us. Cats are easily stressed out by large groups of people, and this stress can be really harmful to them. In order to keep our kitties feeling zen we will limit the number of visitors to The Cat Room. We will also have rules in place about how you will be able to interact with the cats, such as, no cat juggling! We will work closely with our veterinarian to ensure that our furry friends are safe, happy and healthy.

5. How will this whole thing work?
In order to enter The Cat Room you will need to pay a cover charge for a 1 hour visit with the cats. This cover charge can be waived with the purchase of a beverage from The Purrfect Cup Cafe (for the same cost). Reservations for The Cat Room will be available online for everyone's convenience.

6. What happens if you don't reach your funding goal?
If we don't reach our goal we will continue our efforts to open the cafe. Not reaching our goal does NOT mean The Purrfect Cup won't open! It may however mean that the opening will be delayed, so reaching our goal means getting your cat and coffee fix a lot sooner! If, for some unknown reason we are not able to open the cafe the funds we raised during this campaign will be donated to local animal shelters. 


Who Are We?

Zack was born and raised in Cumberland, RI, while Sarah comes from Cornwall, CT. We met at St. John's University in Queens, NY in 2008 and have been sharing our love of cats, coffee, and The Office ever since. After graduating with a BA, Zack spent 2 years working as a real estate appraiser in NYC. Sarah went on to get her Master's and then dedicated one year to service with AmeriCorps in the NYC public schools. We've spent the last year teaching English in South Korea and traveling throughout Asia on our days off. If you're interested in our Korean adventures you can check out our blog here, or if you have any other questions about us we'll be happy to answer!


Press about The Purrfect Cup

  • Rhode Island Monthly
  • CatChannel.com
  • Eater
  • The Unfiltered Lens
  • The Woonsocket Call
  • Three Little Sparrows
  • The Lakeville Journal

Other Ways You Can Help

We hope you love our idea as much as we do! If you can't support us financially please share our campaign with your friends, family, cat-lovers and maybe even some dog-lovers! 

If you have any questions, suggestions or wish to help in some other way, please email us at PurrfectCupRI@gmail.com. 

Thank you for support we can't wait to see you in 2016!

story:
NOTE: To our Chinese supporters please use the following Youku video link: http://v.youku.com/v_show/id_XMTI5MDY1Nzg5Mg==.html

Meet Digital 6

Digital 6 (D6) is Skyvine’s ultimate virtual personal assistant (VPA). Unlike any other VPAs available on the market, D6 is not only designed to actively learn from you, but also programmed to digest information at an unprecedented rate. Let the A.I. spend time with you, and your life will never be the same. Through technology that maintains security and privacy, D6 uses your taste and preferences to:

  • Curate information relevant to you
  • Improve every aspect of your social life
  • Escort you to new and exciting experiences


The unique aspect of Digital 6 is that it remembers your preferences to help provide you with better suggestions. Curated information such as restaurant recommendations, deal alerts, news articles, and other relevant data will be matched to your specific interests to help make your life more convenient.  D6 patent pending proprietary technology goes a step further. Embedded into a multi-functional camera, it also harnesses vision to make inferences, thus delivering more holistic and accurate predictions. As the old saying goes, a picture is worth a thousand words.


The Digital 6 App



Curating Information

The unique aspect of D6 is that it remembers your preferences in order to provide you with the most pertinent recommendations. Curated details are displayed on an easy-to-use app with the goal of cutting down on time spent sifting through irrelevant content.
 


Socializing

Socializing with current friends or meeting new people has never been easier. D6 highlights the common interests you and your friends share and offers its suggestions with them in mind. Interested in expanding your social network? D6 can also propose new contacts recommendations given your preferences and interests.



Exploring

Explore your environment with the help of D6. Discover local events, activities, and trends. Alternatively, create your own event and invite friends to join.  Need to grab a bite before or after the event? Let D6 recommend new restaurants, as it uses its technology to consider not only your preferences but also places where you have eaten in the past.


The Digital 6 Camera


Home Security

The modular camera design will allow for further functionality even if you are not wearing it. Dock the camera into its wall mounted charging station and  D6 transforms into a home monitoring device capable of recognizing people, performing analytics and alerting you of any unusual situations at home in real-time. Through the app you will even be able to access the live camera feed and always keep an eye on what matters most. 



Real-time security streaming will capture possible alerts, describe them with words, and save the footage in a separate file, thus making it easier to review without having to sit in front of a screen fast forwarding and rewinding through endless footage. And all while simultaneously performing deep analysis of events to present a more robust understanding of what took place - such as distinguishing from trusted individuals and strangers. 



The core technology behind the D6 camera allows you to have the peace of mind that comes from having an expensive state of the art home monitoring system at a fraction of the price and size. You will no longer need to deal with the hassle of installing bulky cameras in your home; the simple to use and compact design of the D6 camera allows you to protect, both quickly and conveniently, what matters most. 


Wearable

The D6 companion camera is highly functional, serving as your second set of eyes to help you navigate through your busy day.


The camera’s functions include:

  • The ability to learn about your immediate environment
  • The ability to keep track of your belongings -  alerting you if you are about to leave an item behind
  • The ability to locate misplaced items - such as keys, glasses or even your wallet
  • The ability to detect faces - such as those of your friends and family


Tentative Specs


The Digital 6 Technology

To deliver results, the most advanced VPAs employ the use of predictive analysis. However taking advantage of users’ geographical location, search terms, and web browsing history alone limits these VPAs’ ability to generate accurate predictions, as they remain blind to the interactions taking place amidst the users' surroundings.  Furthermore, in an effort to learn user behavior, traditional VPAs habitually store massive quantities of personal data in the cloud - a practice that continues to raise privacy concerns and fears of cyber-attacks.  


To prevent any privacy issues, D6 will not be collecting and storing your entire digital footprint like most personal assistants currently do. D6 will take the camera's input and your location information to quickly learn your preferences and deliver accurate recommendations.  To further mitigate privacy concerns, our team has developed additional technology that has the dual benefit of giving D6 an extra layer of encryption to protect all sensitive data, and also allowing it to map and access your preferences quickly in order to improve the relevance of its recommendations.


We Need Your Help

We are asking for $200,000 to acquire the proper equipment to prototype the camera before production. Current tests have been run using cellphone cameras and development boards, and have proven to be successful; we are ready to begin implementing the technology into a compact camera. Before we finalize on a production model, we would like to obtain fan feedback and additional inputs on the camera and its design, to deliver a product that not only users like, but that will also help them become more efficient. The funds raised will go directly into implementing your suggestions into the final product.  


The Perks

Indiegogo supporters will receive an exclusive Indiegogo version of D6 at a discounted price. 


The D6 T-shirt


Other Ways You Can Help

We would love to hear your input on the camera and its application. What improvements would you like to see as developments progress? If you share our vision we would love your support. Please share our campaign with all your friends, we shall be most grateful.  

Development and Timelines


Progress and Milestones

Over the past year our team has been developing and testing the core technology that will make D6 a reality.


Milestone 1: Image recognition

     


We trained the A.I. to analyze images for a short period of time. We then proceeded to test its learning capabilities. After downloading random images from the internet, we then let the A.I. process them using a short analysis time frame to simulate real time interactions. In the above example, the A.I. successfully determined the animal species in the picture in less than thirty seconds. 


Milestone 2: Enhanced Analytical Abilities

We trained the A.I. to successfully recognize never before seen images. The team then developed the A.I's linguistic and analytical capabilities.


                  


To test the A.I.'s enhanced analytical abilities, the team employed images such as the one depicted above. The A.I. was able to simultaneously recognize a person, the color of the person's shirt, and the plane in the background. Additionally, the A.I. wrote a sentence describing the picture in detail. 


Milestone 3: Item Location Mapping

To help D6 better navigate its environment, the team developed additional technology allowing it to track the position of different items from pictures taken at different angles. 


              


This technology does not only help D6 keep track of your items, but it also gives D6 access to the elusive depth dimension, allowing it to learn and navigate the world more efficiently.


Milestone 4: Mobile Device Integration

To simulate the D6 camera, the team integrated the A.I. into a smartphone. 

The above demo shows the A.I.'s analytical capabilities in real time. While the A.I. had never previously seen these specific objects, it demonstrated its ability to accurately recognize them nonetheless.  The demo also confirms the A.I's ability to be integrated into low power devices.


Milestone 5: Video Analysis

Upon achieving mobile device integration, the team proceeded to develop and test the A.I.'s video analytics capabilities, which will play an integral role in its home security applications. 




In the demo above, the A.I. successfully detected and assigned a unique ID number to the car entering the driveway as well as the one driving passed it. This technology will be employed to not only recognize familiar vehicles, such as those belonging to friends and family, but to also alert of unusual circumstances, such as those that could arise when an unknown van is detected loitering in front of a house.  




In the above demonstration, the cellphone camera zoomed in to record the concluding moments of a soccer match, just as the players begin to walk out of the field. The results capture high levels of video noise. Yet, even within the confines of poor quality footage, the A.I. recognized and tagged the different soccer players and assigned each of them an individual ID. This technology will empower D6 to sound an alarm when a stranger breaks into the house but not when a pet runs in from an open window. 


Milestone 6:  Vision Enhancement

After performing several image and video analysis tests, the team assessed that the limitations of low cost camera components had a significant impact on the A.I.'s ability to learn and navigate the surrounding environment. Through the development of two distinct algorithms, one centered around image de-noising, and the other around lighting enhancement, however, these limitations where reduced to a minimum.   




The example above shows an image taken with an old, inexpensive cellphone. The picture at the top is riddled with noise caused by the poor lighting environment. As the A.I. processes it, employing both the image de-noising and lighting enhancement technologies, however, the image quality becomes comparable to that of the same picture, shot at the same time, but using a high-end DSLR camera.  

In the works

The team is currently working on milestone 7, 8 and 9.


Milestone 7:  The Digital 6 App

This milestone will be achieved upon completion of the Digital 6 application. Currently, the projected timeline to reach this milestone stands at approximately 8 months (~April 2016)

Milestone 8:  The Digital 6 Camera: Home Security

This milestone will be achieved upon completion of the Digital 6 home security camera software integration. Currently, the projected timeline to reach this milestone stands at approximately 12 months. (~August 2016)


Milestone 9:  The Digital 6 Camera: Wearable

This milestone will be achieved upon completion of the Digital 6 wearable camera software integration. Currently, the projected timeline to reach this milestone stands at approximately 24 months. (~August 2017)

 FAQ

Where does the name “Digital 6” come from?

Through many years of evolution, humans have developed five senses: sight, hearing, taste, smell and touch. Our ambitious lifelong artificial intelligence dream is to use our technology to give humans the ability to tap into a sixth sense, which is not biological but digital.


Is Digital 6 similar to Google Now?

Yes, both Digital 6 and Google Now are intelligent virtual personal assistants designed to offer you recommendations. Both applications take advantage of location and online information. Only Digital 6, however, is equipped with an integrated camera. With state-of-the-art image recognition technology, D6 leverages the camera’s inputs to offer you ever more personalized recommendations.


Can I speak to Digital 6? (Is voice input supported?)

Yes, Digital 6 will be equipped with a speech recognition module.  


How often will D6 offer recommendations? Will their frequency be annoying?

The team realizes that everyone has different preferences. The settings menu was designed with that notion in mind, allowing you to set the frequency as well as the type of notifications you care to receive. 


What is the current stage of the development?

Development of core technologies, such as image recognition and neural network artificial intelligence has been completed. The team has successfully prototyped many of D6 core functions on mobile devices and development boards. With your support, D6 will become a commercial, off-the-shelf product. Before beginning production, however, the team would treasure your input. The recommendation engine has been successfully developed and tested on web based applications.  Its implementation into mobile applications shall be completed next. Developments for the Android application are currently ahead of their iOS counterparts. 


Will the images captured by D6 be stored on your server?

No, D6 will only use the images on-the-spot to offer you real-time recommendations. The images, however, will not be saved. Home security future offerings may include cloud services to store such information. 

 

Will you sell personal data and GPS information to third-parties?

No, the D6 team treats privacy very seriously and will not sell or give away user information to any third-party.


Will D6 work in the dark / at night?

D6 will be unable to work in a pitch-black environment. The presence of a dim light, however, such as that of a street lamp's, will enable D6 to operate at full capacity.   


Will the camera water-proof?

While the camera will be able to withstand life in the outdoors, such as exposure to raindrops and snow flakes, it will cease to function if placed under water. 


Risks & Challenges

The process of taking a technical device from prototype to mass production is complex and time-demanding. This is especially true when a lot of innovation is built into a digital product. 

From finding the right Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) partners, some of whom the team has already identified and engaged with, to complying with FCC and CE certification standards, a task often delayed by lengthy quality control and approval processes, the challenges can be many. 

With a vast patents and publications portfolio, and experience ranging from coding complex algorithms to developing novel technologies, however, the D6 team is not only committed to overcoming all hurdles, both foreseen and unforeseen, but also prepared to do so most effectively.   

Support from the IndieGoGo community will be instrumental as D6 morphs from an abstract concept into a reality.
