The D6 companion camera is highly functional, serving as your second set of eyes to help you navigate through your busy day.




The camera’s functions include:

The ability to learn about your immediate environment
The ability to keep track of your belongings -  alerting you if you are about to leave an item behind
The ability to locate misplaced items - such as keys, glasses or even your wallet
The ability to detect faces - such as those of your friends and family





Tentative Specs


The Digital 6 Technology
To deliver results, the most advanced VPAs employ the use of predictive analysis. However taking advantage of users’ geographical location, search terms, and web browsing history alone limits these VPAs’ ability to generate accurate predictions, as they remain blind to the interactions taking place amidst the users' surroundings.  Furthermore, in an effort to learn user behavior, traditional VPAs habitually store massive quantities of personal data in the cloud - a practice that continues to raise privacy concerns and fears of cyber-attacks.  





To prevent any privacy issues, D6 will not be collecting and storing your entire digital footprint like most personal assistants currently do. D6 will take the camera's input and your location information to quickly learn your preferences and deliver accurate recommendations.  To further mitigate privacy concerns, our team has developed additional technology that has the dual benefit of giving D6 an extra layer of encryption to protect all sensitive data, and also allowing it to map and access your preferences quickly in order to improve the relevance of its recommendations.



We Need Your Help

We are asking for $200,000 to acquire the proper equipment to prototype the camera before production. Current tests have been run using cellphone cameras and development boards, and have proven to be successful; we are ready to begin implementing the technology into a compact camera. Before we finalize on a production model, we would like to obtain fan feedback and additional inputs on the camera and its design, to deliver a product that not only users like, but that will also help them become more efficient. The funds raised will go directly into implementing your suggestions into the final product.  

The Perks
Indiegogo supporters will receive an exclusive Indiegogo version of D6 at a discounted price. 



The D6 T-shirt




Other Ways You Can HelpWe would love to hear your input on the camera and its application. What improvements would you like to see as developments progress? If you share our vision we would love your support. Please share our campaign with all your friends, we shall be most grateful.  

Development and Timelines

Progress and Milestones

Over the past year our team has been developing and testing the core technology that will make D6 a reality.

Milestone 1: Image recognition



     


We trained the A.I. to analyze images for a
short period of time. We then proceeded to test its learning capabilities. After downloading random images from the internet, we then let the A.I. process them using a
short analysis time frame to simulate real time interactions. In the above example, the A.I. successfully determined the animal species in the picture in less than thirty seconds. 



Milestone 2: Enhanced Analytical Abilities


We trained the A.I. to successfully recognize never before seen images. The team then developed the A.I's linguistic and analytical capabilities.



                  

To test the A.I.'s enhanced analytical abilities, the team employed images such as the one depicted above. The A.I. was able to simultaneously recognize a person, the color of the person's shirt, and the plane in the background. Additionally, the A.I. wrote a sentence describing the picture in detail. 


Milestone 3: Item Location Mapping

To help D6 better navigate its environment, the team
developed additional technology allowing it to track the position of
different items from pictures taken at different angles. 


              


This technology does not only help D6 keep track of your items, but it also gives D6 access to the elusive depth dimension, allowing it to learn and navigate the world more efficiently.


Milestone 4: Mobile Device Integration
To simulate the D6 camera, the team integrated the A.I. into a smartphone. 


The above demo shows the A.I.'s analytical capabilities in real time. While the A.I. had never previously seen these specific objects, it demonstrated its ability to accurately recognize them nonetheless.  The demo also confirms the A.I's ability to be integrated into low power devices.


Milestone 5: Video Analysis

Upon achieving mobile device integration, the team
proceeded to develop and test the A.I.'s video analytics capabilities, which
will play an integral role in its home security applications. 





In the demo above, the A.I. successfully detected and assigned a
unique ID number to the car entering the driveway as well as the one driving
passed it. This technology will be employed to not only recognize familiar
vehicles, such as those belonging to friends and family, but to also alert of
unusual circumstances, such as those that could arise when an unknown van is detected loitering in front of a house.  






In the above demonstration, the cellphone camera zoomed in to record the
concluding moments of a soccer match, just as the players begin to walk out of the
field. The results capture high levels of video noise. Yet, even within the confines of poor quality footage, the A.I. recognized and tagged the different soccer players and assigned each of them an individual ID. This technology will empower D6 to sound an alarm when a stranger breaks into the house but not when a pet runs in from an open window. 

Milestone 6:  Vision Enhancement
After performing several image and video analysis tests, the team assessed that the limitations of low cost camera components had a significant impact on the A.I.'s ability to learn and navigate the surrounding environment. Through the development of two distinct algorithms, one centered around image de-noising, and the other around lighting enhancement, however, these limitations where reduced to a minimum.   



The example above shows an image taken with an old, inexpensive cellphone. The picture at the top is riddled with noise caused by the poor lighting environment. As the A.I. processes it, employing both the image de-noising and lighting enhancement technologies, however, the image quality becomes comparable to that of the same picture, shot at the same time, but using a high-end DSLR camera.  






In the works



The team is currently working on milestone 7, 8 and 9.

Milestone 7:  The Digital 6 App

This milestone will be achieved upon completion of the Digital 6 application. Currently, the projected timeline to reach this milestone stands at approximately 8 months (~April 2016)


Milestone 8:  The Digital 6 Camera: Home Security
This milestone will be achieved upon completion of the Digital 6 home security camera software integration. Currently, the projected timeline to reach this milestone stands at approximately 12 months. (~August 2016)


Milestone 9:  The Digital 6 Camera: Wearable
This milestone will be achieved upon completion of the Digital 6 wearable camera software integration. Currently, the projected timeline to reach this milestone stands at approximately 24 months. (~August 2017)


 FAQ


Where does the name “Digital 6” come from?
Through many years of evolution, humans have developed five senses: sight, hearing, taste, smell and touch. Our ambitious lifelong artificial intelligence dream is to use our technology to give humans the ability to tap into a sixth sense, which is not biological but digital.


Is Digital 6 similar to Google Now?
Yes, both Digital 6 and Google Now are intelligent virtual personal assistants designed to offer you recommendations. Both applications take advantage of location and online information. Only Digital 6, however, is equipped with an integrated camera. With state-of-the-art image recognition technology, D6 leverages the camera’s inputs to offer you ever more personalized recommendations.

Can I speak to Digital 6? (Is voice input supported?)
Yes, Digital 6 will be equipped with a speech recognition module.  

How often will D6 offer recommendations? Will their frequency be annoying?
The team realizes that everyone has different preferences. The settings menu was designed with that notion in mind, allowing you to set the frequency as well as the type of notifications you care to receive. 

What is the current stage of the development?
Development of core technologies, such as image recognition and neural network artificial intelligence has been completed. The team has successfully prototyped many of D6 core functions on mobile devices and development boards. With your support, D6 will become a commercial, off-the-shelf product. Before beginning production, however, the team would treasure your input. The recommendation engine has been successfully developed and tested on web based applications.  Its implementation into mobile applications shall be completed next. Developments for the Android application are currently ahead of their iOS counterparts. 

Will the images captured by D6 be stored on your server?
No, D6 will only use the images on-the-spot to offer you real-time recommendations. The images, however, will not be saved. Home security future offerings may include cloud services to store such information. 
 
Will you sell personal data and GPS information to third-parties?
No, the D6 team treats privacy very seriously and will not sell or give away user information to any third-party.

Will D6 work in the dark / at night?
D6 will be unable to work in a pitch-black environment. The presence of a dim light, however, such as that of a street lamp's, will enable D6 to operate at full capacity.   

Will the camera water-proof?
While the camera will be able to withstand life in the outdoors, such as exposure to raindrops and snow flakes, it will cease to function if placed under water. 


Risks & Challenges

The process of taking a technical device from prototype to mass production is complex and time-demanding. This is especially true when a lot of innovation is built into a digital product. 
From finding the right Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) partners, some of whom the team has already identified and engaged with, to complying with FCC and CE certification standards, a task often delayed by lengthy quality control and approval processes, the challenges can be many. 
With a vast patents and publications portfolio, and experience ranging from coding complex algorithms to developing novel technologies, however, the D6 team is not only committed to overcoming all hurdles, both foreseen and unforeseen, but also prepared to do so most effectively.   
Support from the IndieGoGo community will be instrumental as D6 morphs from an abstract concept into a reality.

story:
So what do we have here...

           We have a two part campaign that facilitates moving an idea of ours forward while creating an entrepreneurial environment for the Hopi Nation. The Hopis have lived in North America longer than any other group of people. We have dubbed our project the Spider Initiative to pay homage to the Hopi Spider Woman, who is the Mother of Creation in their belief system. An outgrowth and added benefit of our project will also create an opportunity for other enterprising individuals to start their own businesses by using the finished product from the joint venture.

(MORE EXPLANITION VIDEOS IN GALLERY)

First things first, what is your idea?

        The creative spirit in us allowed us to create the definitive mobile on-site garment screen printing machine. Almost anyone can operate this machine anytime and anywhere, and create quality multi-colored shirts the right way. Everyone who has witnessed and experienced the process has loved it. Experimentation and practical use has now perfected the process and  created the ProfitPrinter mobile on-site printing machine.


What happened next?

         People started asking us to sell them one of our mobile on-site printing machines. We heard from Guam, Nova Scotia, Florida, England, New York and many more places. No advertising, just word of mouth.

So, is that why we are here?

         Exactly. People around the world started asking to buy something we build and were willing to pay good money for it. And as I said, with no advertising. We have built the machines ourselves for years and now have an inspired idea to create a production facility and do massive good at the same time. But we need your help.

Is this where the Hopi Nation comes in?

         We have worked with the Hopi Nation for years doing garments and events. The Hopi people are incredibly gracious, talented, and creative people. In fact the word Hopi means peaceful. Their unique spiritual culture has survived in these harsh lands for over 1500 years. They have fought off the Spaniards, Mexicans, and other tribes to live on and cultivate their farming-based society. Yet, since the intervention of the U.S. Government, they have watched their proud and honorable ways disappear and be replaced by social programs. There is little industry on their land to keep the young, talented and educated students home to keep their culture and beliefs flowing. The Hopis are facing what a millenneum and more of aggression could not accomplish, the decimation of their beliefs and ways. There is little to fill the economic needs of their citizens, both young and old.

         So, rather than build our machines through the standard channels, we have talked with the Tribal Council and asked them if they would like to create a small production facility to build ProfitPrinters not only in America, but by the original natives of our land. Not only can they build our machines, but they can fabricate other items that will be of use by their people. Made in Hopi, by Hopis, for Hopis. The main focus is to create a culture where people learn to embrace the entreprenuerial spirit and take ideas and create their own opportunities once again. Then we will take the model that they created and share it with others who need a chance to succeed.

Is this where I fit in?

         In order to help the Hopi people and to build our machines, we are asking your help in funding the project in a grass roots manner. The Hopis have found a workable building to convert and we have assembled an ambitious group to make it become an actuality. We still need the following:

Inventory as in steel, motors, heaters, etc.

Shop Renovation and retrofitting.

Equipment/welders and such.

Training in both business and welding practices.

Website creation and management.

Powder Coat Booth implementation.

Miscellaneous Expenses such as andministration, travel, etc.


So...what is the bottom line?

            In order to get the project bare-bone funded, we need your help in raising at least $22,000 USD to renovate and get the basic equipment in place. To build it out completely to where they have the powder coating capabilities and are completely self sufficient to use the shop to build other items for the nation will be $65,000 USD. We are asking for the minimum to make sure we have the process moving forward and then we will continue to push the rest along. Of course the more we raise, the quicker we get the project rolling to make money and create opportunity.

What happens when you meet your goal?

        Nothing but good things, with hard meaningful work. Our crew will partner with the Hopi crew to take a 100 year old building and turn it into a functioning production facility. This means painting, plumbing, electrical, and all the good stuff. Then we add the safety guidelines, and we start teaching people who had no creative outlet to create.

        It might not be the cheapest way for us to build the machines, but it IS the right way to do them. We believe that businesss only works if everyone wins. Then, the Hopis start building ProfitPrinters and other items such as railings, handrails, and canopies.

What is ProfitPrinter exactly?

       Good question. It is a go anywhere, 4 color portable screen printing machine with its own infra-red conveyor oven built right in to take care of any printing needs in remote locations. Why would you need that? Because there are tens of thousands of opportunities to print directly at events. That not only saves you inventory problems, but earns you full retail price for your shirts -and it's mostly cash. Your event host does not need to worry about buying ahead of time, design and inventory costs, and bad weather. It frees them up to do what they do best. It's a classic win-win situation.

These machines look like the could be fun and profitable...

         That they are! If you like freedom in your life, enjoy traveling a bit, and like to talk to new people, then they are a kick in the butt. Plus you make serious change doing it.

If I donate, can I look into getting one?

         We would appreciate the donation, but you can learn about the process regardless. We are actually looking for interested self-motivated people to help us create an on-site printing network across the United States and Canada. So, sure we would love to talk to you.

Is there a lot to learn?

         There definitely is a learning curve, but we have created resources and classes to teach anybody to do it. If you use our MissingLink web platform, you can even have the artwork at your disposal for cheap or even free. Easy Peasy.

What is this MissingLink thing?

        MissingLink is a web based printing/embroidery platform we are building to eliminate the dysfunction and inefficiency in the screen print and embroidery business. We want to include the availability of a network of on-site screen printers to the users as well. That is where the Hopi project merges with the MissingLink.

You guys arent messing around...

        We take this stuff serious because we KNOW with your help we can do better and help others out at the same time. Our ultimate goal is to put value and compassion back in business. We are hell-bent on getting it done.

Is there anything else?

           Probably, but we don't want to bore you with the minor stuff. If you want more info regarding any of this please contact me, Alan Poh, at ShirtsInk@gmail.com. I will be glad to answer your questions or just talk about the process.

           Please donate if you can and we will send you some neat and value-packed perks to say thanks for helping many people reach their goals. Also, please use the PayPal option if you can as it greatly speeds up the distribution of funding.


Kwak Khah!

story:
Short Summary

With web and mobile technologies reaching the corners of our personal lives, one would expect help and rescue to be a blink away but with information distributed all over the web it becomes increasingly difficult to access the information when needed. This problem is more pronounced when the information needed is crucial for women suffering from domestic abuse. We aim to address this problem by creating a freely accessible database containing the details of all the reliable shelters for women across the country state-wise. This database would prove to be useful for the Protection Officers, Police Officers or service providers aiming to help the women under abuse or the victim herself.


Challenges

  • Most of the organizations that have set up shelters in India do not have a strong online presence. Therefore, we need to go through each state’s approved service providers manually.

  • Now with the country being divided into 30 states, more attention should be given to cities as well as rural areas.

  • Internet has not yet permeated to rural India where most of the population resides. Therefore, we need to create a method to make this database accessible to everyone.


The Impact

  • Primarily, the funds would be used to support Chayn India’s research group who’ll be hired particularly to collect information about women shelters more accurately and effectively.

  • Any and all remnants of the funds raised from the campaign will be added to the Chayn Empowerment Fund which will be used in emergency situations when women who approach Chayn seeking support, shelter or help


Other Ways You Can Help 

If you can't contribute to the campaign but would like to help us out, you can do so by:

  • Spreading word about the campaign by using the hashtag #SpreadChayn
  • Encourage your friends and family to visit Chayn India.
  • Join us as a volunteer by signing up at Chayn Volunteer sign up.

About us

CHAYN is an open-source project that leverages technology to empower women against violence and oppression so they can live happier and healthier lives. Running solely on the passion of skilled volunteers, it is also a pro bono service to charities who work with vulnerable women.


Everything that Chayn does has originated in a burning passion for gender equality and for the emancipation and empowerment of women against overwhelming tides of patriarchy, oppression and abuse. We stand proudly with the Open Source movement to create, distribute and benefit from a culture and society of free knowledge. All our materials are licensed underCC 4.0(SA).


Contact Chayn at team@chayn.co | +91-888-4616-122

http://chayn.co | @chaynHQ | facebook.com/chayn

Incubated at CIVA [UK Charity number: 1122095]

story:
Short Summary

The Primitive Studio, LLC was formed in June 2015 to fill a creative void in our community, and address our collective need for inspiration.  Our goal is to create an innovative and artistic environment in which people can discover the wonder and beauty of their imaginations. The Primitive Studio will  provide a unique environment for artists and patrons alike to be immersed in a new, unexpected experience combining 3D digital media production with traditional theater.  

What We Need & What You Get

The Primitive Studio is seeking $9,000 in start up costs. This funding will enable the studio to complete renovations of the performance space, to purchase needed equipment for stage and video productions, and to implement a sales and marketing plan to establish a presence in the community.  In addition to live performances, The Primitive Studio also provides space for:

⦁   Art/Gallery Showings
⦁   In-house workshops for digital media production, acting, costume design, and     stage production
⦁   Training seminars
⦁   Private functions

The Impact

The Primitive Studio is located on South Main Street in the SoMa Art District of Gainesville, Florida.  Revitalization of the city's core along South Main Street has picked up, and many parking lots and underutilized buildings are being developed and restored to blend in with existing historic structures.  This revitalization has attracted both young and older consumers to the area. The building that houses The Primitive Studio was built in the 1930's and has recently been restored.  The location provides a unique, atmosphere for workshops, seminars, or rehearsal space as well as a showcase for art and live performances. 

The Primitive Studio will provide the Gainesville and surrounding communities with a unique center of innovation to experience the arts on a whole new level and expand their imagination and creativity.

The Primitive Studio's founding executives are comprised of the following high-caliber professionals whose experience and drive will create an immensely imaginative opportunity for the company:
  
Co-founder and Theater Director, Sam Richardson, is receiving his Bachelor of Fine Arts in theater and acting at The University of Florida.  Sam is a Gainesville native, and having grown up here, he has close ties to the community.  He has been an active supporter and performed in many of our local community theater productions. Sam feels confident that the impact of The Primitive Studio will be an extraordinary, unique reflection of Gainesville's identity.

As co-founder and Digital Media and Sound Production Director, Iver Thue brings a Studio and Video Production degree from The Art Institute and 6 years of digital production experience to The Primitive Studio. He has directed film, video and animation projects for many local and national clients.   Iver is also a  professional musician, and has toured the country performing in live shows and in the studio since the late 1990's. 

Lisa Demanuel, co-founder and CEO, has over twenty years of experience in production design, marketing, public relations, and business management.  She began her career traveling around the country coordinating hair and fashion shows for Aveda, Revlon, and Clairol.  Since coming to Gainesville  she has worked as an Account Executive for an advertising firm, and was the Marketing and Promotions Director for a local radio station where she helped to launch Radio Disney in the Gainesville market.  Lisa will be instrumental in our community outreach programs, business management, and will add her creative touch to The Primitive Studio.

Risks & Challenges

The City of Gainesville is a known supporter of music and the visual arts.  Although,  Gainesville is home to three active main-stage theaters and a performing arts center, there is not a viable, local venue for artists to showcase what they do and the chance to share it with the local community.

While our area has a lot to offer culturally, we know there are certain risks involved in any venture of this kind. That being said, we strongly believe we bring a unique and transcendent experience to our cultural and artistic landscape. The Primitive Studio will push the boundaries of production and performance. We have already
scheduled two main performances and numerous workshops for the space beginning in late June 2015.  We have a short film in development, and two web based tutorial series to produce.  Work on our first projection mapping insulation is in the animation phase and we have two gallery exhibits in the works for late summer, early fall.  We feel confident we will be profitable within 3 months of opening our doors if not sooner.

But, we need your help!  we can't do this without start-up funds to finish renovations of our space and open the doors. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Anyone can help! If you can't contribute financially you can donate items and or volunteer your time or skills to help us build and grow!
story_txt:
Short SummaryThe Primitive Studio, LLC was formed in June 2015 to fill a creative void in our community, and address our collective need for inspiration.  Our goal is to create an innovative and artistic environment in which people can discover the wonder and beauty of their imaginations. The Primitive Studio will  provide a unique environment for artists and patrons alike to be immersed in a new, unexpected experience combining 3D digital media production with traditional theater.  
  What We Need & What You Get The Primitive Studio is seeking $9,000 in start up costs. This funding will enable the studio to complete renovations of the performance space, to purchase needed equipment for stage and video productions, and to implement a sales and marketing plan to establish a presence in the community.  In addition to live performances, The Primitive Studio also provides space for:⦁   Art/Gallery Showings⦁   In-house workshops for digital media production, acting, costume design, and     stage production⦁   Training seminars⦁   Private functions   The Impact The Primitive Studio is located on South Main Street in the SoMa Art District of Gainesville, Florida.  Revitalization of the city's core along South Main Street has picked up, and many parking lots and underutilized buildings are being developed and restored to blend in with existing historic structures.  This revitalization has attracted both young and older consumers to the area. The building that houses The Primitive Studio was built in the 1930's and has recently been restored.  The location provides a unique, atmosphere for workshops, seminars, or rehearsal space as well as a showcase for art and live performances.  The Primitive Studio will provide the Gainesville and surrounding communities with a unique center of innovation to experience 
the arts on a whole new level and expand their imagination and 
creativity.The Primitive Studio's founding 
executives are comprised of the following high-caliber professionals 
whose experience and drive will create an immensely imaginative opportunity for the company:    Co-founder and Theater Director, Sam Richardson, is receiving his Bachelor of Fine Arts in theater and acting at The University of Florida.  Sam is a Gainesville native, and having grown up here, he has close ties to the community.  He has been an active supporter and performed in many of our local community theater productions. Sam feels confident that the impact of The Primitive Studio will be an extraordinary, unique reflection of Gainesville's identity. As co-founder and Digital Media and Sound Production Director, Iver Thue brings a Studio and Video Production degree from The Art Institute and 6 years of digital production experience to The Primitive Studio. He has directed film, video and animation projects for many local and national clients.   Iver is also a  professional musician, and has toured the country performing in live shows and in the studio since the late 1990's.  Lisa Demanuel, co-founder and CEO, has over twenty years of experience in production design, marketing, public relations, and business management.  She began her career traveling around the country coordinating hair and fashion shows for Aveda, Revlon, and Clairol.  Since coming to Gainesville  she has worked as an Account Executive for an advertising firm, and was the Marketing and Promotions Director for a local radio station where she helped to launch Radio Disney in the Gainesville market.  Lisa will be instrumental in our community outreach programs, business management, and will add her creative touch to The Primitive Studio. 
  Risks & ChallengesThe City of Gainesville is a known supporter of music and the visual arts.  Although,  Gainesville is home to three active main-stage theaters and a performing arts center, 
there is not a viable, local venue for artists to showcase what they do 
and the chance to share it with the local community.While our area has a lot to offer culturally, we know there are certain risks involved in any venture of this kind. That being said, we strongly believe we bring a unique and transcendent experience to our cultural and artistic landscape. The Primitive Studio will push the boundaries of production and performance. We have already scheduled two main performances and numerous workshops for the space beginning in late June 2015.  We have a short film in development, and two web based tutorial series to produce.  Work on our first projection mapping insulation is in the animation phase and we have two gallery exhibits in the works for late summer, early fall.  We feel confident we will be profitable within 3 months of opening our doors if not sooner.But, we need your help!  we can't do this without start-up funds to finish renovations of our space and open the doors.  
  Other Ways You Can HelpAnyone can help! If you can't contribute financially you can donate items and or volunteer your time or skills to help us build and grow!

story:
This fund was started in order to support independent reporting in Burundi following weeks of political turmoil. During the protests and subsequent coup of April-May 2015, ALL of the independent press houses, radio stations, and web sites were taken off-line or physically destroyed in Burundi, leaving only the state-run RTNB. Many reporters and citizens continue to use social media and their telephones as communication tools in absence of independent media. This campaign will help provide for the necessary phone credits and other tools to help citizen journalists, independent journalists and others in Burundi to spread information, especially those in the under-reported rural areas. 

ALL funds will be dispersed to citizen journalists and observers in Burundi who ask for contributions to their phone accounts. There is no service fee or collection charge, and the services Ding and Prepaid Union will be utilized.  

With the lack of independent media, rampant spreading of rumors and crackdown by Burundi's government, the need for different voices across Burundian society, across the country and across other divisions has never been greater. By providing the means to provide information to both fellow citizens in-country as well as the outside world, the impact of the work of these reporters will be magnified greatly. 

Please share this project widely, and tweet, share on Facebook, WhatsApp, and other social media platforms. 

We also encourage you to follow the events of Burundi's unfolding election cycle on twitter and see your contributions in action.

story:
City of Angels Residential will provide help and care to developmental disability (DD) client's in the day to day life of the client's. This company assists the client's with their hygiene, meals, budgeting, medicine, appointments, transportation and any action's that the client's may need. City of Angels Residential Services will advocate for the client's when needed.

I was a Direct Care Giver/Professional Manager/Supervisor and currently working for Grand River Residential as a House Manager for a developmental disability house. I'm looking to open over 10 developmental homes. With the hard work of the team, the expansion of the business is attainable.

I was raised with a handicapped sister and helped my mother to start the first workshop for the developmental disable in the Raytown, Mo area until I went into the Army. In the Army I worked covert operation against terrorist and confidential narcotic cases. I came home from the Army and opened a kennel with my wife which we ran for over 28 years while still working full time. I worked as a police officer for about 8 years undercover and on the road as assistance chief of police of a small town. I went to work for Fairmont Dairy where I started from the ground floor and worked my way up to Plant Manager where I led and developed around 60 personnel. I was associated with Missouri Baptist Children Home, the DD Home County Haven for the past 13 years. For the past 7 years, I was a Direct Care Giver/ Professional Manager/Supervisor. I'm currently working for Grand River Residential as House Manager as House Manager for a DD house.

City of Angels mission statement is we will provide services and supports which are outcome focused, person centered, comprehensive, and integrated to the greatest extent possible, which encourages and supports each individual in maximizing their quality of life.

City of Angels Residential Services will promote the highest quality of clinical, supportive, and rehabilitative services so that each individual and safely and effectively meet their support needs. Our mission statement explains our passion in helping DD individual's to live life as close to normal as they can safely.

story:
Campaign Service Announcement

First, we’d like to thank you for taking the time to learn more about the PRIDE Gentleman’s Barber Lounge (“PRIDE”) crowdfunding campaign. As you make your way through our campaign information, you’ll get a feel for the atmosphere, culture, level of service, and the overall unique PRIDE grooming experience. PRIDE also recognizes that we are operating in significantly different times and although we have a defined target market, we acknowledge and embrace the fact that as a result of the ever changing and evolving family unit…women are quite often finding themselves taking the young men in their lives to the barbershop now a days.

We want to make it explicitly clear that the PRIDE environment and culture is one that embraces diversity on all levels and our focus is on providing everyone that walks through our doors with a unique environment and grooming services that are second to none.

PRIDE Gentleman’s Barber Lounge Overview

PRIDE offers the ultimate curated grooming experience, providing its clients with world-class grooming services in a unique, captivating, and relaxing lounge-like atmosphere. The materials and fixtures used in our interior design process, highly skilled barbers, branded apparel, grooming products, and beverage collection has been hand selected to exemplify the PRIDE brand and a grooming experience that is second to none.  

Simply put…PRIDE is taking traditional male grooming to the next level by delivering a truly unique grooming experience. 

PRIDE's Business Philosophy

Professionally Responsible In Delivering Excellence that’s our philosophy and it’s based on the legendary Golden Rule of “treating people as you want to be treated.” Building and maintaining a thriving, healthy, loyal and satisfied customer base is the pinnacle of our business model and the most critical factor in our overall success. PRIDE’s ambiance, culture, products, and services have all been tailored to provide our clients with a professional atmosphere where world-class grooming services and products are the standard. In addition to making our clients look good, our amenities will also provide our clients with the opportunity to conduct business, socialize, or simply relax and recharge while enjoying our lounge-like atmosphere and their beverage of choice.  

Our Story

Many barbershops have become a place filled with less than acceptable customer service, a lackluster approach to maintenance and cleanliness, and an atmosphere that leaves a lot to be desired. How many times have you entered into a shop looking for your barber...or any barber for that fact, you stand at the front for minutes on end and right before you’re about to do an about face and walk out, someone grunts and points to a sign-in sheet, yeah you guessed it...the grunt translates into, “you need to sign in.” That’s unacceptable and that’s your introduction to their shop, really? You deserve more, and more is the standard at PRIDE.

For centuries, the barbershop was more than a place to just get a haircut or shave. Its served as a hub of the community where men came together to socialize, bond, and exchange ideas on a myriad of topics. That communal camaraderie, old-fashioned quality, customer service, and passion for creating an environment that fosters this level of interaction is hard to find.

PRIDE effectively fills this void with a modern and multicultural approach. Whether you’re stopping in for a cut and a shave, to have a drink, or just to enjoy the environment and amenities. From the time that you arrive, you'll take notice to the modern decor, brushed steel fixtures, stained concrete flooring, leather couches, wall art, unique sculptures, and flat screen televisions all highlighting the fact that PRIDE is as much a place to meet, talk, relax, and do business as it’s a place to get a haircut.

PRIDE offers a superior alternative to the sports themed, super, fantastic salon/barber chains that you’ll find in your local strip mall. Generally speaking, the majority of the individuals working in these salons are cosmetologist whose training is geared towards catering to women’s hair and using scissors, not clippers…the main tool used in cutting men’s hair! PRIDE has highly skilled and experienced barbers trained to service any hair type and texture with the highest level of quality.

Customarily, PRIDE barbers will ask you questions about your day, how you’d like your haircut, daily grooming regime, and any changes to your hairstyle that you’d like to make. Leveraging their industry training and experience, our barbers are able to provide you with advice on a wide range of grooming/styling topics and issues. These additional steps taken by our barbers to get to know their clients and foster open and effective communication are all geared towards creating a look that you can take PRIDE in, and establishing a long lasting relationship.

Grooming Services, Products, and Apparel

At PRIDE, our grooming services and products are the cornerstone of what we do and who we are as a company. PRIDE embraces the fact that we live in an extremely diversified society by servicing all demographics. Our barbers are trained and experienced in every aspect of barbering and styling services for our multicultural clientele.

Services Offered:

  • Hair: traditional and modern haircuts and styles,  one step hair color, highlights, corrective color, hair and scalp treatments

  • Shaves: hot lather straight razor shaves, hot towels, beard maintenance, and balm treatments

  • Additional Services: facials, eyebrow shaping, bigen restoration, massages, etc.

Grooming Products

One of PRIDE’s main objectives is to assist you in furthering your personal brand and giving you a look that you can take PRIDE in. In order to accomplish our objective, it’s essential that we provide our clientele with professional grooming products that do the job and do it right. Therefore, we’ve hand selected shampoos, conditioners, and shaving supplies from the tried and true brands below.

Brands to be offered:

Community Involvement

PRIDE has a vested interest in the communities in which we will operate...our contributions to the community will transcend our brick & mortar locations. It’s extremely important to us to actively support the local community in which we live and work. Annually, we will participate in the following philanthropic activities and/or non-profit organizations:

  • Back to School Fundraisers (i.e. free haircuts, backpacks, and school supplies)

  • Dress for Success Worldwide

  • Local Food Bank and Pantry

  • Future Business Leaders of America

  • Relay for Life Fundraising

  • Salvation Army, Holiday Angel Gift Program, etc...

What’s Next, Why We’re Here, and How Can You Help

What’s next...PRIDE is in the strategic execution stage of our concept and brand. We are assembling an “execution team” comprised of experienced interior designers, contractors, suppliers, and project managers with defined roles and responsibilities in their respective areas. This execution team is responsible for defining, developing, and executing a streamlined, duplicateable, and efficient model that transforms existing structures and/or spaces into an environment that exemplifies the PRIDE brand.  

Meeting or exceeding our funding goal would position us one step closer to establishing and opening our flagship location in the Greater Tampa Bay Area. In essence, the PRIDE concept is about being far more than just another barbershop…it’s about connecting with people, our community, and creating something that we all can take pride in. PRIDE is a place where “male grooming” refers to much more than just our superb cuts and a shaves…it also refers to the pursuit of what it means to be a true gentleman, not only in appearance but mind, body, and soul as well.

Why we’re here...is because we need YOU to make this dream a reality! 

How can you help...I know, that’s a loaded question. We recognize that there are various opportunities for assistance outside of financial contributions alone. Whether you chose to support our campaign financially or not, getting the word out to your social circles of influence and making others aware of the PRIDE Gentleman’s Barber Lounge campaign via the Indiegogo platform is just as important as any monetary contribution and appreciated just as much. Sharing our campaign information increases our chances of reaching people, groups, and organizations that we alone would never reach.

In closing with the highest level of sincerity...PRIDE Gentleman’s Barber Lounge would like to THANK YOU in advance for your contribution and the time that you provided in support of our campaign. 

“You don’t beat the competition at their game. You redefine the game.”

-Steve Jobs

story:
About More Than Just Great Coffee

We are combining our passion for coffee, community and youth to empower underemployed young people to be successful in life and the workplace.  We believe that every person, as a unique human being, should have every opportunity to succeed.  Our goal is to begin offering youth internships to equip young people with employment skills, life skills and job experience while roasting ethically sourced coffee.  

Please watch our video and consider contributing to help The 517 Coffee Company go beyond just great coffee.  Thank You!


Our Story

This all started several years ago while working with inner city youth in Lansing, MI. We began to hear story after story of the difficulties of finding employment as well as the desire to work.  Many teens and young adults we talked with expressed the need to support themselves, their families, to stay out of trouble or to just move forward in life.  The very real obstacles they faced boiled down to a couple of primary issues; job experience and employment training.  The truth is, these issues are not unique to the Lansing area.  The current unemployment rate for youth across America is 19% with the inner city being some of the toughest areas for young people to find employment.  You can read more on this topic at the links below.
http://www.washingtonpost.com/news/storyline/wp/2014/10/27/4968/
http://www.pbs.org/newshour/extra/daily_videos/job-market-toughest-for-inner-city-teens/

 

A little over a year ago The 517 Coffee Company was born.  As parents, aspiring business owners and members of our community, we set out with a goal to just do something, no matter how small, and do it well.  We invested what we had and continue to invest to sustain our business and work towards our social mission. 

Today we are poised to move forward with our social mission.  To make that happen we are looking to raise funds for two things.  
1) A commercial roaster ($7,000-$8,000). Currently we are roasting with home equipment, turning out 8oz. of fresh roasted specialty coffee every 35 minutes.  With a commercial roaster we are looking to increase production to about 5 pounds every 15 minutes.  This will allow us to keep up with demand, increase our sales volume and profits so we can re-invest in youth internships and employment opportunities.  
2) Funds to begin offering paid internships ($2,000+).  We are extremely motivated and excited to roll out our first youth internship this summer.  Internships are for the benefit of the intern not our business.  Our internships will be focused on learning together what is needed for each individual intern to be successful.  Together we will discover individual strengths, passions and goals.  We will equip our interns with employment and life skills like: resume building, interviewing skills, professional etiquette, work ethic, personal finance and social responsibility.  

Please consider helping change the lives of Lansing Area youth by contributing and/or sharing this campaign with your friends and family.

Peace,

James Defrees

Currently we are roasting with home equipment, turning out 8oz. of fresh roasted specialty coffee every 35 minutes.  With a commercial roaster we are looking to increase production to about 5 pounds every 15 minutes.  This will allow us to keep up with demand, increase our sales volume and profits so we can re-invest in youth internships and employment opportunities.  

2) Funds to begin offering paid internships ($2,000+).  We are extremely motivated and excited to roll out our first youth internship this summer.  Internships are for the benefit of the intern not our business.  Our internships will be focused on learning together what is needed for each individual intern to be successful.  Together we will discover individual strengths, passions and goals.  We will equip our interns with employment and life skills like: resume building, interviewing skills, professional etiquette, work ethic, personal finance and social responsibility.  
Please consider helping change the lives of Lansing Area youth by contributing and/or sharing this campaign with your friends and family.Peace,James Defrees

story:
After few visit to Dubai prison in U.A.E ,my eyes was filled with tears hearing the stories of inmate,of all class, the criminal the incriminated and the victims.

 A mist all was a shocking revelation that most of them having finished serving their sentence, but are still there because they have no return tickets home with unite with their families and love ones.

So I have taken it as burden to visit them counsel them and assist them with return tickets to their respective country.Most prisoners abroad are assumed dead by their family due to disconnect in communication .

 Please support  me put a smile on a families face again today. No amount is small. 

Thank you

story:
WHO ARE WE?

We are a team of scrappy, change-driven humans, each with personal experience around misdiagnosis and chronic or terminal illness.

JP: Background in finance, marketing, and sales.

JESSE: Background in small business and design. 

COURTNEY: Background in small business and education. 

JASON: Background in finance and corporate management. 


WHAT ARE WE?

Crowdcuring is an independent company founded by J.P. Davitt, who was frustrated by his own chronic health issue—Lyme’s Disease—and the thousands of dollars and hours spent to educate himself, resolve symptoms one at a time and find solutions to finally feel better after struggling through the better part of a decade.

Crowdcuring.com is a powerful, free online resource to help people gain a better understanding of their health while also providing a platform for people to share experiences and best practices.

We’ve built a state-of-the-art algorithm and platform to cut through the clutter, to present information in bite size pieces, and to pair you up with other people dealing with similar health concerns. In layman’s terms, we’ve combined a search engine, an online dating site, and a social media platform into a secure, safe place for all of us to share and resolve our symptoms.


We believe by:

  • making people aware of healthier choices,

  • providing the ability to learn from others, and

  • having better data to help doctors be more effective,

we enable people to be become one day better each and every day.


Crowdcuring opens up the dialogue of healing and breaks down social barriers so the subject of sickness is no longer taboo, but we need your help to do it. The money you contribute will go to the third and final phase of development for the Crowdcuring platform. We are currently in stage two and we need your contributions to continue production, development, and testing. We are looking for many different levels of contributors. Even if you don’t have the ability to contribute monetarily, sharing this campaign goes a long way. Let’s start Crowdcuring together!


WHAT AM I FUNDING?

Our goal is to keep Crowdcuring free for all users. This means free of a monthly subscription and free of influence from a major corporate donor.



We are looking to raise $150,000 over the next 40 days. We will spend $68,000 on development and production to complete the platform and its supporting algorithm. Part of the development and testing requires us to purchase approximately $32,000 in equipment and hosting to keep the site safe, secure, and functioning. The remaining $50,000 will go to research and testing. This testing phase is extremely important, and will help us deliver the best possible product to you. Additional funding, or stretch goal contributions, will go to implementation and quicker rollout of the platform and supporting products. Time is money, and every dollar speeds up the process. Let’s start running!


PERKS!

First, and foremost: THANK YOU!!! Just showing up and reading this far is a huge help to our campaign.



Second, our Contribution Perks are a first look into Crowdcuring.

New


The t-shirts and totes, along with surprises included for stretch goals, will only be available through this campaign. Your support means the world to us and many others as we struggle to find answers. Rewarding you with something special is our way of saying thanks for the help!



Feel proud, you are making a difference in the world!

At the $95 level and higher, you’ll receive an exclusive, signed, first edition copy of JP’s journey detailed in the Betterbook.



For a $4,995 donation or higher, we’ll give you JP! But really, JP will speak at your organization, church, backyard bbq; best friend’s wedding, you name it. Use this perk to have JP talk about the project or simply pick his brain. It’s up to you!



$9,995. This is the motherload of perks. You get all of the things, plus permanent recognition on the Crowdcuring.com platform. Your name will forever be listed as a founding contributor to this groundbreaking project. Think of it as your moment to sign a declaration of wellness. You are a high rolling, mastermind!



Even if we don’t reach our goal, we will still use every dollar raised to fund production, research, and testing of our platform and its supporting algorithm. We won’t let a lack of funding stop us from moving forward. Even if this is an uphill both ways kind of project, we’ll walk it, in the snow, every day, until it’s done.


WHAT'S THE SECRET SAUCE?

We believe by making people aware of healthier choices, creating hope through community, and providing a safe, secure one-stop shop for all your health charting needs, will change how we all interact with medicine. 


Patient ownership of daily actions will:

  • increase awareness,

  • increase personal responsibility, and

  • decrease the epidemic of learned helplessness.


Not only does our platform empower patients, but it also helps doctors be more effective in the short time they have with each patient, enabling the physician and patients to partner. This allows each of us to become one day better each and every day.

Our project is about empowerment. Our goal is to save you time and money and to build community. Consider every time you’ve gone searching for an answer to your symptoms online. How often did you find a scary and unreliable answer? Instead of asking a web bot, why not reach out to your community of like-minded, caring people?

While our project is state-of-the-art and unique in the market, at its heart, Crowdcuring is a simple notion: People helping people. That said, our team brings the needed math and business expertise it takes to build and maintain a large, free online platform.


WHY CROWDCURING?

What if you were sick? What if everywhere you turned for answers, you were met with fear, confusion, and loneliness? Here at Crowdcuring, we’ve personally been there. JP and Courtney have both been chronically ill for years. Jason and Jesse have family members who’ve suffered through chronic and life-threatening illnesses. We understand how it feels and what it takes to find answers and support, and we’re here to make life easier. After all, we each deserve an enjoyable, happy and healthy life.


WHAT ABOUT THE FUNDING, AGAIN?

The Crowdcuring team is a small, scrappy band of entrepreneurs. We have decades of experience in small business, corporations, and startups between us. Everyone is working tirelessly to reach our goals.

Every bit of funding brought in by the campaign allows our team time to focus on the production and testing instead of seeking out investments. Crowdfunding the contributions to this campaign keeps the mission and drive of Crowdcuring pure of investor influence and focused on our mission to facilitate people helping people.

We are in business to break down health care barriers and to facilitate independent medical research for years to come.


HOW CAN I HELP?

Don’t feel like you can’t contribute: You can! Share your frustration with the state of health care. Share hope!

Sharing is caring, folks! Even if you don’t have money to contribute, simply clicking share and posting us to your social media and email lists goes a long way.

No Facebook? Easy peasy. Just share with ten people through email, text, or call them up.

If you share with ten friends and they share with ten friends each, the growth is exponential. So, do it! Make like a virus, and be contagious.

Remember, share this campaign like the flu at a college party, and give it to everyone you know! Follow the links below to connect with us on Facebook, Twitter, and YouTube.

And, lastly,

THANK YOU. NO, SERIOUSLY. THANKS!

Big time high fives and hugs from the Crowdcuring Team. You rule!

story:
Dear Friends in Slacklining,

I’m a keen slackliner and slackline equipment developer. I made several prototypes of slackline equipment, which we've been using for years with group of friends in the Outdoor Inhales Team.

Many years of experience in rigging longlines and highlines led us to the final concept.

Now we proudly present the ZERGE product range – safe, functional and high quality equipment.



ZERO - the ultimate solution for a leash ring.

The main function of this new concept is to shape and support the loop of the leash, and protect both the webbing and the leash rope from abrasion damage.

The leash rope fits into the U-shaped channel of the ring in order to avoid direct contact with the webbing. Compared to other rings, ZERO’s contact area with the webbing is much bigger which means that the forces are equally distributed on the webbing.

When the leash rope is not exposed to additional tension, the accessory cord keeps it secured in its place. In a fall situation the additional tension tightens the rope around the ring, therefore keeping it firm without any chance of slipping away.

It arrives with an accessory pouch, for safe keeping. And just a small tip - in case you forget or lose the accessory cord for Zero you can always use the one from the pouch.


The way ZERO is designed to distribute the load is allowing it to be more compact.  For additional safety it is forged from a solid block of high-strength stainless steel, which makes it extremely durable and bomb-proof and still lighter than many other steel rings on the market.

Want to go ultralight? In this case ZERO BLACK is perfect for you. It’s machined from 7075 aircraft quality aluminium alloy with hard anodized finish for additional strength, endurance, and wear resistance. It weighs less than 80 grams, which is less than half of the weight of the lightest steel ring on the market. It’s really a “must have” piece in every ultralight system.

The concept for MINI is to be compact and highly-efficient rigging pulley system at the same time. Compared to the common 5:1 pulley system setups with 9-11mm diameter ropes this pulley system is 9:1 and is designed for the 8mm RIG STATIC rope.

In other words, the system needs more rope with a reduced diameter. Effectively the system weighs the same but the rigging is almost two times more efficient.

Using the triple, double and simple pulleys as multipliers you will be able to rig more than 100-meter-long line on your own.

The force is better distributed, there is less load on the rope brake which makes the system safer. The brake’s special design allows high-performance when rigging but also much better control over the rope when releasing.

The side plates, axles, bolts, shackles and maillons are made from high-strength stainless steel. The highly efficient bearings are also made from stainless steel for maximum safety and durability.

The webbing anchors are made for 25mm polyester or polyamide webbings. These heavy-duty anchors also provide safe rigging for longlines over 100m. The 28mm diameter middle roller is made from hard anodized 7075 aluminium alloy. It is secured with an extra bolt to make its use safer, and prevent from turning around under high loads, which can make the webbing slip off. Because of its big diameter the roller makes the locking with the webbing highly efficient.

The front pin is made from high-strength stainless steel and has a quick release button for easy use. It makes the rigging and pre-tensioning a lot easier.


This lightweight rope has been especially designed for longline rigging.

We reduced the rope diameter which made it much lighter and at the same time this did not affect its performance. We are using a high quality polyester with an improved structure with very low stretch and high strength properties. In effect the rope has high performance in rigging and it’s easier to control in the brake because of its good grip characteristics.

The rope cover is also made from polyester which protects it from abrasion and UV exposure. The rope is heat-treated for additional elongation reduction.

RIG STATIC is developed especially for the MINI pulley system, but it can also be used together with other pulleys. This rope is made for rigging, DO NOT use it for climbing!


Do you want to protect your equipment and keep it organized anytime? ZIP is an improved rope bag optimized for longline and highline rigging. It’s a perfect storage for your MINI rigging system, but it is also suitable for other pulley systems.

Inside the bag there are four pockets which purposefully keep the equipment separate and prevent from wearing out. The rest of the space can be occupied by up to 100 meters of 8mm or 60 meters of 10.5mm diameter rope and they can be firmly secured by straps. Additional straps are provided outside so you can attach the spansets, webbing or other parts of the gear to them. ZIP can also protect your equipment when it’s rigged.

The base fabric we are using is durable and highly resistant to abrasions, tears and scuffs. The Acetal buckles have excellent tensile strength, stiffness, surface hardness and chemical resistance. Their physical properties remain consistent across a wide range of temperatures, relative humidity, and weather conditions.
Produced in cooperation with Lupusbag.


LINK is a versatile and lightweight stainless steel webbing anchor for 25mm polyester or polyamide webbings. This heavy-duty anchor also provides safe rigging for longlines over 100m.

It has a rear attachment hole with 18mm width and 16mm diameter. It is designed to work with 1.5t and 2t WLL steel anchor shackles and also with stainless steel shackles. The side plates, axle and bolts are made from high-strength stainless steel.

The 28mm diameter middle roller is made from hard anodized 7075 aluminium alloy. It is secured with an extra bolt to make its use safer and prevent turning around at high loads which can make the webbing slip off. Because of its big diameter the roller makes the locking with the webbing highly efficient.

The front pin is made from high-strength stainless steel and has a quick release button for easy use. It makes the rigging and pre-tensioning a lot easier.

SKIP is the first full Stainless Steel highly efficient webbing pulley on the market. Suitable for 1inch / 25mm wide flat webbings. It can be used as a multiplier in an Ellington tightening system or as a transport pulley.

All the parts including the high-performance bearings are made of stainless steel for maximum safety and durability. It is guaranteed that the bearings won’t get rusty and damage the surface of the webbing. Compared to other aluminium pulleys it’s much more resistant to abrasion caused by the wedding. There is an additional 4mm diameter cord hole on the side plate which helps you to attach and store your gear.


*Note that the final products will be the same as seen on the 3D models and there will be further engravings of safety instructions (not shown in the pictures).

Materials we use

The physic of Slacklining and its variations, is different compared to any other sport. A properly set up and tensioned longline has a static load equivalent to 500-1200 kg and on top of it there is an additional dynamic stress when somebody is walking or jumping on the webbing.

In many cases people tend to use inappropriate equipment, which is not produced and/or tested for slackline use, such as aluminium carabiners and pulleys often used for climbing. These are rated for one person weight only and usually exclude the additional tension load of a longline, even though their tested tensile strength is over the expected load.

Aluminium is a rigid material. Once you drop an aluminium equipment from a larger height you cannot fully trust it any more, as the stress from a drop can cause invisible cracks in its structure.

Yield strength of aluminium (the stress at which a material begins deforming plastically) is close to its ultimate tensile strength (the force under which the material brakes) and its elongation before break is just about 11%. In a case like this, it’s not possible to note if your equipment is overloaded before it fails.

For your safety we have decided not to use aluminium parts in cases where these parts are continuously exposed to heavy loads and additional dynamic loads.

Stainless steel’s tensile strength is pretty much the same as the 7075 aluminium but its yield strength is much lower, therefore the elongation at break is about 50-70%. This means that when you overload your system the deformation would be noticeable, as a result of the system not being used properly. Visible deformation appears much before it fails so you can note that. This way, it’s easier and safer to follow the history of the equipment and make the decision about trusting it in the future.

Aluminium has been used in cases, where there are no big dynamic forces. We use 7075 high strength aluminium alloy, used in climbing equipment, as well as aircraft construction and bicycle parts. All of these aluminium parts are hard anodized which adds more durability to them and brings their properties closer to those of hard faced or case hardened steel.

The main parts which will be exposed to heavy loads are constructed from high strength stainless steel (1.4301 and 1.4571). These are durable, and everlasting materials that match the outdoor use and increase safety.

The combination of these high-tech materials makes ZERGE outdoor equipment perfect for slacklining.

Shipping

We are shipping worldwide and we are already in contact with the various courier services to provide you the best prices and fast shipping. International backers will be responsible for applicable tariffs and customs fees, as well as shipping around July, 2015. We are Please contact us to get shipping prices to your address.

Risks and Challenges

We are already in contact with the various manufactures and suppliers, for the production of individual parts, and with a network of international shipments. They are prepared for the production. We will start the production and send you the items as soon as possible.

Publications and reviews

*Note that the final products will be the same as seen on the 3D models and there will be further engravings of safety instructions (not shown in the pictures).




Materials we use
The physic of Slacklining and its variations, is different compared to any other sport. A properly set up and tensioned longline has a static load equivalent to 500-1200 kg and on top of it there is an additional dynamic stress when somebody is walking or jumping on the webbing.
In many cases people tend to use inappropriate equipment, which is not produced and/or tested for slackline use, such as aluminium carabiners and pulleys often used for climbing. These are rated for one person weight only and usually exclude the additional tension load of a longline, even though their tested tensile strength is over the expected load.
Aluminium is a rigid material. Once you drop an aluminium equipment from a larger height you cannot fully trust it any more, as the stress from a drop can cause invisible cracks in its structure.
Yield strength of aluminium (the stress at which a material begins deforming plastically) is close to its ultimate tensile strength (the force under which the material brakes) and its elongation before break is just about 11%. In a case like this, it’s not possible to note if your equipment is overloaded before it fails.
For your safety we have decided not to use aluminium parts in cases where these parts are continuously exposed to heavy loads and additional dynamic loads.
Stainless steel’s tensile strength is pretty much the same as the 7075 aluminium but its yield strength is much lower, therefore the elongation at break is about 50-70%. This means that when you overload your system the deformation would be noticeable, as a result of the system not being used properly. Visible deformation appears much before it fails so you can note that. This way, it’s easier and safer to follow the history of the equipment and make the decision about trusting it in the future.
Aluminium has been used in cases, where there are no big dynamic forces. We use 7075 high strength aluminium alloy, used in climbing equipment, as well as aircraft construction and bicycle parts. All of these aluminium parts are hard anodized which adds more durability to them and brings their properties closer to those of hard faced or case hardened steel.
The main parts which will be exposed to heavy loads are constructed from high strength stainless steel (1.4301 and 1.4571). These are durable, and everlasting materials that match the outdoor use and increase safety.
The combination of these high-tech materials makes ZERGE outdoor equipment perfect for slacklining.

Shipping

We are shipping worldwide and we are already in contact with the various courier services to provide you the best prices and fast shipping. International backers will be responsible for applicable tariffs and customs fees, as well as shipping around July, 2015. We are Please contact us to get shipping prices to your address.


Risks and Challenges


We are already in contact with the various manufactures and suppliers, for the production of individual parts, and with a network of international shipments. They are prepared for the production. We will start the production and send you the items as soon as possible.

Publications and reviews

story:
Please Give!

Contributions from this crowdfunding campaign will go toward defraying the costs of putting on the BirthKeeper Summit in order to keep our ticket prices as low as possible for all to attend! This is an opportunity to support a grassroots movement for ground-breaking social justice, even if you cannot attend the BirthKeeper Summit, April 30-May 3, 2015 at Berkeley City College, CA.

Why do you want to give to the BirthKeeper Summit, 2015?

You're a visionary. You want to change the culture of birth. You care about the environment. You care about the future generations whose world and well being are being affected by our current societal systems. You know that if MotherBaby MotherEarth was considered first that 'We would substitute profit and greed and power and control with love, and sharing and caring."  as Vendana Shiva has said.

You are supporting intimate & honest discussions on ways of being on our beautiful earth that protect mothers, babies, families, the environment – the whole ecosystem.

Come to the BirthKeeper Summit 2015, April 30-May 3, at Berkeley City College, CA to meet leading visionaries, people who are trail blazing cutting edge ideas in the area of women’s rights, environmental rights and human rights …you’ll learn something new and you’ll get connected with a community of like minds to make social change happen.


MORE INFO:

Purpose of BirthKeeper Summit

Calling out to unify with others who resonate with the role of BirthKeeper. Inviting already existing, acting and self-described BirthKeepers to help build this movement as well as offer education and support for what is needed to build it locally and globally. Convening of aligned groups and social activists. Inform about our world’s current situation. Inspire change. Train and launch actions. Create community. 

Strategies of BirthKeeper Summit

1. Attract birthworkers and those in the continuum of prevention: environmental health,social activists, reproductive health, rights activists: to Healing/Repair:therapists, medical professionals: to Lifestyle: attachment parenting, fathers,modern women, youth, grandparents.

2. Numbers of attendees -on site and virtual:regional, affiliated groups, aligned groups, industry segments.

3. Program and Speakers tied into values and strategies.

a. Clear statement of current situation, witnessing to current dominator system and its harmful effects- oppression, abuse and violence. Understanding of problems.

b. Inspirational healing solutions being done or planned or envisioned.

c. Interactive, experiential, virtual, tedx short lectures, small groups, pathways, keynote speakers, panels, workshops, celebrations,music, art, enabling convening of specific groups, central gathering spot.

4. Action oriented. Non-violent training for action and holding actions vs dominator systems

5. Affordable for all: scholarships, keep fees low,venue is public commons.

6. Collaborative- include all organizations who want systemic change.

7. Sustainable-staffing supported as financial resources are available. Affiliated groups can generate revenues.

8. Inclusionary of frontline populations in decisions, committees, outreach efforts and program.

9. Clear goals and plans for outcomes, what will be different in the world?

10. Creation of sacred space and support of individual heart intelligence of attendees.

11. Joyful, fun, engaging arts as container for participation in expansive ways of understanding BirthKeepers strategies and values.


BirthKeeper Summit

April 30- May 3, 2015

Berkeley City College, Berkeley, CA
