story:
Project ThunderStruck.

Our Mach 1.5 Glider will Open the Door to Sending Payloads Cheaply to Space.

We are building spacecraft to make that possible we need to conduct test flights. The first flight is a supersonic glider that is set to break the sound barrier and coincidentally, world records. This is not a spacecraft, but essential for the next phase. We are also launching it from nearly half way to space. The craft is designed to easily break the sound barrier for supersonic and transonic tests and is expected to reach Mach 1.5 or nearly 2,000kph / 1,250mph. That is fast and designed to capture the world's imagination. It is also to prove the reliability of our systems our remote control pilot will be an accomplished 13 year old who will be firmly on the ground. If he gets into difficulties, The craft will take over and automatically land itself.

The glider will be flown in Australia later in the year and you can be in the virtual cockpit during the record breaking flight, seeing what the pilot is seeing. Be there as we topple world records and test our systems ready for building our spacecraft - a winged re-entry vehicle. All of this takes time and money, but the money is small and the time is now.

Hi, I am Robert Brand and I have worked in space communications and space industry for most of my life and as an aerospace engineer for the last few years. I worked on Apollo 11 communications, Voyager encounters for NASA and ESA's Giotto mission to Halleys comet. I have an award for Shuttle STS-1 support that was personally given to me by Commander John Young.

We have a great team behind the project and there is one member that you really need to meet. He is the Mach 1.5 remote control glider pilot: Jason Brand. He is 13 years old and will fly the fastest small craft privately built and he has done much of the design work! He will even create a sonic boom! Why a 13 year old pilot? Because we are building the X-2A systems to be very responsive. We know that even a 13 year old will be able to control and fly the craft. It is a demonstration in its own right. It is also a testimony to STEM education. 

Above: Jason's appearance on Australia's Sunrise TV program.

Please check out our full team in the team info tab as they are the key to our success. Despite the fact that Jason has the final say on design, the team offers suggestions, does a lot of the higher level maths (thanks Todd) and finds the problems in the design and mission profile so that we eliminate failures points. Many of us have been working on earlier space mission projects. We have the skill set to ensure success.

Robert, Jason and many in the team also launch high altitude weather balloons. They release them, track them and recover the scientific payloads. Robert & Jason have conducted 23 flights and recovered all 23 payloads with a world record of 100% recovery.. These flights often make it to 33.3km altitude. That is 1/3 the way to space. We plan on using that experience to carry out test, much the same as NASA used the X craft to test and create the space shuttle.

We can't afford massive aircraft like a B-52 to get us to altitude and we can't afford to build craft like the X-15, but we don't have to nor do we want to. We can achieve supersonic  flights for under $20,000 once we are set up and we can even get a payload to space for under $60,000 (sounding flight). We are expecting that to be our second flight. Of course setting up for the first flight and refining the subsequent systems is more expensive and that is why we are flying our craft that we have code named the X-2A.

How can we Help Each Other?

We need to raise A$80,000, but you also get the Rewards

Here are some of the big items we need:

  • 2 x Zero pressure balloons A$40,000 (half the budget)
  • 2 x GPS capable of greater than Mach 1.5  A$20,000
  • 2 x Radar transponders A$10,000
  • The rest: Helium A$2,000; travel A$3,000; Airframe A$2,000; Civil Aviation Safety Authority Fees A$1,000 and more.

There is a lot more that we need and we are hoping that your generosity will raise more than the A$80,000. The Perks that we have organised will be great and some items may one day become valuable as we will grow to become an important player in the space sector. Check out the rewards in our Perks section!

When we set up a space company based on these flights, your name will be displayed on an entrance wall as a contributor to the success of the X-2A flight.

What will we achieve?

Although the funding is for the first flight that is essential for the next stage - the flight to space, you will be directly contributing to designing spacecraft. Along with the balloon, stage 2 we expect will be a sounding rocket flight above 100km - the internationally recognised start of space.

  • This will cut costs to micro gravity experiments, especially those needed in the manufacture of important medicines and new science experiments.
  • It will also show the importance of STEM education. 

The ThunderStruck spacecraft that results from this will be very different. For those that understand flight/space. the wings will have dihedral and lift. The X-2A has neither. The spacecraft, when used as a sounding craft launched from a balloon will have a rocket in its tail. It will also have a lifting body and cold gas thrusters to keep it controllable in space. The sounding craft version will only need minor heat shielding and its design will make it reusable.

This Video will Help Explain the X-2A Project

We recently were on the Australian Channel 7 Sunrise Program with a 5 minute interview. There are a few errors, but it will explain a lot. Remember, the launch is Sept 2015 and we are not building a manned craft. We see the niche business as one of building a space courier business. We take it up or bring it back! Enjoy the interview with these things in mind.

CLICK HERE to watch this amazing 5 minute video as seen on Television

Note that the date in the video was meant to say "September" for our launch. We are also talking about a space courier operation - not manned flight.

Note that the video shows our starting model. The X-1. We started with a chunky, small winged craft and allowed the maths and science to create the ever so sleek X-2A. The "A" is because we did a few tweaks after publishing the design of the X-2 version.

Desktop Testing

The world understands flight dynamics better than ever and the world creates aircraft using desktop testing. So do we. Want to see a small video of one test. It scans the vehicle as a single moment in time and shows the pressure waves. In fact it was this video that caused us to "tweak" the X-2 design. We noticed some pressure waves bouncing off the winglets.


We also tapered the rear end of the craft to lower Base Drag. More on that in our updates.

Do We Have What it Takes?

The answer is YES for many more reasons than the few below, but these points address the biggest hurdles:

  • As mentioned earlier we have an enviable track record in balloon flights to the stratosphere and experience in building aircraft and flying them remotely.
  • Robert Brand has been a glider pilot and worked in support of many space programs.
  • Robert also has the a huge communications background, including communications with spacecraft.
  • Robert and Jason both have Amateur Radio certificates and Robert works with Extreme Radio systems in challenging environments.
  • Our Sponsors and Supporters think that we have the "Right Stuff": Australia's Defense Scientific and Research Organisation and the enormous support of Hobbyking are two of the reasons that make this a reality.

Risks & Challenges

The risk is simple. If we fail on our first attempt. We have factored that into the budget and will simply correct the problem and fly again. The 3.5m / 11.5ft craft will be also tested as a small model with a ducted fan for propulsion. It will be flown to 120m / 400ft and allowed to glide for testing. It will then be flown back for more tests.

  • We have designed the craft using desk top modelling and our own spreadsheets, developed for this unusual flight. The refinements show us the lowest drag and pressure differentials making for a great design that simply feels right!
  • We have eliminated the chance of it pulling out of the dive by removing the lift form the wings and making the craft symmetrical in any cross-section nose to tail.
  • We have a great support team and we are collecting a huge amount of data from sensors on the craft. That will be sent to the ground in real time and recorded and also recorded on board in our own "Black Box". The system will allow us to refine the design and overcome any problems

Other Ways You Can Help

We would ask that you contribute anything from $1 to whatever you can afford to create a huge opportunity for new competition in the space sector; a 13 year old to create a "sonic boom"; and to make world records tumble, opening new doors for student and youth that believe that they can make a difference. If you can't space a dollar, please do one or both of the following

  • Get the word out and make some noise about Project ThunderStruck.
  • Remember that you can use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks for taking the first part of the journey to space with us. Please consider supporting us as this is a wild ride driven by imagination, innovation and the right people.

story:
Did you know that it costs an average of $1.50 more per day for an individual to eat a healthy diet based on fresh fruits, vegetables and lean protein? (2013 Harvard Health Study)

When you have little or no money to begin with, that amount is well out of reach. 

At The Gathering - a community meal program in Milwaukee - we are working to bridge this gap through our Fresh Produce Preservation Project (FPPP). 

Begun in 2010, the FPPP perfectly complements The Gathering’s mission to feed the hungry and to do so with respect and dignity.  We take produce donated during the growing season, use as much as possible in our daily meals, and preserve the rest through freezing and canning for use in our winter meals. The scraps are then composted.

Increasing the amount of fresh fruits and vegetables in our meals, increases the nutritional value and food options available to our guests, and helps bridge the healthy eating gap between those with means and those without.  It also promotes good stewardship of resources.


Since its inception the FPPP has grown and expanded its sources of produce, supporters, volunteers, tools, and methods of preservation.  But we need your help to keep this project alive.

Thanks to a grant from the Marquette Hunger Clean-Up Campaign we have $3,000 dedicated to the 2015 FPPP.  We need an additional $8,000 to hire a seasonal project manager, purchase preservation supplies, transport product, recruit and support volunteers, and contribute to kitchen and food storage expenses.  Dollars can be designated for the Fresh Produce Preservation Project or for general support of our Community Meals. 

Will you help?

Our goal for this online campaign is to raise $3,000 of the amount needed. Every donation no matter how big or small, counts.

CLICK HERE for more information on the Fresh Produce Preservation Project.

E-mail beckylong@thegatheringwis.org or call 414-272-4122 with questions/comments/suggestions

**EDIT: in the perk category labeled, "$50" the text reads, "Donate $100" whoops! This is an error. The $50 perk still stands for $50. Thanks!**

story:
Who we are and what we do

We are the FusionWorks team and we are in search of funds to support us in continuing the development of BashWorks, an online service that will both help users understand the command-line usage of various programs and aid developers in designing simple and easy-to-use guides for their products.

Having previously worked on building integrated solutions for Big Data analysis, we would like to help common tools reach a larger audience by auto-generating the command needed to run them in a terminal.

How does it work? It’s simple - you access a friendly interface that helps you select the needed options and prefil the available fields, then, at one click of a button, we generate the command that you would paste to the terminal. If you develop a tool, don’t bother documenting its various options and arguments - just describe a simple interface using our tool editor and let your users figure it out themselves.

Does

blastn -task blastn -db $BLASTDB -i $BLASTQUERY_FILE -evalue 1e1 -gapopen -1 -gapextend -1 -xdrop_ungap 20.0 -xdrop_gap 30 -xdrop_gap_final 50 -window_size 0 -word_size 11 -searchsp 0 -num_descriptions 100 -num_alignments 100 -penalty -3 -reward 1 -culling_limit 0 -out $BLAST_OUTPUT -outfmt 5 -dust yes

look confusing? 

Of course it does! And it should, because, honestly, no sane person should spend time on learning letters in order to understand that without pulling their hair.

Or maybe you feel like you could relate to this situation:

that could have turned out entirely different had Randal Munroe’s characters bookmarked BashWorks earlier.

You might have heard of Gooey and Wooey, so did we, this is why BashWorks is easier to use and as an online service. The code above could be easily obtain through our Blastn UI

Right now, BashWorks has just the basic functionality. With your help we will add new working tools, allow them to be embedded as widgets, improve the existing features and add new features.


What we need

We need money, that’s why we’re here. With $20,000, we will be able to:

  • Create more content: cover most popular and confusing command-line tools, as well as those requested by our users
  • Extend functionality - create a widged that could be embeded to other pages
  • Build a lightweight and easy-to-use tool editor, that will do most of the tool creation work itself

Risks & Challenges

Whether we reach the target sum or not, any contribution will be invested in project development. BashWorks is already alive and we’re working on it, so you take no risks in investing in a project that would never get to see daylight.


Other Ways You Can Help

We are open to any ideas and suggestions - if you think there is something else we can do, tell us and we might even take that into consideration, if we feel kind enough on that given day. Write to us on info@fusionworks.md.
story_txt:
Who we are and what we do
We are the FusionWorks team and we are in search of funds to support us in continuing the development of BashWorks, an online service that will both help users understand the command-line usage of various programs and aid developers in designing simple and easy-to-use guides for their products.
Having previously worked on building integrated solutions for Big Data analysis, we would like to help common tools reach a larger audience by auto-generating the command needed to run them in a terminal.
How does it work? It’s simple - you access a friendly interface that helps you select the needed options and prefil the available fields, then, at one click of a button, we generate the command that you would paste to the terminal. If you develop a tool, don’t bother documenting its various options and arguments - just describe a simple interface using our tool editor and let your users figure it out themselves.

Does

blastn -task blastn -db $BLASTDB -i $BLASTQUERY_FILE -evalue 1e1 -gapopen -1 -gapextend -1 -xdrop_ungap 20.0 -xdrop_gap 30 -xdrop_gap_final 50 -window_size 0 -word_size 11 -searchsp 0 -num_descriptions 100 -num_alignments 100 -penalty -3 -reward 1 -culling_limit 0 -out $BLAST_OUTPUT -outfmt 5 -dust yes


look confusing? 


Of course it does! And it should, because, honestly, no sane person should spend time on learning letters in order to understand that without pulling their hair.

Extend functionality - create a widged that could be embeded to other pages


Build a lightweight and easy-to-use tool editor, that will do most of the tool creation work itself


Risks & Challenges
Whether we reach the target sum or not, any contribution will be invested in project development. BashWorks is already alive and we’re working on it, so you take no risks in investing in a project that would never get to see daylight.

Other Ways You Can Help
We are open to any ideas and suggestions - if you think there is something else we can do, tell us and we might even take that into consideration, if we feel kind enough on that given day. Write to us on info@fusionworks.md.

story:
Lavender Syrup – Taste of summer

Lavender Syrup is an organic lavender extract made by a unique recipe. You can use it for making refreshing beverages, spicing up your tea and coffee, and it is also perfect as a cocktail ingredient. If you like to, you can even try it with cookies, fruit mixes, and ice cream. Feel free to experiment, the only limit is your imagination. There are some tips on our Facebook page, or if you choose to support us, you can receive a special recipe collection.


We started lavender growing in 2010. Thanks to the ideal soil and climate, our first attempts were successful, so we started to multiply our plants. Years after years, we have managed to increase the number of our lavender plants, which are the key ingredients of our organic Syrup.



In 2013, after the first harvest, we started our brainstorming sessions. We asked ourselves, what kind of product we should create of our lavender plants. We intended to create a cutting edge product that no one had ever seen before. After a couple dozen ideas, it suddenly hit us. Why don’t we make a Lavender Syrup?

Later on, we started experimenting. After trying more than 50 approach and production technology, we believed we have found the One. The next phase was testing. After several focus group researches, we finalized the recipe, what managed to preserve the natural taste and scent of lavender. When you pop up a bottle, you can feel the scent of a fresh lavender straightaway, and no matter if you are making a beverage or food, you can always taste the unique flavor.

Since we didn’t have our own production line, we needed to find a factory, where we could produce the first line of products. After a long searching period, we managed to find a factory, which met all of our criteria, so we struck a deal with them.

In the meantime we designed the image of the brand, and engineered the package of our products. The production process was successful, and more than a 100 consumers have already tested the product since then. So far, we have only received positive comments.


We truly believe that we created an appealing product, so we started our Indiegogo campaign with several goals. We would like more people to meet our product, and recognize the potential inside Lavender Syrup. In order to accomplish that, we need to set up a global distribution line. Besides of our own sales force, we need to find new distributors and retailers. We also need to find partners for logistics, so we could properly transport and store our products in order to serve every distributor and retailer.


When you are going global, the first thing you need to do is to start mass production. At first we plan to hire a production line temporarily, and in the second phase, we intend to start our own factory.

We are also planning on improving the product by making it more perfect, and also focusing on finding new ways utilize our lavender plants. At last but not least, our goal is to increase the number of the plants, so we would be able to meet the growing demand for Lavender Syrup.


Thank your for your time, we hope you like our Lavender Syrup. Taste it, find your own way to use it, and share it with our community! See you around!

story:
It has been developing, since 2013, the urban regeneration project in the Castelo and Colina da Sé quarter, in Lisbon city, in a participative process involving population both in the definition of its’ objectives as well as in the prosecution of the work. The project denominated Moralá Castelo, encompasses a series of strategies that seek to contribute to rejuvenation of the neighborhood.

The team are architects, designers and sociologist.  We intend to enhance urban rehabilitation and recover of spaces with emerging needs, like the communitarian building to develop lots of activities with the local populations and interact with the visitor.  In parallel we will organize events related to architecture, design, arts&crafts, music, cinema and poetry.

We put together a multidisciplinary team and created a non-profit association, with which we will give the first steps (FAS) and helped the foundation of another non-profit association: https://www.facebook.com/hacastelo?fref=photo

We feel it is fundamental to have as partners the Lisbon City Hall and the Architects Association, without which it will be difficult to implement this project. And other local institutions.

We already have a space where we are developing the pilot project, which will be the test to continue this initiative. But the spaces needs renovation.

For any further questions about the project and for volunteering please check our facebook page and the website.

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Fundo-de-Arquitectura-Social/255760977893363

www.fundoarquitecturasocial.pt

About
Architecture Social Fund, created from the contribution of local partnerships, corporate sponsorships, individuals and volunteers, for the execution of construction projects at no cost for those who do not have the required economic resources (individuals or institutions).

Mission
Carry out construction projects and contribute to improve the city’s urban environment, the inside of people houses or any institution’s public space, and public spaces in the historical center of Lisbon City.

Company Description
Nonprofit organization that aims to promote the rehabilitation, redevelopment, preservation, rehabilitation and intervention of facades, parts of buildings, interior of homes and public or private areas of public buildings, with the help of an Architecture Social Fund.

Description
Parallel activities (local partnerships):
Organisation of seminars / informal discussions about architecture in public squares or local institutions.
With the conclusion of each project, a street performance will be carried out by an artist, which will reflect on the community. Other events: Local Marcket, Cultural and Turistic Guide, Arts ans cultural Activities for adults and kids, free Cinema in the afternoon, manufactures products made by locals with help of Designer teams.

General Information
Any architect or other can offer his/her work at any given time, in order to contribute to the fund  with voluntary work.

story:
The money will go to repairing the property, windows, and several undisclosed problems with the home we have found out. One being no insulation in the walls or floors, yes you hear me correctly a home in Canada with no insulation. Very costly to heat and on a pention its impossible.

We have a long road here and any help is greatly accepted to make life safer for my parents.

My Mom and Dad have given me everything to have a good life and and never say no to anyone looking for help and now I want to do the same for them.

I am on bended knee asking the good people out there to help a great Mom and Dad anything is welcome if funds are a problem we are taking supplies or hands on approach as well
what is $1-$2 going to do for you, coffee?, get together with a few friends and pool your change and drop it all here you will be helping a great deal feel free to e-mail brewerbanks@hotmail.com for information

Thank you
Trevor

story:
Bikers Against Child Abuse (BACA) has been established to eradicate fear, protect children, and make sure that perpetrators can no longer intimidate or threaten their victims.

They exist as a body of Bikers to empower children to not feel afraid of the world in which they live. They stand ready to lend support to our wounded friends by involving them with an established, united organization. They work in conjunction with local and state officials who are already in place to protect children. They desire to send a clear message to all involved with the abused child that this child is part of their organization, and that they are prepared to lend their physical and emotional support to them by affiliation, and their physical presence. They stand at the ready to shield these children from further abuse.

Last year, I had the opportunity to ride with them during their 1st 100 Mile Ride, and I'm so excited to join them again this year.

These men and women are hard-core advocates who volunteer so much of their time and energy out of love for these little ones.

Your support will make sure that a child who has suffered and been abused will be wrapped up, protected, and cherished!

Every year, BACA raises funds that will go towards:

  • Child assistance funding
  • Abuse prevention brochures
  • Memorabilia for kids they visit such as leather vests, stickers, coloring books, patches and temporary tattoos

I am so excited to partner again with this amazing organization. I am profoundly inspired by the amazing work they are doing to make children safer, stronger, and heard in a world where they so often go unnoticed, are re-traumatized by the system, and go without justice.

Don't take my word for it though -- check them out:



So what are you waiting for? Get my butt on the backseat of a Harley and make a huge difference in the life of a child. Thank you so much for your support!


With love and gratitude,

story:
Short Summary

Led by Ryan LeStrange and Jennifer LeClaire, AwakeningTV.com is a digital broadcasting network that delivers modern and historic messages of revival and awakening to the body of Christ.

Your donation could light a fire that sparks revival that leads to an awakening in the body of Christ!

AwakeningTV.com will deliver programming that is inspiring, informative, revelatory, and stirs its viewers to press into what God is doing in this hour. We will offer live streaming flagship broadcasting produced in-house, live streaming events and church services from various locations around the nation, and archived historical video. AwakeningTV.com will also feature interview-based programming, live preaching and teaching, historic revival videos, and live streaming from content partners.

Awakening TV’s mission is to serve as a rallying point for voices in the awakening movement to disseminate their messages to an audience of believers hungry for the next great move of God. AwakeningTV.com will work to draw in believers from many streams of the body of Christ who are praying for God to move in this hour. The content will equip and inspire hope in the hearts of believers and stir them to pray and believe God for another move of His Spirit. Our overarching goal is to facilitate and chronicle the next great move of God.

Again, your donation could light a fire that sparks revival that leads to an awakening in the body of Christ!

Ryan LeStrange started in ministry after training and serving under his spiritual father, Dr. Novel Hayes. Ryan and his wife, Joy, lead Impact International Ministries in Bristol, Va., which includes several local churches and revival ministries. Through Ryan LeStrange Ministries, he travels the globe preaching, igniting revival and moving in the power of God. Ryan can be seen weekly on his television program, Power 4 Today, airing around the world on GodTV. He is the founder and apostle of Impact International Apostolic Fellowship, networking and fathering ministers around the world. Ryan has authored several books releasing an apostolic and prophetic perspective to the body of Christ. 

Jennifer LeClaire is the director of Awakening House of Prayer in Fort Lauderdale, FL. Jennifer also serves as senior editor at Charisma magazine. Jennifer is a prolific author who has written over a dozen books, including: The Next Great Move of God: An Appeal to Heaven for Spiritual Awakening; Mornings With the Holy Spirit: Listening Daily to the Still Small Voice of God; and Developing Faith for the Working of Miracles. Her materials have been translated into Spanish and Korean. Jennifer writes some of Charisma’s most popular prophetic columns. Her media ministry includes her website; over 200,000 followers on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube; and a growing newsletter list. Jennifer has been interviewed on numerous media outlets including USA Today, BBC, The Alan Colmes Show, Bill Martinez Live, Babbie's House, Atlanta Live and Sid Roth's It’s Supernatural, as well as serving as an analyst for Rolling Thunder Productions on a Duck Dynasty special presentation.


What We Need & What You Get

We need $10,000 just to get out of the gate with phase one of our website development. We've hired a top notch designer that has worked with the likes of Reinhard Bonnke, Calvary Church, Benny Hinn on digital media projects. Every dollar of this fundraiser will go toward building the website.

We've gather some unique perks for our revival-minded donors, including some of our own materials, podcasts with leading voices in the body of Christ, classic books on prayer and supernatural gifts, an AwakeningTV.com T-Shirt and more.

    The Impact

    We've said this many times, but we really believe your donation could light a fire that sparks revival that leads to an awakening in the body of Christ! That's because we're broadcasting messages you might not normally get to hear from voices you may have never heard--voices from the past and emerging voices--as well as voices you know and love. Our inspirational and revelatory content will inspire you to press into the supernatural, into awakening and into Christ.

    We have published over a 20 books combined, preached hundreds of hours revival, prophetic, apostolic and faith messages, and helped major events in various nations. We both have extensive television experience, both as on-air personalities and production, and are passionate about transforming revival and are laboring at a grassroots level to spark an awakening in the nations.

      Risks & Challenges

      Digital media is a competitive landscape and there are many Christian broadcast networks on the market. Rising above the noise is our initial challenge, but there's nothing like AwakeningTV.com on the market--and there's a pent up demand for this kind of content in the body of Christ. Collectively, we've been plowing and building in the ministry world for nearly 35 years. This project was birthed in prayer and will be bathed in prayer. We believe this platform is God's will in this hour.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

        • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
        • You can use the Indiegogo share tools!

        Thanks for considering donating to the phase one launch of AwakeningTV.com. We can't wait to show you our vision in action.

story:
(The project is in English version, French & Italian)

Hello everybody, 

my name is Giorgia and I’m an Italian photographer.

I come from Sardinia, an amazing island that is so hard to leave even if it’s so necessary to do,  and every departure is always too much homesick.

For a long time I have been living in Bologna where I really improved my skills and capabilities.

I had the chance of working  in an e-commerce field: our team had to take fashion pictures for the most important brands and realize catalogues for Italian and International designers.

In such a creative and motivating experience, I developed more and more the idea, to be honest, also the big dream of moving to Paris.

Why working and living here? Just because Paris is an incredible metropolis where anyone-a photographer or any other artist-can find that real massive mash-up of different cultures, languages, backgrounds that offers all the inspiration needed.

I had just realized in the past a project about a metropolis, New York: in that case I had discovered how a simple human could comparing himself to the enormous dimension of a city like that.

I can’t deny that trips are important and I think the same also of professional experiences but, for me, the most deeply touching moment ever was the birth of my daughter, Bianca.

It was three years ago and about our family I can say that it’s not as  conventional as the others:  in fact it’s a monoparental one because it was only me to acknowledge the child.

Everybody around told me that with my baby I would have stopped working, travelling, having fun and probably that I would have given up living my life and who knows what else I would I have stopped.

But the reality was totally different: step by step, even in our easy way, I still keep on enjoying my every-day life: my daughter grows up and that’s what I really care.

And thanks to these three years I developed the idea of this project and for this reason I need you.

I’m planning my tour in 14 laps all over the Europe: from Lampedusa to Norway, from Portugal to Greece and edit the PhotoBook.

*Lampedusa, France, Suisse, Allemagne, Pays Bas, Norvège, Estonie, Scozia, Irlande, Portugal, Malte, Grèce, Roumanie, Italie*

I’d like to do it with my child because I indeed want to demonstrate that any woman can make a trip alone, do a lot of experiences and have the opportunity to know other stories: 14 different backgrounds from any type of family, non-conventional ones that can give us also new educational methods.

I’d also show you all the different politics among the EU countries about work and family fields.

Even if I don’t get 16,000 Euros, my wish will be anyway to manage to edit my book and in that case I could also reduce the laps of my tour.

The  16.000 euro :

20% for the production 

40% for two person travel and living

30% for edition PhotoBook and Perks

10% for the traduction PhotoBook

I’m sure they will be so so much interesting and I can’t realize it without you and your effort.

I do need your help for everything: not only for the whole tour, not only for the post-editing, but also for printing the book I’d like to give you before Christmas 2015.

My trip without you is impossible to do: you are one of the most powerful rings of the chain in my project.

If you can’t help me by money, I just ask you to give me your support by a click on social networks, sharing and spreading my research and my story.

During the development of  the whole 14 laps you will be always informed or you can reach all my news by yourselves using Twitter, Facebook, Periscope.

I wanna thank you in advance for all you will be able to do for me and for us.

And thanks so much also for watching my video.

Kind greetings by me and my baby Bianca.

_____________________________French Version__________________________________

Bonjour,

Giorgia est mon nom. A la base j'ai rien de particulier. Italienne de la Sardaigne

romantique dans l'âme j'ai toujours adore la photographie. Capturer en un clic tout une histoire, des émotions, des personnages... L'image selon moi peut contenir tout une vie un véritable chamboulement de sentiment.

A l'âge de 24 ans toujours célibataire, déjà installée depuis un bon moment a Bologne, je me lançais dans la vie active en tant que photographe professionnelle.  Avide de nouvelles expériences d'amour et de vie j'ai appris que j'attendais un enfant dans quelques mois. Le destin me réservait apparement beaucoup de surprises! 

Aujourd'hui je me retrouve a Paris avec une petite fille de trois ans. Un parcours bouleversant. L'accouchement, la mise au monde d'une âme innocente, la voir grandir, faire ses premiers pats, dire ses premiers mots, m'appeler ''mamma''. Parfois il est difficile de croire que moi qui menais auparavant une vie tranquille est devenue déjà maman.

Selon mon expérience la maternité est l'une des expérience les plus émouvante que j'ai vécu. La photographie et ma petite fille étant ce qui m'est de plus cher au monde  , je me suis décidé de me lancer dans une aventure qui me tient fort a coeur.

 Photographier les parcours passionnants , de mères a travers l'Europe avec un livre photographique sur combien viens a changer la maternité.

  • Je veux faire un voyage avec ma petit fille de 3 ans pour rencontrer des mères en 14 nation européen et vous vous donner pour Noël notre PHOTOBOOK de portait plain des histoire dure, intense, marron, émotionnant.

Le Project:

Le Voyage en 14 nation européen et la publication du Photo Book pour la fin du 2015

On a besoin de vous pour:

Le voyage nous porterais en Lampedusa, Suisse, Allemagne, Pays Bas, Norvège, Estonie, Scozia, Irlande, Portugal, Malte, Grèce, Roumanie, Italie.

On a déjà le contact, mais on lasse ouvert la possibilité d'ajouter o changer quelque itinéraire.

Le  16.000 euro :

20% cout de production 

40% cout du voyage et logement 

30% cout di edition photo book

10% cout pour le traduction  

C'est un occasion unique pour réfléchir sur sujet important et si on arriverais pas  a l'objectif le livre viendrais réalisé  ! 

Des autre façon de contribuer 

Reste en contact sur le réseaux sociaux 

Partager mon project avec un simple click 

N'importe qui tu est si tu as lire jusque ici, Merci Bien! 

_____________________________Versione Italiana________________________________

Buongiorno! 

Aiutami a raccontare storie forti, di madri comuni.

Parlano di noi: 
http://www.smallfamilies.it/post/portfolio/giorgia-e-bianca-piccole-donne-crescono/
http://www.ladonnasarda.it/storie/4581/quattro-...

Sono una donna, una mamma sola, una fotografa, una narratrice..                                 Mi chiamo Giorgia e voglio raccontarvi la mia storia e quella di molte altre donne in un Viaggio Fotografico, che attraversando l'Europa metterà in evidenza com'è cambiata la maternità ai giorni nostri. 

Col vostro contributo realizzerò un Libro Fotografica che racchiuderà il viaggio, migliaia di chilometri e centinaia di storie per raccontare com'è cambiato il modo di vivere ed interpretare l'essere madre.

  • Voglio intraprendere IL VIAGGIO CON LA MIA BAMBINA, andare ad incontrare le madri in diverse nazioni europee e regalarvi per natale in nostro libro con le nostre storie forti, dissacranti, divertenti, intense. 

    Per secoli ci è stato detto che una donna si sarebbe realizzata solo nella maternità per poi convincerci che l'indipendenza passasse dal non avere vincoli neanche di sangue. Oggi tante donne han trovato da sole una piacevolissima mediazione, l'equilibrio tra donna e madre. Aiutatemi a mostrarla con il vostro contributo in tutte le sue sfaccettature, siate parte di questo progetto.

Ecco perché ho bisogno di voi:

Il Viaggio ci porterà in Francia, Svizzera, Germania, Olanda, Norvegia, Estonia, Scozia, Irlanda, Portogallo, Malta, Grecia, Romania, Italia e terminerà a Lampedusa!

i 16.000 euro verranno così suddivisi:

20% costi di produzione

40% costi di viaggio ed alloggio 

30% costi di edizione libro

10% costi di traduzione 

E' un occasione unica per riflettere su temi importanti e anche se non dovessimo raggiungere l'intero obbiettivo il libro verrà comunque realizzato ! 

Altri modi per contribuire

Tenerci in contatto sulle risorse sociali 

Segnalarmi storie che a vostro avviso dovrebbero esser raccontate

Condividere la mia campagna con un semplice click

Chiunque tu sia e qualunque sia la tua storia, GRAZIE per aver letto la mia!

story:
UPDATE (3 Oct):

I've found a suitable location with lots of space for both training and production. It even has cooking and washing facilities, with extra rooms for storage. These extra rooms and facilities would work out well to provide temporary housing for those in the free training/apprenticeship program, if they should need it, until they can get back on their feet. There are lots of ideas running in my head, but with 2 days left to the end of the campaign and no where near the target...
Well, I am still hopeful :)
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Some of you might already know that F+D Apparel is a one-woman enterprise...me. 

I started this tailoring business to supplement my family's income, just to cope with our daily basic expenses in this increasingly expensive society. I started off with bespoke/custom tailoring and naturally progressed to include pattern and sample making, and small-lot production services for fashion labels and designers.

To my utter surprise, business has been good to the extent that I now need to hire help. Staffing also means moving the business out of my house and into a more suitable location. 

This is presenting itself as a chance to pay-it-forward for the many opportunities and blessings I've received. And since I'm in the business of dressing women, I'd like pay it to other women who truly need it. 

This workshop, which will be set up in Kuala Lumpur, hopes to give women in need a stepping stone towards changing their circumstances. It will also offer an opportunity to those who are disabled, but still have adequate motor ability, to learn a tangible skill and be equitably employed and empowered through their employment.


The Impact

The workshop will offer free pattern making and/or sewing lessons to 2 ladies each month. These ladies will be sought from local orphanages, welfare homes and other community help organizations, etc. Upon acquisition of adequate skills, they can choose to progress onto the next curriculum (still free) or become part of my production team as a paid apprentice. They can also choose to start earning a living with their own home-based sewing business, or be placed with other social entrepreneurial businesses that would require sewing apprentices.

In order to maintain operational costs, the workshop will also be opened to the paying public; ladies (and gents) who also want to learn to sew as a hobby.

This will help keep alive a vanishing skill in a metropolis society. A skill that enabled our own grandmothers and great-grandmothers to supplement their household incomes and send their daughters to school.

And, let's be honest, I get to keep doing a job I love and give something back at the same time. 


What We Need & What You Get

Being a solo act at the moment, funds are rather limited to what I can afford for rent and salary...and that doesn't amount to enough unfortunately.

So with your help, I hope to raise the requisite amount which will:

  • pay for the securities deposit for the new place
  • sustain rent and utility expenses for 4-5 months
  • buy the minimum no. of new machines for training and operations
  • pay a fair wage to the ladies during the first months of apprenticeship.
Even if the target isn't reached but minimally sufficient, every little bit of contribution will still be put towards setting up the new workshop, and perhaps buying fewer machines than planned, but enough to go ahead with training and continued operations. 
And you won't leave empty-handed either! Choose any amount you are comfortable with to give and receive a gift in return. You could enjoy discounts on custom orders, or receive a complimentary dress from our small RTW collection. Or, if you are an avid seamstress yourself, get a free dress pattern from our modest range of commercial paper/pdf patterns.


Other Ways You Can Help

Money isn't everything (but it sure helps), so if you'd like to contribute in other ways, I will be thrilled! This is a list of some of the things that would be gleefully welcomed and greatly appreciated:

  • New or used industrial sewing and cutting equipment in good working order. 
  • New or used domestic sewing machines in good working order.
  • Affordable/free space (large enough to accommodate a small sewing manufactory).
  • CAD pattern drafting software. 
  • New or used sewing tables, stools and other furniture.

Or you can simply help me get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Do feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools.

THANK YOU most sincerely from me at F+D!

story:
Look who's talking about Hunter Bars!


                            




Introducing Hunter Bars - 

Food designed to Target Your Hunger ™


Have you ever stopped to think about all of the improvements made in hunting and fishing over the years?



We're pretty sure that you aren't using the same bow, gun, or fishing equipment that your grandparents used.  Yet would you believe most of us still pack the same food they did?  Yep, its true.  Most hunters and anglers we know still pack the same stand-by food items when they head out, food affectionately called "Old School Hunting Food."   Check out the list...look familiar? 



Here's the problem:  Old school hunting food doesn't cut it.  Why?  Because hunting burns the same amount of calories as swimming and jogging. (www.calorielab.com/burned) 


Yet people swim or jog for an hour or two at a time.  Hunters and anglers are out a lot longer so we burn calories at a very high rate.  Here's what we mean:

We're not going to travel for 3 or 4 hours just to hunt or fish for an hour.  We're out all day! From our personal experience and according to everyone we've been talking with, it's not uncommon for hunters and anglers to be out for 4-6 hours at a time!  That's some serious calorie burning.  It takes its toll physically and mentally.


Here's the solution!




Hunter Bars™ are the first nutritional energy bars made specifically for the hunter and angler.  These bars increase mental alertness, are packed with protein, and give you energy without the jitters.  

Hunter Bars™ come in a quiet, water-tight wrapper and can travel with you without melting or getting soggy.  We want you to experience the adrenaline rush of the kill and be able to tell stories around the campfire, not go back empty-handed because you got too tired or too hungry.

These bars provide nutrients that increase your stamina and energy so you can stay in the hunt longer.  


Finally, food as advanced as your gear!

It's a nutritional bar combined with an energy bar.

                                    



Is there an ingredient list?  

Great question. We are starting with our most popular flavor called Autumn Spice.  It's a great blend of pumpkin and ginger.  While the bars are not certified gluten-free, we aren't adding any wheat ingredients and we are leaving out milk products (this includes whey protein).  Most of the population can't digest these well, and some people have major issues with them.  

There are still a few things we are working out with our food scientist so we do not have a final nutritional label.  

We can tell you that they are made to specifically address the nutritional needs of hunters and anglers.  Our food scientist (who comes from a family of hunters and herself is a hunter for 20+ years) is helping us deliver a bar that contains ingredients known to increase energy, stamina, concentration, and alertness.  

Here are some general facts about Hunter Bars:

  • 52-58 grams
  • Approximately 230-260 calories per bar
  • Approximately 10-16 grams of protein per bar
  • The final iteration of our ginger bar will likely contain almonds, coconut, sunflower seeds, sunflower oil, almond butter, ginger, organic flax seed, organic flax seed oil, pumpkin spice, vanilla, organic oats, organic brown rice syrup, and organic brown crispy rice.
  • 12 bars per case


There's Science Behind These Bars

Yes, it's true!  Hunter Bars has our very own Food Scientist and Nutritionist, Dr. Jana Bogs, who is making sure these bars not only taste good, but do exactly what they are suppose to do.


So how do they taste? 

Another great question.  Of course we think they taste great, but let's take a look at what these fellow hunters & anglers have to say when they tried the samples we sent them:





The great thing about Hunter Bars™ is how the idea makes so much sense.   Its a nutritional bar combined with an energy bar made to meet the demanding needs of hunters and anglers.  



Stay in the Hunt™ and Target Your Hunger™ with Hunter Bars.


How we arrived at our target number of $50,000

There are so many variables that go into setting a price point when it comes to manufacturing a great product.   After much thought, we decided to focus on quality ingredients and high volume.  That does two things:  1) allows the Hunter Bar to deliver what it is supposed to every single time and, 2) be sold at a great value.  


Our Unique Perks!

A case of Hunter Bars will retail for around $38 but our backers have the chance to get as much as 25% off!  Also, some of our perks are bundle packages.  What this means is that we've partnered with some pretty cool companies who have agreed to offer their product/service at a generous discount when bundled with our discounted bars!  Some are offed with a limited supply so take advantage while they are available!


POSSIBLE  RISKS & CHALLENGES - THINGS TO BEAR IN MIND

We have worked for almost a year developing Hunter Bars.  Assembling the right team and finding the right manufacturer is a lot tougher than we expected but our persistence paid off.  Even though it feels like we've been at this a LONG TIME, it's not even one year yet.  We share that to say that by backing Hunter Bars you are doing so with the understanding that this is a new product.   

So to manage expectations, here are some things that are important to know:

MANUFACTURING: We are working closely with a manufacturer who has been able to produce Hunter Bars at a high quality so we have already resolved some of the manufacturing challenges. However, to produce on a larger scale will require increased production supplies and ingredients - this is where some delay could occur.

FULFILLMENT: Despite the best planning, there may be factors that we cannot control such as equipment malfunction, transport, or supplier delays. While we hope that your support on Indiegogo will enable us to begin production on a commercial scale we have no idea as to whether it will be 'business as usual' for us or an overwhelming demand. If more people than we anticipate want Hunter Bars we may have to scale up the factory or set up manufacturing in additional locations.  We will endeavor to produce the product quickly and make sure that the early backers are given priority to receive their Hunter Bars.


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can't contribute - that doesn't mean you can't help!  Here are a couple ideas that will help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign through your social media!  Copy the campaign URL and paste it into an email or social media update
  • Click on the Facebook, Google Plus, or Twitter icons to share through your social media networks
  • Add a widget to your blog or personal website. Click Embed and then copy and paste the widget code. 
  • Send a direct email from Indiegogo


Common Questions & Answers

Our goal is to have you as a customer for life, so your feedback and satisfaction are very important to us.  We've created a list of common questions and answers that should cover all the bases. 

Q: Are Hunter Bars allergen free?

The short answer is no. While we may not include common allergens in the bars (for example, peanuts), the bars are manufactured in a shared facility and may contain traces of Milk, Eggs, Soy, Wheat, Tree Nuts, and Peanuts.

Q: Are Hunter Bars gluten free?

While the bars are not certified gluten-free because of possible cross-contamination in the facility, we aren't adding any wheat ingredients.

Q: I'm on a strict Paleo diet, can I eat a Hunter Bar?

Our understanding is that a strict Paleo diet does not do grains like oats.  If we elect to have oats in Hunter Bars, the oats will be certified gluten free, which means they will not be cross contaminated with wheat because of using the same fields.  That being said, if you are a strict Paleo, you might want to buy Hunter Bars for a non-Paleo friend for the time being.  :-)

Q:  Do they taste good?

30 out of 31 people we sent samples to loved this flavor.  That's a 96.7% approval rating, a stat other bars will be jealous of!  If you click on the gallery tab at the top of the campaign, you will be able to view some of the video testimonials we've received.  In addition, you can review our Twitter and Facebook account to read even more testimonials.  So yeah, they taste good!

Q: What is the maximum amount of Hunter Bars an individual should consume in a day?

The recommended usage for Hunter Bars is 2-3 bars per day. Although there is nothing harmful about consuming more bars than this in a short period of time, it should be noted that Hunter Bars are not designed to be a nutritionally complete food. Rather, they are intended to be a nutritious snack food to accompany your diet. Hunter Bars should be consumed as part of a well-balanced diet containing a wide variety of healthy foods.

Q: Can a person with diabetes eat Hunter Bars?

Hunter Bars were not specifically designed for persons with diabetes.  Your physician or registered dietitian should be consulted regarding the proper consumption of Hunter Bars if you have diabetes.

Q: Can children eat Hunter Bars?

Hunter Bars were developed based on adult nutritional needs. These products are not recommended for use in children under 4 years of age.  If you plan to use these products for children less than 4 years of age, please check with the child's health care professional first.

Q: If only part of a Hunter Bar is eaten, what is the best way to store the remaining piece of the bar?

They are so good that it's rare to not finish one!  We suggest that you share it with your buddy.  If that won't work, cut off the portion you wish to consume and then store the unused portion in a sealed storage bag at room temperature.

Q: What nuts are processed in the facilities that produce Hunter Bars?

At this point, all Hunter Bars are manufactured in a facility that processes nuts (peanuts and/or tree nuts). Therefore bars without nuts are made on the same lines as other bars containing nuts. May contain traces of: Milk, Soy, Wheat, Other Tree Nuts, Peanuts, pits or pit fragments, shell or shell fragments.

Q: Where are Hunter Bars made?

We're proud to say that our product is manufactured in the USA.

  And that's not all.  

The ingredients, wrappers, and cases are purchased from our wonderful vendors located in the USA as well.  That's right, Hunter Bars are a product of the US of A.


Q: Does Hunter Bars contribute to a social cause?
Yes!  As a matter of fact, after our launch, we will donate a portion of our net profits to two awesome causes...Disabled American Veterans and Feeding America. 

          

A portion of your Hunter Bars purchases will help create donations.  You can learn more about these wonderful causes and watch Hunter Bar contributions at www.hunterbarfansgivingback.org

The Next Steps

This Indiegogo project is only the beginning of what we intend to create.  Our vision is to get Hunter Bars into 5,000 stores throughout the nation, donate thousands of dollars to social causes, and sponsor hunters and anglers financially and with product donations.   Before any of that can happen, we need to sell a few bars first, so thanks for backing us!


Disclaimer

"Delivery of rewards/perks are subject to best efforts and not guaranteed." 

Paypal needs the above disclaimer to be displayed on the page....

Thanks so much for all your amazing support and contributions,

Dino and Kevin, Founders
story_txt:
Look who's talking about Hunter Bars!









                            



Introducing Hunter Bars - 

Food designed to Target Your Hunger ™



Have you ever stopped to think about all of the improvements made in hunting and fishing over the years?





We're pretty sure that you aren't using the same bow, gun, or fishing equipment that your grandparents used.  Yet would you believe most of us still pack the same food they did?  Yep, its true.  Most hunters and anglers we know still pack the same stand-by food items when they head out, food affectionately called "Old School Hunting Food."   Check out the list...look familiar? 



Here's the problem:  Old school hunting food doesn't cut it.  Why?  Because hunting burns the same amount of calories as swimming and jogging. (www.calorielab.com/burned) 


Yet people swim or jog for an hour or two at a time.  Hunters and anglers are out a lot longer so we burn calories at a very high rate.  Here's what we mean:
We're not going to travel for 3 or 4 hours just to hunt or fish for an hour.  We're out all day! From our personal experience and according to everyone we've been talking with, it's not uncommon for hunters and anglers to be out for 4-6 hours at a time!  That's some serious calorie burning.  It takes its toll physically and mentally.

Here's the solution!


Hunter Bars™ are the first nutritional energy bars made specifically for the hunter and angler.  These bars increase mental alertness, are packed with protein, and give you energy without the jitters.  
Hunter Bars™ come in a quiet, water-tight wrapper and can travel with you without melting or getting soggy.  We want you to experience the adrenaline rush of the kill and be able to tell stories around the campfire, not go back empty-handed because you got too tired or too hungry.
These bars provide nutrients that increase your stamina and energy so you can stay in the hunt longer.  





Finally, food as advanced as your gear!

It's a nutritional bar combined with an energy bar.


                                    





Is there an ingredient list?  

Great question. We are starting with our most popular flavor called Autumn Spice.  It's a great blend of pumpkin and ginger.  While the bars are not certified gluten-free, we aren't adding any wheat ingredients and we are leaving out milk products (this includes whey protein).  Most of the population can't digest these well, and some people have major issues with them.  
There are still a few things we are working out with our food scientist so we do not have a final nutritional label.  
We can tell you that they are made to specifically address the nutritional needs of hunters and anglers.  Our food scientist (who comes from a family of hunters and herself is a hunter for 20+ years) is helping us deliver a bar that contains ingredients known to increase energy, stamina, concentration, and alertness.  
Here are some general facts about Hunter Bars:



52-58 grams


Approximately 230-260 calories per bar


Approximately 10-16 grams of protein per bar

The final iteration of our ginger bar will likely contain almonds, coconut, sunflower seeds, sunflower oil, almond butter, ginger, organic flax seed, organic flax seed oil, pumpkin spice, vanilla, organic oats, organic brown rice syrup, and organic brown crispy rice.
12 bars per case




There's Science Behind These Bars


Yes, it's true!  Hunter Bars has our very own Food Scientist and Nutritionist, Dr. Jana Bogs, who is making sure these bars not only taste good, but do exactly what they are suppose to do.




So how do they taste? 


Another great question.  Of course we think they taste great, but let's take a look at what these fellow hunters & anglers have to say when they tried the samples we sent them:






The great thing about Hunter Bars™ is how the idea makes so much sense.   Its a nutritional bar combined with an energy bar made to meet the demanding needs of hunters and anglers.  



Stay in the Hunt™ and Target Your Hunger™ with Hunter Bars.

How we arrived at our target number of $50,000
There are so many variables that go into setting a price point when it comes to manufacturing a great product.   After much thought, we decided to focus on quality ingredients and high volume.  That does two things:  1) allows the Hunter Bar to deliver what it is supposed to every single time and, 2) be sold at a great value.  

Our Unique Perks!
A case of Hunter Bars will retail for around $38 but our backers have the chance to get as much as 25% off!  Also, some of our perks are bundle packages.  What this means is that we've partnered with some pretty cool companies who have agreed to offer their product/service at a generous discount when bundled with our discounted bars!  Some are offed with a limited supply so take advantage while they are available!

POSSIBLE  RISKS & CHALLENGES - THINGS TO BEAR IN MIND

MANUFACTURING: We are working closely with a manufacturer who has been able to produce Hunter Bars at a high quality so we have already resolved some of the manufacturing challenges. However, to produce on a larger scale will require increased production supplies and ingredients - this is where some delay could occur.
FULFILLMENT: Despite the best planning, there may be factors that we cannot control such as equipment malfunction, transport, or supplier delays. While we hope that your support on Indiegogo will enable us to begin production on a commercial scale we have no idea as to whether it will be 'business as usual' for us or an overwhelming demand. If more people than we anticipate want Hunter Bars we may have to scale up the factory or set up manufacturing in additional locations.  We will endeavor to produce the product quickly and make sure that the early backers are given priority to receive their Hunter Bars.
Other Ways You Can Help




We understand that some people just can't contribute - that doesn't mean you can't help!  Here are a couple ideas that will help:

Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign through your social media!  Copy the campaign URL and paste it into an email or social media update

Click on the Facebook, Google Plus, or Twitter icons to share through your social media networks
Add a widget to your blog or personal website. Click Embed and then copy and paste the widget code. 
Send a direct email from Indiegogo

story: When I was 8 I ate my first Denny's pancake, it was love at first bite. I made a promise to myself at that moment that I would take a trip down the East Coast and stop at every Denny's. Help me eat some pancakes.

story:
Everyone deserves tea and cupcakes!

I've been bringing my delicious vegan and gluten free cupcakes to markets and events around Melbourne for the past three years, and I've ALWAYS wanted to be able serve tea with them! I've ALSO always wanted to be able to serve it from a bike, which is where the Wheely's Cafe Bike comes in... 

What We Need & What You Get

So for $4K, I will be able to... 

  • Buy the bike! It's $2999 for the basic model. 
  • Get it shipped to Australia! 
  • Pay the requisite council registration fees. 
  • Fulfil the perks and pay Indiegogo's fees.
  • If I don't get the full amount, then what I do get will go into a high interest savings account so I can either purchase a Wheely's Cafe in the future, or look into getting my own built here in Melbourne. 
Perks I am offering to those who support the campaign...
  • CUPCAKES!!! 
  • Tea, either as a care package or served to you and your friends at your event
  • The bike making an appearance at your event, serving tea, coffee and cupcakes
  • Baking lessons
What happens if I raise more than $4K? The funds will go towards...
  • market fees!
  • advertising fees!
  • wheely's cafe extras!
  • MAYBE even get the super fancy science version with solar power and cold storage and a mobile greenhouse, go have a look it is SUPER COOL. 

Why Support This Campaign?

What sounds more quintessentially Melbourne than a bike cafe serving amazing tea, coffee and delicious baked goods? 

  • Since it's a bike and not a van, it's environmentally friendly! 
  • You'll be helping me achieve a long held dream. 
  • But no seriously, don't you think the world needs more tea?

Risks & Challenges

Obviously, there's a bit of outlay to get the bike and get it here. And then there's the ever problematic Melbourne weather! And how do you know whether I'll actually get the bike out into the city and selling?

  • I've been running my cupcake business for over three years now, through rain, sunshine and financial hardship. 
  • The bike is pretty weather proof, and I'm pretty tenacious. You help me get the bike, and you'll never see me off it. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't throw any money in at the moment? No worries! 

  • PLEASE tell everyone you know. Multiple times. Be annoying if you have to. 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the news across social media!
  • Successful promotors will get a super special thank you from me, in the form of a treat. ;]

story:
Why and What we want

In last decade many historical castles deteriorated to absolute ruins, mostly because of greed of some people who got them cheap from local governments and then got lucrative loans for restoration which never happen and  these lovely castles decayed close to complete destruction. You can see the current state in our gallery.

We have decided to save one and bring it back to life. Our plan starts with complete restoration of the building and conversion of it to community center that will stand out even in 21st century.

We plan to use  restored castle to preserve traditional crafts such as weaving, paper making, candle making etc. We are selecting crafts that can be performed by socially excluded. Our aim is to create protected environment for disabled or otherwise excluded, so we can help them to ingrate and get employment.

Third main cornerstone of our project is to use part of the property as business incubator that will provide friendly and effective environment for startups to prove that not all businesses are destructive for cultural heritage.

Who we are

Whole project is brainchild of Petr who in real life is DataCenter architect and business owner. Petr has created this project as the way to return something to his country of origin and society there. In the past Petr was part of similar project in early 2000's where they have created protected workshops for disabled people with severe disabilities (www.letohradekvendula.cz). 

Petr's drive and enthusiasm spread across his contacts so the team for this project has grown to include people form full spectrum of life. Many of whom is joining team directly and putting their own efforts and support to this cause.

What We Need & What You Get

Each and every penny that we raise will go to restoration of this lovely piece of architecture. Together with our own funds we are also working with Culture ministry of Czech Republic, European structural fonds and donations from our supporters on preserving the heritage of the castle.

We will start by securing the main building, preventing more structural damage, installing new roof, restoring fallen walls. Which we believe is most critical part for this round we would love to have roof ready by winter to prevent one more year of snow and wet getting in to the walls.

Estimates for completing the whole project are in range of 50m czech crowns (about 2.000.000 USD). Here we are asking you to support us with the crucial task of starting the process of saving the castle.  As said before we are working together with government organizations to get grants to help us to save the castle, but these take time and we are looking to you to help us to bridge the gap and make this happen.

Even if we don't reach the goal all the money raised here will go towards the restoration and will support our own efforts and efforts of our supporters to  raise the rest of the capital need for our project.

In the News

I do apologize but all the articles are in Czech language, but if any one is interested i can translate them.


   Část zámku v Dobříčanech se zřítila


   Zámek v Dobříčanech se zřítil ...


   Opuštěný a nebezpečný!


The Impact

Impact is immense, this campaign can save castle that stands on its place since 1437 when it was first mentioned as fortress. It was rebuilt in 1620 by order of  Christopher Hrobčiký of Hrobčice as renaissance chateau. Because of the owner  participated in upraising in the same year chateau was attacked, burned and confiscated and became part of kings estate.

In 1623 castle was bought by František Clary de Riva. His descendants rebuilt abandoned castle in the Baroque style and founded large park  in the second half of the 17th century.  Count Leopold Kaspar Clary-Aldringen the side branch Clary de Riva, inherited  the castle in 1746. His descendants kept the castle till y. 1804 when it was bought by Jan Antonín Chládek and immediately sold in 1809 to Edward of Schönburka. Castle was in family possession  up to the year 1945.

After Second World War castle was used by Czech army as storage depot and after velvet revolution in 1989 was as part of privatization sold to private company in 1992 that left the castle to ruin after it cashed out the loans for its restoration.

So appart form saving the piece of history our project has two more areas of impact as described in our 3 corner stone activities.

First one is to restore the property destroyed by greed

Second is to create and preserve center with national handicraft 

Third one is to create friendly environment for startups to grow companies that will be responsible to its history and environment.

Doing all these we want to create jobs for socially excluded in Czech society, be it in manufactures of Czech handicraft or in support roles for the startup incubator or incubator itself as we believe in equal opportunities for all.


Risks & Challenges

As it might become obvious in this project biggest risk is that we will not be fast enough and the castle collapse to the ruins before we can save it. To prevent that we are already in discussion with the Ministry of culture and their National Landmark persecution fund to fund emergency repairs together with our own funds.

Also as this Castle is part of the bankruptcy proceeding against the greedy company we are negotiating its direct purchase with legal receiver and there are some legal hurdles that we are facing, luckily we have solicitors and legal advisers in our team and we are making progress.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't feel like supporting us with money. You always can help us to spread word about this campaign. Or even better you can come over and help us working on the castle (obviously this has to be arranged upfront not to affect other works that are going on) But every helping hand is welcome.

His descendants rebuilt abandoned castle in the Baroque style and founded large park  in the second half of the 17th century.  Count Leopold Kaspar Clary-Aldringen the side branch Clary de Riva, inherited  the castle in 1746. His descendants kept the castle till y. 1804 when it was bought by Jan Antonín Chládek and immediately sold in 1809 to Edward of Schönburka. Castle was in family possession  up to the year 1945.


After Second World War castle was used by Czech army as storage depot and after velvet revolution in 1989 was as part of privatization sold to private company in 1992 that left the castle to ruin after it cashed out the loans for its restoration.

So appart form saving the piece of history our project has two more areas of impact as described in our 3 corner stone activities.

First one is to restore the property destroyed by greed

Second is to create and preserve center with national handicraft 

Third one is to create friendly environment for startups to grow companies that will be responsible to its history and environment.

Doing all these we want to create jobs for socially excluded in Czech society, be it in manufactures of Czech handicraft or in support roles for the startup incubator or incubator itself as we believe in equal opportunities for all.


 Risks & Challenges
As it might become obvious in this project biggest risk is that we will not be fast enough and the castle collapse to the ruins before we can save it. To prevent that we are already in discussion with the Ministry of culture and their National Landmark persecution fund to fund emergency repairs together with our own funds.
Also as this Castle is part of the bankruptcy proceeding against the greedy company we are negotiating its direct purchase with legal receiver and there are some legal hurdles that we are facing, luckily we have solicitors and legal advisers in our team and we are making progress.


    Other Ways You Can Help If you don't feel like supporting us with money. You always can help us to spread word about this campaign. Or even better you can come over and help us working on the castle (obviously this has to be arranged upfront not to affect other works that are going on) But every helping hand is welcome.

story:
*All funds go directly to building the small factory that will result in more indigenous women having a strong and secure income, and will allow more women to be proud of being indigenous!
                                                                             Our Story
          Hello,  my name is Gabriel and I am going into my Junior year of High School. Over two years ago  I was looking at a variety of community service projects in South America. As I was doing research, I came across Mishky Huarmy, a company that partners up with Indigenous Women. I felt attracted to the project because they work with a lot of single women. During tenth grade , I went to Ecuador. There, I was housed by the owners of Mishky Huarmy, Cristobal and Gabriela. In Ecuador I fell in love with their company, and became involved even more. 
 
           Mishky Huarmy is a reletively new company that could qualify as fair trade, but will just recently start to apply for the certification process. They pay the women in ONE MONTH what many Fair Trade companies pay in a YEAR! They make a dietary supplement that is made out of Agave Syrup, one of the ancestral flavors of Ecuador. The goals of the company are to bring a secure and reliable economic situation to Indigenous Ecuadorian women, and to help the indigenous people to be proud of their identity and heritage.  Many of the ancestral traditions of Ecuadorian women are frowned upon because along with the Spanish conquest came the Spaniards' way of life, and traditional cultures were discouraged. Now with the help of Mishky Huarmy there is a resurgence of pride in the Cayambe region when it comes to indigenous culture and identity. 

         After going through details, and adding up the costs for everything we came to $50,000. This is the amount that Mishky Huarmy needs in order to be able to open a small factory, and consequently hire more underpriveleged women. The small factory will include a low temperature evaporation system where the Agave sap will become more concentrated.  This factory will allow more women to be hired, because right now Mishky Huarmy is made out of a small kitchen and the amount of women that can work there is limited. Additionally, Mishky Huarmy hopes to provide the women with domestic financial workshops in a few months, and to begin working with the reforestation with agaves of their land. 
     
       Mishky Huarmy is valuable to the area of Cayambe and to Ecaudor both economically and culturally. With your help, we will be able to hire more women, and to allow the Indigenous population to be proud of their identity once again! Mishky Huarmy's first employee was Señora Teresa Quishpe from Pingulmi. However, slowly and steadily the business has grown to partner up with and employ women from three other towns, and if the goal is reached we will be able to emply women from all over the region!   


         Here at Mishky Huarmy we understand that many people aren't able to donate. However, that doesn't mean they can't help. Right now, we need to spread the word about the product, and the indiegogo campaign so we can grow, and consequently employ more and more women. By liking Mishky Huarmy's page on Facebook and sharing the campaign you can do a lot of help, and we greatly appreciate it!


Mishky Huarmy's Awards:

2014 Ecuadorian Grand Bazaar: 1st Prize

Ecuador Cultural Gourmet: 1st Prize

Ecuadorian Textures, Colors, and Flavors Fair : 1st Prize for Flavors
