story:
Who is ARI?
Art Relief International (ARI) was launched in 2009 and uses art outreach, art education and art therapy techniques to break down language and cultural barriers, This enables our workshop participants to learn, grow and inevitably express their thoughts and feelings as individuals and valuable community members via their creativity. Through encouragement our students are better able to communicate their needs to the larger community and bring about positive societal change, whilst empowering themselves and each other.

We believe that art is a powerful tool for change. Our mission at ARI is to promote expression and cultivate the creativity that lies inside each individual. We use art to create an atmosphere of inclusion and belonging where often there is none. ARI provides a VOICE for individuals by exploring various creative means, including visual, performance and experimental arts.

"If a voice can't be heard, teach it to be seen"- Emily Scott, Former Art Director

Just some of the population groups that ARI facilitates art workshops with include children with physical and / or intellectual disabilities, orphans, children of Burmese refugees and the hilltribes of Thailand who are not afforded the same rights as Thai citizens, children and young people at risk of being trafficked or already involved in the sex tourism trade and single mothers (and their children), to name a few. ARI delivers on average eight (but sometimes as many as twelve) workshops a week to the communities mentioned above.

Our Annual Community Exhibition...

Each year Art Relief International hosts a major exhibition featuring the art work produced by our numerous community artists during our workshops throughout the year. The exhibition is a celebration of the creativity, ability and resilience of the communities we work with, as well as a platform for sharing their various stories which often involve disadvantage, marginalization and hardship. In essence, the exhibition provides a space where their voices can be heard (or seen).

Past exhibitions have been extremely well attended by both locals and expats alike, and help to promote our organization and the work we do with our community artists and the partner organisations that support them. It also highlights the need to continue to advocate for those most marginalized in our society, and educate the wider community about the issues they face.

It is also an opportunity to connect with our supporters around the world, and hopefully recruit new supporters, via tools such as social media (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, our blog) where we will promote the exhibition and share stories from all stages of the exhibition process, our websites where we will host photos from the exhibition and our art catalogue which is developed from the art work created and available to browse on-line - http://issuu.com/artrelief/docs/ari_lookbook_2015_

These opportunities to promote the work we do are vital for the survival of our organisation.

Why We Need Your help...

In November, 2015 we hope to increase the scope of the exhibition and enhance the experience for our supporters in Chiang Mai. To achieve this, we have decided to adopt the theme ‘Right of Passage’. A Rite of Passage can be defined as ceremonies that mark important transitional periods in a person's life, such as birth, becoming a legal adult, marriage and having children. However, in adapting the spelling of ‘rite’ to ‘right’, we are interpreting the meaning to be the freedom of access to any pathway in life, including the various life markers mentioned above.

In addition to our new theme, we have also decided this year that the exhibition will have a focus on installation art, further symbolising and emphasising the concept of a ‘Rite of Passage’, where exhibition attendees will be asked to ‘experience’ the art work, and therefore the stories and lives of the artists themselves, as they wander through various ‘passages’ and pathways that link the exhibition art work together.

In light of our ambitious ideas for this year’s exhibition, we are seeking additional funding that will assist us in managing the increased costs associated with this event, including venue hire, marketing (printing of posters and flyers), art supplies and materials, construction, catering and other miscellaneous costs which will arise as we begin the development of the installation art works.

What Will You Get In Return?

In return for your pledge, not only will you receive that wonderful warm and fuzzy feeling you get when you assist those who will truly benefit from your help, there are also numerous rewards or 'perks' you will receive depending on the amount you pledge. You will also be able to see where all your generous money has gone via our many posts, updates, photos and blogs across our numerous social media platforms.

However, we know not everybody is in a position to help financially, but would still love to support this wonderful cause. We would still be extremely grateful if you can simply spread the word about this campaign, the exhibition and the work we do at ARI. Please post, re-post, share, like, comment, blog etc. etc.

ARI would like to thank you in advance for your wonderful generosity. Together, we can use art to change the world, for the better.

In creativity, compassion and gratitude,
The ARI Team.

story:
WHAT is the urgency


  • Senegalese migrants are dying as they try to cross the Atlantic in hopes of finding employment and finding better futures in Europe.
  • Senegalese culture is dying as western brands are used as status symbols.


WHAT we are doing about it


  • Tiossan (tee-oh-sahn) is building a production facility in Senegal to create jobs so Senegalese do not need to leave Senegal for a better life.
  • Tiossan, inspired by the medicinal secrets of the Senegalese traditional healers, is renewing Senegalese culture.
  • Tiossan is the only skincare company in the world that devotes 50% of its profits to finance entrepreneurial schools in Senegal, to foster the next generation of conscious entrepreneurs, creators of tomorrow's jobs and guardians of the Senegalese culture.


WHAT is Tiossan


Tiossan is the first all-natural artisan skin care brand inspired by the ancient medicinal secrets of the traditional Sufi healers of Senegal. Tiossan builds on the beauty rituals of the gorgeous Senegalese women, offering the richness of Senegalese culture to the world, while creating jobs, hope and opportunity for the people behind it.


Magatte Wade, CEO, founded the company after studying with a traditional healer from her native Senegal.  She wanted to bring the best of her cultural traditions to the global consumer.



WHAT we need


Below is a breakdown of estimated costs required to set up our first production facility in Senegal. We also plan to begin preparing for our first Tiossan entrepreneurial school on the ground.


WHAT is the entrepreneurial school all about 


We are committed to educating the next generation of conscious Senegalese entrepreneurs, future job creators, policy makers and leaders through devoting 50% of our profits to the creation of entrepreneurial schools in Africa. Our model is the Khabele Strong Incubator in Austin, co-founded by Magatte Wade's husband, Michael Strong, and his dear friend Khotso Khabele, of Lesotho. Inc. Magazine dubbed this model of schools A new idea for unleashing waves of conscious entrepreneurs.


    WHAT you receive



      WHAT is the story of Tiossan

      Magatte says that in her native Senegal, there is a ritual for all babies. For the first 45 days, a grandmother gives the baby a daily full-body massage with healing ingredients. Thus, a daily ritual of self-love is established for life by spending a few minutes every day making those gestures over your own skin with nourishing ingredients that come from the land. This ritual of caring for the body creates a unique connection with it. That is what the indigenous people know. Women who observe and practice these traditional methods radiate with a different type of health and beauty.

      Tiossan offers you not only these sacred ingredients and formulations to feed your skin, but a reminder of the daily ritual. Many women globally focus on their face and hair, while completely neglecting the rest of their skin. Skin is the body's largest organ, and it needs to be kept in an optimum state of health to do its job - absorbing nutrients for the body, expelling toxins, and forming a natural barrier against external pollutants.


      WHO is Magatte Wade, Founder of Tiossan

      WHAT you can do

      Whether it's with your checkbook or your Facebook, YOU can help. Even if you can't donate $10 right now, please:
      • Promote our campaign!
      • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
      • Buy Tiossan. Let your friends know about Tiossan products and the miracles they do for your skin!
      • Keep us in your hearts, especially during this holiday season!
      • Follow us on Instagram @worldofTiossan!

      In Senegal we say, "Nit Niteye Garabam", meaning "Mankind is the cure for Mankind". Let's prove it once more :)

      With Love & Gratitude,

      Magatte and The Tiossan Family

Tiossan, inspired by the 
medicinal secrets of the Senegalese traditional healers, is renewing Senegalese culture.
Tiossan is the only skincare company in the world that devotes 50% of its profits to finance entrepreneurial schools in Senegal, to foster the next generation of conscious entrepreneurs, creators of tomorrow's jobs and guardians of the Senegalese culture.

WHAT is TiossanTiossan is the first all-natural artisan skin care brand inspired by the
 ancient medicinal secrets of the traditional Sufi healers of Senegal. Tiossan builds on the beauty rituals of the gorgeous Senegalese women, 
offering the richness of Senegalese culture to the world, while creating
 jobs, hope and opportunity for the people behind it. 
Magatte Wade, CEO, founded the company after studying with a traditional
 healer from her native Senegal.  She wanted to bring the best of her 
cultural traditions to the global consumer.



WHAT we need 
Below is a breakdown of estimated costs required to set up our first 
production facility in Senegal. We also plan to begin preparing for our first Tiossan entrepreneurial school on the ground.WHAT is the entrepreneurial school all about We are committed to educating the next generation of
 conscious Senegalese entrepreneurs, future job creators, policy makers 
and leaders through devoting 50% of our profits to the creation of 
entrepreneurial schools in Africa. Our model is the Khabele Strong Incubator in Austin, co-founded by Magatte Wade's husband, Michael 
Strong, and his dear friend Khotso Khabele, of Lesotho. Inc. Magazine dubbed this model of schools A new idea for unleashing waves of conscious entrepreneurs.  





WHAT you receive







  


WHAT is the story of Tiossan 




Magatte says that in her native Senegal, there is a ritual for all 
babies. For the first 45 days, a grandmother gives the baby a daily 
full-body massage with healing ingredients. Thus, a daily ritual of 
self-love is established for life by spending a few minutes every day 
making those gestures over your own skin with nourishing ingredients 
that come from the land. This ritual of caring for the body creates a 
unique connection with it. That is what the indigenous people know. 
Women who observe and practice these traditional methods radiate with a 
different type of health and beauty.
Tiossan 
offers you not only these sacred ingredients and formulations to feed 
your skin, but a reminder of the daily ritual. Many women globally focus
 on their face and hair, while completely neglecting the rest of their 
skin. Skin is the body's largest organ, and it needs to be kept in an 
optimum state of health to do its job - absorbing nutrients for the 
body, expelling toxins, and forming a natural barrier against external 
pollutants. 


WHO is Magatte Wade, Founder of Tiossan








  WHAT you can do 
Whether it's with your checkbook or your Facebook, YOU can help. Even if you can't donate $10 right now, please:
Promote our campaign!
Use the Indiegogo share tools!
Buy Tiossan. Let your friends know about Tiossan products and the miracles they do for your skin!
Keep us in your hearts, especially during this holiday season!
Follow us on Instagram @worldofTiossan!
In Senegal we say, "Nit Niteye Garabam", meaning "Mankind is the cure for Mankind". Let's prove it once more :)
With Love & Gratitude,Magatte and The Tiossan Family

story:
The Masatepe Chamber of Commerce

The Masatepe Chamber of Commerce started as a project between Illinois Enactus, a student-led entrepreneurship group and International Teams, a faith-based organization with an emphasis on community development.

After moving to Masatepe, Nicaragua, with I-Teams, Brandon and Hannah Weidman founded a successful cafe, which has not only provided jobs for local residents, but also a meeting place for the community. But this alone was not enough. They noticed a trend among other local businesses:

  • They were very small and family-oriented
  • They had no way to support each other or exchange ideas
  • They were powerless to lobby the government for better business conditions

It was then that the idea for the Masatepe Chamber of Commerce began as a means to address these needs.

What is a Chamber of Commerce, and why should I support one in a completely different country?

A Chamber of Commerce may seem like an abstract concept, but its impact on a community cannot be underestimated. Your local Chamber of Commerce likely supports community events, offers scholarships for students, and presents seminars for local businesses. But these activities just scratch the surface.

A Chamber of Commerce helps to:

  • Promote entrepreneurship and small businesses within a community
  • Provide support and networking for struggling businesses
  • Lobby the government for better business conditions
Without the services that a Chamber of Commerce provides, small businesses struggle, and when this happens, the economy stagnates. Partially because of this problem, the economy of Masatepe, Nicaragua has become one of the worst in the Western Hemisphere.

Where is my money going?

Like any business, the Masatepe Chamber of Commerce is having to face startup expenses before money from dues begins to come in. For example, we need to cover:

  • Our first 6 months of rent
  • Extensive building renovations
  • Legal fees
  • Staff salaries
In exchange for your support, we'd love to send you some perks! We have some truly unique rewards that really reflect the culture of Masatepe and the businesses that have helped make this dream a reality. Choose from simple rewards like shout-outs, samples of Nicaraguan coffee and handicrafts, and even join us in Masatepe for a tour of the Chamber!

We are happy to say that Beto's Coffee Company, a founding member of the Masatepe Chamber of Commerce, has provided many of the perks that will be sent to you as a thank-you for your generosity. Check out their website and learn about how they have impacted the community of Masatepe.

It's time for a change.

Entrepreneurs in Masatepe deserve a chance to see their small businesses succeed, and the project to create a Chamber of Commerce could not be in better hands. For example:

  • International teams has been at work for many years to create sustainable change in the Masatepe area. Check out some of the things they've accomplished in the area on Brandon and Hannah's blog.
  • Illinois Enactus has tackled projects relating to sustainable entrepreneurship around the world and in their local community of Champaign-Urbana.

But what if I can't donate?

We understand that many of you who want to help may not be able to contribute financially. In that case please help us get the word out!

  • Share this campaign with your local Chamber of Commerce and ask them to make a contribution!
  • Share this link on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc: every little bit helps!

Contribute to the Masatepe Chamber of Commerce today!

story:
Indy Convergence has found the perfect building to call home in the Near West Side of Indianapolis. The area is undergoing thoughtful and exciting regrowth through community initiatives and Indianapolis's Great Places 2020 campaign. The building we hope to call home is located at the epicenter of the King St. and Michigan Ave "Great Place". Over the last few weeks we have met with community leaders, secured an option to buy the building through October 26 and raised nearly half of the money needed to purchase the building.

Here is where you come in. Your tax-deductible donation will help Indy Convergence put down firm, lasting roots in Indianapolis. This building will be a space for our annual artist gathering, community classes and meetings, a rooftop garden and a space where we can showcase what we have learned through Earthship to create sustainable structures. 

Why now? As an organization we are ready to have a space of our own to offer unlimited space to the professional artists that come through our programs. We are also ready to expand how Indy Convergence already operates in Haiti with the community of Oban using Asset Based Community Development. Our presence in the Near West Side will bring life to a partially vacant street and augment community programs to introduce arts, nightlife and business to a once thriving part of Indianapolis.

Don't wait, Donate. Your gift today helps us move forward with the purchase of this beatutiful space before our option to buy runs out on October 26, 2015. Not able to donate? Share our story or your talents with Indy Convergence. Contact Caitlin@indyconvergence.org if you have a skill, talent or time you would like to volunteer.

story:
WHAT IS CHANGE COFFEE?

Change Coffee is one day a year when we rally coffee drinkers across the nation (and soon the globe!) to buy one extra cup of coffee. 


So it's BUY 2, GET 1, with the value of the second cup funding on-the-ground programs for vulnerable kids through our non-profit organisation.

At Change Coffee HQ we know that for the price of a single cup of coffee, once a year, coffee drinkers can literally change the life of a child that has been orphaned or made vulnerable by AIDS. 


WHEN IS CHANGE COFFEE?
Annually on the first Friday of December. This year - 4th December 2015!



HOW CHANGE COFFEE WORKS!

It’s simple, it’s easy and it’s fun! Great coffee; a good cause.

First up: Café Owners – These socially responsible 'thought leaders'  will carry the distinctive symbols and branding of #ChangeCoffee and will serve all Change Coffee drinkers their bevvy of choice in a trendy, bright, happy, colourful cup that EVERYONE will want.


Next up: Coffee Drinkers! They drink coffee... so they're already awesome. When they buy their #ChangeCoffee on December 4th from a participating Café they'll be more than awesome; they'll be #ChangeCoffeeAwesome. 

Yes, of course that's an actual thing.




CHANGE COFFEE'S MISSION

We are on a mission to alleviate poverty and improve the lives of orphaned and vulnerable children in Sub-Saharan Africa.
Alleviating poverty is not a task of charity, it is an act of justice. Food, water, shelter, good health, an education and being spoilt are the birthright of all children.
Change Coffee will play it's part in creating this world.

WHO IS BEHIND CHANGE COFFEE?

Hi, I'm Robyn. In 2010, I visited an orphanage in South Africa. The children at the orphanage were more than just statistics; each had a unique story of pain and loss, and yet they approached life with such positivity and enthusiasm, despite some of their very basic needs not being met. 

Humbled and inspired by their warmth and affection, I decided I had to do something to improve the lives of these lost children and established the Eniwe Children’s Fund, a not-for-profit organisation.

Since then Eniwe Children’s Fund has raised over $300,000, and the Eniwe team has seen exciting, tangible results in these impoverished communities that has affirmed my belief in our ability to fundamentally change the lives of these kids.


WHAT WE NEED:

We need funds to enable us to launch big, hard and strong!

The funds we raise here will be used for the following:

Custom Change Coffee Cups

Printed material for marketing and POS information for the cafe's

Logoed T-shirts for our volunteers

Social Media, PR and Experiential marketing

Website design and development


WHAT CHANGE COFFEE CAN ACHIEVE:

Just to give you some perspective here...

1 x Change Coffee will feed 15 children for a day

1 x Change Coffee will feed 1 child for 15 days

25 x Change Coffees will feed 1 child for a whole year

285 x Change Coffees will build a new home for a Child Headed Household


Check out our groovy perks!

story:
There is always a thought in our mind that looms whenever our loved ones step out of the house, or when they go for long journey. A sense of fear that always prevails making us uneasy.Let’s say you realize something fishy or wrong, how do you inform the authorities about it? With the motive of making the world safer, I have come up with an App that gives a sense of security and a vigil on the world around us. We can help one another and prevent many mishaps that happen on daily basis. 

-- Oindexter: An easy to use app that will bring a ‘new necessary’ tool in personal safety and security to your pocket and handbag. It will do so by offering a new and easy way to provide you safety and security with your smart phone no matter where you are located.

 ---Oindexter offers an avenue for you to use your smart phones camera to scan vehicles license plate alerting the driver of an issue with their vehicle that they are unaware of via voice to text and/or scan functionality. Oindexter offers you a way to better ensure your personal safety and security around you. 

Let us tell you a little about how it works. 

 --Using image recognition and optical scanning Oindexter is able to scan the license plate and alert the driver of issue. Once the tag is scanned you can alert driver by sending a voice to text message and/or send text via functionality.You will have the option during registration to add the contacts of the people who apart from you that drives your vehicle.So using this app all the contacts registered on your contact list will be alerted about any issue, irrespective of as to who is driving the vehicle. 

--Oindexter will also be equipped with facial recognition. The benefit of this feature will be applicable when there’s a scene developing .This goes beyond the standard picture taken by your camera. This feature will isolate irrelevant information and identify the relevant information from the picture it needs to capture. The benefit of this App is not just confined for your safety but having a selfless prospect of making the community safe.

Now the question arises: What makes our app so useful and what you will find so valuable? To which the answer is, our apps’ voice to text feature and scan functionality. This is undoubtedly the feature which makes your smart phone smarter than before. Using our app on your device, you will be able to activate the app for using hands free – and that to discretely. Further when it comes to your own security,Oindexter promises to deliver a new peace of mind. Using Oindexter, you’re able to better secure both your personal safety when out in public, as well as that of your local neighborhood. Using our app when a crisis unfolds, you’re able to ensure there is a clear record of what occurs ‘as it happened’ – as well as providing evidence for authorities after the event has concluded thus helping the authorities and showing your responsibility as a citizen. 

There are many instances where justice is not served due to lack of evidence. But with Oindexter,it’s time going to change the dimensions altogether. Another important aspect is that we have detailed Oindexter with the most powerful feature: remote connection to emergency authorities in your local community. In this day and age, the need for emergency response and real-time data is foremost. You can help make yourself and your wider community safer by sending on the pictures taken in our app to local authorities. 

You can do this in the app ANONOMOUSLY. This ensures that while you will be a big help in keeping the public safe – your safety and your identity will never be at risk while you do so. All this from an app made with skill and pride in the USA and ready to export for use worldwide. You witness any suspicious activity; you report it to authorities within seconds.

The app will be connected to the 911 database and to the appropriate agency of issue reported. The idea is to reduce the crime rate and save lives anonymously. It’s the citizens who have to help the local bodies and the Government in making the World a better place. Criticizing is easy but that does no good. Instead, why not be a critique by showing and performing the selfless act of pertaining to human nature. One small help from you can surely do wonders to others.!

story:
Hi I’m Lynne Stewart the founder and owner of Soul Juicin, a brand new juicing company based out of Victor, NY producing freshly squeezed, healthy, and delicious drinks. Before I speak about the company and my dream, I’d like to explain the drive for developing my company.

My brother Rick Stewart was morbidly obese and our family was always trying to assist him in losing weight. Nothing helped Rick and he ended up contracting ecoli thru his body and died of complications June 26 of 2014. He was only 55 and I lost my brother and friend. My family and I were in shock and it was then that it occurred to me that it was time to make a change in my life and I started juicing again.

Before his death I had juiced and found that it gave me lots of energy instantly but I found it wasn't easy to do as far as the cleanup. After his death and with all the stress, food help provided comfort and with this unhealthy combination, I gained weight. I got away from juicing!

I decided to make a permanent change for myself! Juicing came back into my life and I have a real passion for it and believe strongly that others will benefit from it as well. My brothers situation has provided the drive I needed to make a change in my life as well as helping others. Being that it was difficult and time consuming to do on a small scale in my own kitchen, I researched how I could juice faster and more effectively.

As I was unemployed, I decided to research juicing as a business. This was different from my vast experience in marketing. The inner entrepreneur in me came out and I attended courses at Syracuse University to learn how to grow a company. Besides this knowledge, my contacts and networking list has grown where I now have a solid base of individuals and companies to help me.

Juicing experience and knowledge, along with my marketing experience, and growing network of businesses for the making and selling of juice, has provided me with the tools needed to start a company like this.

The juicing industry and found it to be a Five Billion Dollar industry and is growing 10-15% in the next ten years in each year.  The more I researched the more the juicing business intrigued me.  

A person I know has helped me purchase a Goodnature Coldpress X1 Juicer (1).  This has helped me produce (20-40 gallons ) juice and put this product on the market.   I need another commercial cooler, juice truck to attend festivals, 5k, tough mudders, pay for registration fees for these events, supplies such as labels, cups,fruits and vegetables.My business is growing more each week and I have got connected with Excellus and 37 schools to work with their administration and with University of Rochester for a future pilot program, also have been okd to sell my juice at Canandaigua sport events &  I also do three farm markets which I love . I need a lot  more money than I thought but in the long run it will be totally worth it.I am the first the first Cold Press Juice business in the Finger Lakes I think I can make it BIG and with all the help along with way with all my great friends and family.  SOUL JUICIN I hope will soon be a name everyone talks about when at sport events, family events . Please think changing to a Healthy Drink that will soothe your Soul. Think Soul Juicin  & Special thanks to all you that have helped me thru this journey so far, I will not forget you and all you have done for me.

…Keep Calm and Juice On with Soul Juicin.




  1. https://www.goodnature.com/pressing

www.indiegogo.com to donate today!

I need a lot  more money than I thought but in the long run it will be totally worth it.I am the first the first Cold Press Juice business in the Finger Lakes I think I can make it BIG and with all the help along with way with all my great friends and family.  SOUL JUICIN I hope will soon be a name everyone talks about when at sport events, family events . Please think changing to a Healthy Drink that will soothe your Soul. Think Soul Juicin  & Special thanks to all you that have helped me thru this journey so far, I will not forget you and all you have done for me.
…Keep Calm and Juice On with Soul Juicin.
https://www.goodnature.com/pressing
www.indiegogo.com to donate today!

story:
HELP ME MAKE MY DREAM OF HELPING OTHERS A REALITY!


Have you ever envisioned yourself waking up in the morning on a farm where you’d be required to do everything from collecting eggs to picking crops? Imagine your morning commute consisted of coffee and a short walk to the stable or farm, no one beeping, screaming or hustling around in a constant rush. Although for some this vision could seem like a dream, we are hoping to make this our reality!

Our Plan: Over the span of three months we hope to embark on a volunteer journey of helping farmers and communities around the United States build a more self-sufficient and sustainable being. Around the world communities are struggling due to lack of funds for labor and that’s where we come in! Farm owners will be providing room and board for our travels in exchange for the day to day labor needed to keep their farms running efficiently. 

It has always been a dream to travel the country and be a part of something that is bigger than me. During these three months we will be traveling to a variety of states volunteering at numerous farms. We will be keeping a blog to show the progress as well as an updated map to see where we have been, who we have helped and where we will be heading!

SO YOU ASK… WHY DO WE NEED YOUR HELP!

  • Volunteering will only be providing us with shelter and 1-2 meals per day, no source of payment.
  • By providing this volunteer experience without pay farmer can use the extra money for supplies and weatherization projects to keep their land safe!
  • Help me reach farms that are looking to gain education in solar electricity to help them explore subsidies and reimbursements to take their electricity to a more sustainable level!! 
  • Because you are awesome and can help us make this dream a reality not only for us, but also for those we will be helping. 

What We Need & What You Get

Where Does The Money Go:

Car Stuff: The majority of the money raised will be going towards transportation costs. The average cost of gas per gallon in the U.S is $3.50 per gallon at an estimated 8,000 miles for this journey with an estimated $1,500 dollars in gas (OUCH!) Along with other car costs such as state tolls, oil changes and small maintenance as needed

Unexpected Stuff: When traveling it is only safe to assume that something terrible and unexpected may occur so a small blanket to help avoid that would be IDEAL!

Volunteer/Farming Stuff: Equipment that my normal 9-5 office job does not require but my new farming job will (small tools,gloves, boots etc.)

Food Stuff: While most hosts provide 1-2 meals per day we will be needing funding for food and water in between farms and where hosts can not provided 3 meals a day! 

Other Stuff: Things we are hoping to get to live more efficiently while on the road such as a solar backpack for charging and staying updated, emergency first aid kit, toiletries, reusable bags, water purifiers and more! 

The Impact

  • Farmers will be provided with 2 weeks to 1 month of free labor on their community land projects or farms! 
  • With the saved costs of labor they will be able to make a bigger impact on the sustainability of their community. 
  • Education for me about things I cannot learn in my normal 9-5 office job. I hope to learn as much as possible and educate others when I return. My end hope if to get small groups of people to build knowledge and volunteer themselves. (maybe you will be one of the people who decided a volunteer farm life is for YOU!)

Risks & Challenges

  • Maybe we will fail, but until we try we will never know 
  • With a small budget we cannot reach all the farms and communities we would like. The money raised will help ensure that we will not need to end our journey early, the  more funding we raise the longer we can volunteer and the more sustainable and educated we will become! 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Can't donate online or just don't want to? We can accept cash and check donations that will be added to the campaign! Best part is you'll still get your perks.
  • Head over to our Facebook so you can keep up to date with whats going on in our travels =) 
  • Please share our page to get the word out that we are trying to embark on this volunteer journey! 

HELP ME MAKE MY DREAM OF HELPING OTHERS A REALITY!

If you have questions reach out i'd love to chat                                      amanda.fronduto@gmail.com                                               

And that's all there is to it

story:
Honey is an organization dedicated to stopping the silence around sexual assault. We seek to change public attitudes through various mediums, such as:
  • Education
  • Victim Advocacy
  • Media Campaigns
  • Community Activism
  • Truth Telling

Honey aims to change the way we think about sexual assault as a global community, so survivors never feel ashamed or fearful for telling the truth, seeking help, or reporting their assault. In so many circumstances, discussing sexual assault is socially taboo and survivors fear how they'll be received if they do speak up. Our goal with encouraging conversation is to lessen, if not eliminate, victim-blaming and the stigmas surrounding survivors.
We believe that the more people talk, the more likely it is that sexual violence will be eradicated. As humans, we care about the things we understand, and we believe that conversation leads to understanding and understanding leads to action. We're making noise.



HOW IT BEGAN

We, Taylor and Taylor (the founders of Honey), were both sexually assaulted as teenagers. It took both of us years to come forward and talk about our individual assaults. And like many other survivors, we spent those silent years blaming ourselves and experiencing overwhelming amounts of shame, distrust, guilt, fear and secrecy–among many other things. As friends, we came forward to one another about our individual traumas. 

Filled with both heartache and love, we naturally felt propelled to do something bigger—something more. We didn’t want anyone else to suffer like we had for so long. And after a fair amount of research, we found that we were two silent survivors in a sea of millions. We knew we needed to help those who had been assaulted and protect those who hadn't. 

And then came Honey.

      

                        (Taylor Jarman)                                            (Taylor Rippy Monson)

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

We have taken Honey as far as we can alone. Everything thus far has come out-of-pocket or has been donated by a variety of tremendously selfless individuals (whom we cannot thank enough). But our pockets and the generosity of those offering their time and talents at no cost won't be able to sustain Honey as we take it to a global level. We are asking for $100,000 to sustain and expand Honey for the next fiscal year. Your generous donations will go directly to: 

Marketing

  • General market research
  • Advertising and promotion
  • Printing costs (print advertising, newsletters, direct mail, press releases)
  • Website development
  • Manufacturing costs (merchandise, clothing, etc.)

Research and Development

  • Market research in the education sector
  • Curriculum development
  • Content design
  • Production and labor (printing, shipping)
  • Partnership development

Establishing a Part-Time Team with Independently Contracted Professionals

  • Clinical professionals (in the field of sexual trauma)
  • Creatives (graphic designers, web developers, etc.)
  • Strategists
  • Legal counsel
  • Accountants

Events and Implementation

  • Event space and venue rental fees
  • Equipment rentals
  • Compensation for speakers/professionals/team
  • Travel (flights, gas, hotel, food, etc.)
What if we don't reach our goal? Honey will move forward with the funds that are donated, and every cent will be spent on the items listed above. 

THE IMPACT

In its first few months, Honey has touched the hearts of many. As you can see on our "Truths" page, Honey has already begun making the proper noise assault deserves. Each story is one domino in a larger effort to expand the conversation.
      

Both survivors and friends of survivors have felt the courage to speak up about this issue because of Honey. Even those who haven't experienced assault themselves feel that Honey resonates with them deeply (likely because most everyone knows someone who has experienced sexual assault).

Because of Honey, dozens of survivors have already been successfully connected to their local rape crisis center and/or with an advocate in their area and have received help. In such a heart-wrenching and painful time, we understand how difficult it can be for a survivor to ask for help—even from a stranger—and we applaud each and every person for their individual triumphs, big and small. 

Co-founder Taylor Rippy Monson held a roundtable forum on sexual assault in the name of Honey at a Caux conference in Switzerland earlier this summer. Although the organization was in its infancy, the forum ended up being a resounding success. Over forty individuals ranging in age from 18 to 74 years attended, with representation from 12 countries. There were equal amounts of smiles and tears in the room. As simple as the forum was, it proved how far-reaching Honey could be.

We've had requests that the website be translated into Arabic, inquiries about how one can become an international Honey representative, messages from teachers who want Honey curriculum, the list (and the emails) go on and on. We plan to make each and every one of these happen (and then some), but we cannot do it without your help!

The repercussions of your donations will be long-lasting and life changing for so many. This conversation is relevant and much needed—more than many of us recognize.


RISKS & CHALLENGES

With any project this large, there are potential obstacles we might face. This is the first business that we have started, and it's a learning process as we continue to expand. We are grateful to be surrounded by seasoned supporters and advisors in the business and nonprofit sectors that are helping us make Honey as successful as it can be.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

We completely understand that some of you cannot contribute in the form of a monetary donation, but it doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about our crowd-funding campaign. To put a cherry on top, also share with your friends and family why they should give Honey a chance—and maybe even donate!
  • Anytime you come across content that is relevant to Honey, please send it to us so we can add it to our "Essentials" page!
  • Stand up and believe in survivors. Speak up when your friends use language that perpetuates rape culture. Make some noise however and wherever you can.
  • Share your own Truth (anonymously or publicly) via the "Truths" page on our website.

FOLLOW HONEY
Be sure to like us on Facebook and follow us on Instagram for updates, news about upcoming events, campaigns and other opportunities to get involved.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
We completely understand that some of you cannot contribute in the form of a monetary donation, but it doesn't mean you can't help!



Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about our crowd-funding campaign. To put a cherry on top, also share with your friends and family why they should give Honey a chance—and maybe even donate!

Anytime you come across content that is relevant to Honey, please send it to us so we can add it to our "Essentials" page!

FOLLOW HONEY

story:
Click Here for English!


Clickez Ici pour Français!


Breve Historia de Don Luis y su familia...

Don Luis Bustos y su familia vivían en el municipio de El Castillo, departamento del Meta.  En 2002 fueron desplazados por la violencia paramilitar y estatal que se ensañó, especialmente, con los campesinos de la parte alta del municipio y con los líderes sociales. Don Luis y su familia son ambas cosas y, debido a las constantes amenazas, así como a los combates que se estaban librando en su vereda, tuvieron que dejar su mundo, su casa, su hogar, todo aquello por lo que habían luchado y conseguido con trabajo honesto y constante. 


Salieron hacia Villavicencio con apenas lo que pudieron cargar. Llegaron a un barrio de invasión “La Nohora” donde cientos de familias, en condiciones similares a las de ellos, la mayoría de ellas provenientes de la región del Ariari y del Guaviare, se encontraban luchando contra la montaña y las autoridades, para poder armar unos ranchos que, aunque precarios, los guarnecieran de la lluvia y de la noche.  

Vista transversal del rancho

De esta forma, con mucho esfuerzo, construyeron una nueva morada. Utilizaron unas pocas tejas de zinc, un plástico verde que se conoce como “paroi” (quiere decir en la jerga popular “para hoy”) y algo de madera cortada de ese mismo monte. En ese rancho se establecieron y ahí han vivido los últimos 13 años.  Trabajando, pero también esperando una reparación estatal que no llega, un subsidio de vivienda que tampoco se concreta 

Vista frontal del rancho

Cuando los conocimos nos impactó su inteligencia, su nobleza. Su capacidad de lucha a pesar de las vulneraciones y las indignidades. Su continuo liderazgo. Por eso decidimos buscar la manera de darles una mano y apoyarlos. Porque aunque sabemos que es difícil cambiar el mundo e imposible darle una solución a cada una de esas 6,500,000 personas que el conflicto armado ha dejado desplazadas en Colombia (de acuerdo con las cifras oficiales) también sabemos que no podemos quedarnos quietos cuando tenemos la capacidad de contribuir, aunque sea mínimamente, a mejorar algunas realidades.  

Doña Cinia y su hija, al interior del rancho

Así que decidimos unirnos y entre todos, ¡muchos!, ayudar a reemplazar el humilde rancho por una vivienda digna. Vamos bien. La obra ya comenzó con la ayuda económica y mano de obra de familiares y amigos.  Ya desarmamos el rancho, nivelamos el terreno y comenzamos con los cimientos de la nueva casa.  Los materiales de construcción, la mano de obra de los obreros y sobre todo la subida de los materiales al monte son lo más costoso.  Necesitamos de tu ayuda para continuar con la construcción y poder ofrecerle a Don Luis una ayuda solidaria.

Plano de la nueva casa

Estado de la obra después de tres semanas de trabajo


La totalidad de los fondos recaudados, incluso si no llegamos a la meta, serán utilizados en la construcción de la casa y en la adecuación de sus espacios exteriores e interiores. 
De antemano muchas gracias

English


Brief story of Don Luis and his family...
Don Luis Bustos and his family used to live in “El Castillo” municipality in the department of Meta.  In 2002 they were forcefully displaced by the paramilitary and state violence which principally targeted peasants in the high part of the municipality and the community leaders. Don Luis and his family are both and due to the constant threats to their lives, along with the combats being held in his area, they had to flee their world, their house, their home and everything they had earned with honest and constant work.

They fled to Villavicencio barely with what they were able to carry with them. They arrived at the slum “La Nohora” where hundreds of families in similar conditions, most of them coming from the Ariari and Guaviare regions, were struggling against the mountain and the government in order to build some shanty houses that, no matter how precarious, give shelter from rain and the night. 
Side view of the shanty house

Thus, after much effort, they built their new home. They used some zinc sheets for the roof, some green plastic sheets popullary called “paroi” (this is a slang version of “Para hoy” that means “Just for today”) and some wood planks cut from the nearby trees. In this humble house they have lived for the last 13 years. They have not been only working but also waiting for some state reparations that never come and for a housing allowance that also fails to materialize.
front view of the shanty house

When we met don Luis we were moved by his intelligence, kindness, his continuous leadership and his capacity to fight despite all the indignities and transgressions he has endured. That’s why we have decided to find a way to support them and help them out. Because even though we know it’s hard to change the world and it’s impossible to give a clear solution to the 6,500,000 displaced people by the Colombian internal conflict (According to the Government official record) we also know we cannot stay still when we have the possibility to make a contribution, however small it may be, in order to improve some peoples lives.
Mrs. Cinia and her daughter inside the shanty house

So we have decided o take action, get together, and between all of us to help replace this humble shanty house for a proper, livable house.  the construction has already started with the economic help and workforce of friends and family.  We have already dismantled the shanty house, prepared the field and built the new house's foundations.  The materials, workers, and most of all the transportation of the materials to the site (no roads get here) have been the most expensive.  We need your help to continue with the construction, and be able to offer Don Luis this solidary help.

Blueprints for the new house

Construction site after three weeks' work

The entirety of the funds raised, even if we do not reach the goal, will be invested in the construction of the house and the interior and exterior areas' adaptation.

In advance, thank you!


Français


Bref histoire of Don Luis et sa famille...
Don Luis Bustos et sa famille habitaient à la campagne dans les plaines de l'est de la Colombie au village de El Castillo.  En 2002, dans un des nombreux épisodes de la violence qui sévit depuis plus de cinquante ans au pays, ils ont dû fuir. En effet, les protagonistes de cette épisode n'étaient pas les guérillas mais l'autre acteur très actif : les armes paramilitaires qui agissaient main dans le main avec l'État, s'acharnant sur les paysans et les leaders communautaires. Don Luis et sa famille, faisant partie des deux, et suite aux combats qui se livraient dans sa vereda et à des nombreuses menaces, ont dû partir, quitter tout ce qu'ils connaissaient et tout pour quoi ils avaient travaillé dur et honnêtement.

Ils sont partis à Villavicencio, capitale de la région, juste avec ce qu'ils pouvaient mettre à leur dos, pour s'y installer à une "comuna", sortes des favelas colombiennes, connu comme La Nohora. Des centaines des familles, dans des conditions similaires aux leurs et en provenance du sud du pays principalement, y étaient installées. En lutte constante contre les autorités et la montagne, ils avaient réussi à lui arracher un bout de terrain où installer leurs précaires cahutes, petites huttes de fortune qui malgré tout les protège de la pluie et de la nuit.
Vue de coté du cahute

Ainsi et avec beaucoup d'effort ils ont construit leur cahute, avec des toiles en zinc, du bois de la même montagne et du plastic vert nommé "paroi" : non pas une appropriation du solide mot français mais en allusion au vocable "para hoy", juste pour aujourd'hui.  Là et depuis treize ans, ils continuent ardument leur travail, en attente d'une réparation d'État aux victimes et exilés qui peine d'arriver, afin de reconstruire une vrai maison.
Vue de face du cahute

Quand nous les avons rencontrés leur intelligence, leur humilité, nous ont impacté. Malgré la violence et les outrages ils continuent de lutter, de fédérer. Nous nous sommes donc décidés à les aider. Conscients que, dans une guerre longue de cinquante ans et qui compte désormais - selon les chiffres officiels - plus de six million d'exilés, aider une famille n'est qu'une goutte d'eau dans une mer de détresse, l'immobilité nous est impossible face à la possibilité d'améliorer ne serait ce que le destin de ces cinq personnes. 
Madame Cinia et sa fille à l'intérieur du cahute

Nous nous sommes unis, nombreux ! pour leur aider à transformer leur cahute en une vraie maison. Comme les photos en témoignent, on a déjà commencé les travaux avec l'aide économique et le travail de nos amis et famille.  Nous avons déjà démonté la cahute, préparé le terrain et construit les fondations de la nouvelle maison.  Néanmoins, les matériels et surtout la transportation des mêmes (les vois publiques n'arrivent pas ici) ont été les plus coûteux.  Nous avons donc besoin de votre aide pour continuer avec la construction, et offrir à don Luis et sa famille une aide solidaire.  

 Plans de la nouvelle maison

Construction après trois semaines de travaux 

La totalité des fond réunis, même si nous n'arrivons pas aux 5000 dollars, seront utilisés dans la construction de la maison et l'adéquation de ses espaces intérieurs et extérieurs. 

Par avance merci!
story_txt:
Click Here for English!

Clickez Ici pour Français!




Breve Historia de Don Luis y su familia...Don Luis Bustos y su familia vivían en el municipio de El Castillo, departamento del Meta.  En 2002 fueron desplazados por la violencia paramilitar y estatal que se ensañó, especialmente, con los campesinos de la parte alta del municipio y con los líderes sociales. Don Luis y su familia son ambas cosas y, debido a las constantes amenazas, así como a los combates que se estaban librando en su vereda, tuvieron que dejar su mundo, su casa, su hogar, todo aquello por lo que habían luchado y conseguido con trabajo honesto y constante. 



Salieron hacia Villavicencio con apenas lo que pudieron cargar. Llegaron a un barrio de invasión “La Nohora” donde cientos de familias, en condiciones similares a las de ellos, la mayoría de ellas provenientes de la región del Ariari y del Guaviare, se encontraban luchando contra la montaña y las autoridades, para poder armar unos ranchos que, aunque precarios, los guarnecieran de la lluvia y de la noche.  

Vista transversal del rancho


De esta forma, con mucho esfuerzo, construyeron una nueva morada. Utilizaron unas pocas tejas de zinc, un plástico verde que se conoce como “paroi” (quiere decir en la jerga popular “para hoy”) y algo de madera cortada de ese mismo monte. En ese rancho se establecieron y ahí han vivido los últimos 13 años.  Trabajando, pero también esperando una reparación estatal que no llega, un subsidio de vivienda que tampoco se concreta 

Vista frontal del rancho


Cuando los conocimos nos impactó su inteligencia, su nobleza. Su capacidad de lucha a pesar de las vulneraciones y las indignidades. Su continuo liderazgo. Por eso decidimos buscar la manera de darles una mano y apoyarlos. Porque aunque sabemos que es difícil cambiar el mundo e imposible darle una solución a cada una de esas 6,500,000 personas que el conflicto armado ha dejado desplazadas en Colombia (de acuerdo con las cifras oficiales) también sabemos que no podemos quedarnos quietos cuando tenemos la capacidad de contribuir, aunque sea mínimamente, a mejorar algunas realidades.  

Doña Cinia y su hija, al interior del rancho


Así que decidimos unirnos y entre todos, ¡muchos!, ayudar a reemplazar el humilde rancho por una vivienda digna. Vamos bien. La obra ya comenzó con la ayuda económica y mano de obra de familiares y amigos.  Ya desarmamos el rancho, nivelamos el terreno y comenzamos con los cimientos de la nueva casa.  Los materiales de construcción, la mano de obra de los obreros y sobre todo la subida de los materiales al monte son lo más costoso.  Necesitamos de tu ayuda para continuar con la construcción y poder ofrecerle a Don Luis una ayuda solidaria.


Plano de la nueva casa


Estado de la obra después de tres semanas de trabajo



La totalidad de los fondos recaudados, incluso si no llegamos a la meta, serán utilizados en la construcción de la casa y en la adecuación de sus espacios exteriores e interiores. 
De antemano muchas gracias


English

Brief story of Don Luis and his family...


Don Luis Bustos and his family used to live in “El Castillo” municipality in the department of Meta.  In 2002 they were forcefully displaced by the paramilitary and state violence which principally targeted peasants in the high part of the municipality and the community leaders. Don Luis and his family are both and due to the constant threats to their lives, along with the combats being held in his area, they had to flee their world, their house, their home and everything they had earned with honest and constant work.

They fled to Villavicencio barely with what they were able to carry with them. They arrived at the slum “La Nohora” where hundreds of families in similar conditions, most of them coming from the Ariari and Guaviare regions, were struggling against the mountain and the government in order to build some shanty houses that, no matter how precarious, give shelter from rain and the night. 

Side view of the shanty house


Thus, after much effort, they built their new home. They used some zinc sheets for the roof, some green plastic sheets popullary called “paroi” (this is a slang version of “Para hoy” that means “Just for today”) and some wood planks cut from the nearby trees. In this humble house they have lived for the last 13 years. They have not been only working but also waiting for some state reparations that never come and for a housing allowance that also fails to materialize.

front view of the shanty house


When we met don Luis we were moved by his intelligence, kindness, his continuous leadership and his capacity to fight despite all the indignities and transgressions he has endured. That’s why we have decided to find a way to support them and help them out. Because even though we know it’s hard to change the world and it’s impossible to give a clear solution to the 6,500,000 displaced people by the Colombian internal conflict (According to the Government official record) we also know we cannot stay still when we have the possibility to make a contribution, however small it may be, in order to improve some peoples lives.

Mrs. Cinia and her daughter inside the shanty house



So we have decided o take action, get together, and between all of us to help replace this humble shanty house for a proper, livable house.  the construction has already started with the economic help and workforce of friends and family.  We have already dismantled the shanty house, prepared the field and built the new house's foundations.  The materials, workers, and most of all the transportation of the materials to the site (no roads get here) have been the most expensive.  We need your help to continue with the construction, and be able to offer Don Luis this solidary help.

Blueprints for the new house



Construction site after three weeks' work

The entirety of the funds raised, even if we do not reach the goal, will be invested in the construction of the house and the interior and exterior areas' adaptation.
In advance, thank you!


Français

Bref histoire of Don Luis et sa famille...


Don Luis Bustos et sa famille habitaient à la campagne dans les plaines de l'est de la Colombie au village de El Castillo.  En 2002, dans un des nombreux épisodes de la violence qui sévit depuis plus de cinquante ans au pays, ils ont dû fuir. En effet, les protagonistes de cette épisode n'étaient pas les guérillas mais l'autre acteur très actif : les armes paramilitaires qui agissaient main dans le main avec l'État, s'acharnant sur les paysans et les leaders communautaires. Don Luis et sa famille, faisant partie des deux, et suite aux combats qui se livraient dans sa vereda et à des nombreuses menaces, ont dû partir, quitter tout ce qu'ils connaissaient et tout pour quoi ils avaient travaillé dur et honnêtement.

Ils sont partis à Villavicencio, capitale de la région, juste avec ce qu'ils pouvaient mettre à leur dos, pour s'y installer à une "comuna", sortes des favelas colombiennes, connu comme La Nohora. Des centaines des familles, dans des conditions similaires aux leurs et en provenance du sud du pays principalement, y étaient installées. En lutte constante contre les autorités et la montagne, ils avaient réussi à lui arracher un bout de terrain où installer leurs précaires cahutes, petites huttes de fortune qui malgré tout les protège de la pluie et de la nuit.

Vue de coté du cahute


Ainsi et avec beaucoup d'effort ils ont construit leur cahute, avec des toiles en zinc, du bois de la même montagne et du plastic vert nommé "paroi" : non pas une appropriation du solide mot français mais en allusion au vocable "para hoy", juste pour aujourd'hui.  Là et depuis treize ans, ils continuent ardument leur travail, en attente d'une réparation d'État aux victimes et exilés qui peine d'arriver, afin de reconstruire une vrai maison.

Vue de face du cahute


Quand nous les avons rencontrés leur intelligence, leur humilité, nous ont impacté. Malgré la violence et les outrages ils continuent de lutter, de fédérer. Nous nous sommes donc décidés à les aider. Conscients que, dans une guerre longue de cinquante ans et qui compte désormais - selon les chiffres officiels - plus de six million d'exilés, aider une famille n'est qu'une goutte d'eau dans une mer de détresse, l'immobilité nous est impossible face à la possibilité d'améliorer ne serait ce que le destin de ces cinq personnes. 

Madame Cinia et sa fille à l'intérieur du cahute



Nous nous sommes unis, nombreux ! pour leur aider à transformer leur cahute en une vraie maison. Comme les photos en témoignent, on a déjà commencé les travaux avec l'aide économique et le travail de nos amis et famille.  Nous avons déjà démonté la cahute, préparé le terrain et construit les fondations de la nouvelle maison.  Néanmoins, les matériels et surtout la transportation des mêmes (les vois publiques n'arrivent pas ici) ont été les plus coûteux.  Nous avons donc besoin de votre aide pour continuer avec la construction, et offrir à don Luis et sa famille une aide solidaire.  

 Plans de la nouvelle maison


Construction après trois semaines de travaux 

La totalité des fond réunis, même si nous n'arrivons pas aux 5000 dollars, seront utilisés dans la construction de la maison et l'adéquation de ses espaces intérieurs et extérieurs. 
Par avance merci!

story:
SOULS of Society is a media network that uses storytelling to connect communities and increase compassion and empathy.


SOULS was born in San Francisco and we are raising funds to create an online storytelling school and start new chapters in Oakland, Los Angeles, and Brooklyn.

The Vision

Empower people to become storytellers in their communities. In 4 years SOULS of San Francisco built a community of over 150,000 people in 45 countries by sharing the unique energy of San Francisco. Every place has something special to offer so I want to create SOULS chapters in other cities all over the world!

We'll do this by creating a series of online videos to teach:

  • street photography
  • how to start a conversation on the street with a stranger
  • how to conduct an interview
  • how to create a story from that interview
  • photo editing techniques
  • how to use social media to build a community around the work
  • how to create symbiotic relationships with media outlets
  • how to use this storytelling skill set to travel
Sidenote: I learned more walking around talking to people in my community in 4 years than I did going to college...I'm just saying!

About Me

Hi there ~ I'm Dijon, a bay area based photographer, filmmaker, writer, and lover of people.

Since 2011 I've taken over 5,000 street portraits with stories. What started as a personal art project has turned into a international movement that spreads love, compassion, and empathy. You may have seen it in SF Weekly, Hoodline, the Huffington Post, SF Gate, or the SF Chronicle!


Recently the content has expanded beyond the street and I've been creating videos and podcasts.

Through doing this work I've learned that my happiness comes from service, service to my community. SOULS is how I serve. It's also a great way for people to connect and celebrate each other. I believe the capacity of this project to create cross cultural dialogue and harmony is limitless. 

Your generous support will also help cover:

  • Hiring a team to help run SOULS: social media manager, website maintenance, community manager, PR person, storytellers (paying myself is included in that)
  • All the perks listed to the right and below
  • opening SOULS chapters in different cities. Each $10,000 we raise will help us launch in a new city

The Perks

___________________________________________________

___________________________________________________

Check out the FB Event HERE

___________________________________________________

___________________________________________________

Dark Twain Soundcloud | Levi Alexander Soundcloud

___________________________________________________

___________________________________________________

$3,333 - The SOUL Essence Package

Have your story told in video form by ingenious filmmaker Taylor Soppe. Taylor will spend a day with you creating a 2-8min video to celebrate you SOUL.

Taylor Soppe is a video producer who shoots and edits stories about people, companies and products. She approaches each project as a challenge to create content with distinct personality and style and as an opportunity to grow as a creator.

Check out an example of her work below:


___________________________________________________

The Impact

SOULS of Society is committed to uplifting communities:

  • We will do at least 2 philanthropic campaigns each year where we tell the stories of a socially minded organization. In 2015 we helped Essie Justice Group raise over $24,000 to help women with incarcerated loved ones, and Lessons for Life raise over $10,000 to give free music lessons to urban youths.
  • We'll provide up and coming artist the chance to learn about and celebrate their communities. Artists create culture, and culture is what community is all about.
  • We'll be creating a world wide media network that's people centric. Everyone's perspective is valued and heard.

Risks & Challenges

As I'm sure you've heard, San Francisco is the most expensive place in America to live. It's become increasingly difficult to survive as an artist here. Over the course of my 9 years here I've crashed with friends, slept in cars, and held down multiple jobs just to make ends meet. I'd like to be able to create a solid foundation for my life and for other creatives to use their talents to enrich our collective experience.

Every ounce of support, whether you support us financially or share on social media helps to solidify the foundation of this movement.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share your story of how SOULS of Society has affected your life. Post about it using #SOULSofSociety on social media. 

  • Email your friends and solicit their support.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

With deep gratitude,

Dijon

story:
Short Summary

Hello beautiful Souls! My name is Huang Bingjie, aka Bingz and I'm an intuitive healer and I need USD$1500 to fund my dream of becoming a certified The Wonder Method™ instructor, which would allow me to teach The Wonder Method™ group classes anywhere in the world.

The Wonder Method™ (www.thewondermethod.com) is a very gentle unfolding method that can be done for healing work, manifestation work and to aid in the spiritual awakening process. Even though I have already been helping many people heal since 2009 using other energy healing modalities, I found that The Wonder Method™ offers the gentlest yet most rapid healing results in both myself and my clients. It focuses on Being rather than Doing, and on staying open rather than using energy shielding techniques. I have been studying and practicing this modality for 4 years and am currently a certified practitioner.

I feel that The Wonder Method™ is immensely helpful for 

  • energetically sensitive people who are tired of constantly needing to shield themselves or "toughen up" so as to protect their own energetic boundaries
  • healers looking for a simpler, more intuitive way to heal
  • people who are focused on their spiritual enlightenment and awakening process

I believe that being a certified instructor will allow me to expand my reach in teaching this valuable skill to these people. 

What I Need & What You Get

  • I will need USD$500 to take the 6-week Instructor level class for The Wonder Method™ (held in end March 2016), and another USD$500 to pay for the annual certification.  The remaining USD$500 will go towards my online website hosting, as well as online and local marketing efforts.
  • You will get to receive one-on-one healing and/or coaching in The Wonder Method™ that offers you gentle yet rapid healing results.  
  • I will need a minimum of USD$500 in order to take the Instructor class as my first step. If the funds go below USD$500 I will use it to fund my marketing efforts for my current healing practice (website hosting costs, venue rentals for introductory meditations and workshops). 

The Impact

This dream is really valuable to me because this is how I want to be known for my contribution to the world: 

  • to inspire and train more gifted healers/ lightworkers/ empaths
  • promote energy awareness and how energy heals on all levels: physically, mentally, emotionally, spiritually. 
  • to inspire energetically sensitive people that by Being more, and Doing less, they create more love and light into their lives which in turn causes a ripple effects to the rest of the world.
This is also how I want to be seen by my two young children: a mom who dares to dream, believes in her dream and is committed to live her dream even when it's a slightly unconventional dream.
Testimonial
Here's a detailed testimonial by my long-term client Ana Coeur (Couturier of Luxury French Furniture, CEO of Anahatta):

"All I can say is, 'Wow, wow, wow, wow, wow.' I've worked with many healers before to heal my core wounds, but it is Bingz that takes the cake for giving me the most powerful healing sessions I've ever experienced.

Bingz is very intuitive when it comes to where your pain is lurking in your energy body. She expertly guided me to feel the feelings that I had trouble accessing and helped me open the right doors in my heart. Like a gentle, soothing guide with a flashlight, Bingz took me to the deepest part of my pain and from there, all hell broke loose (in a mighty good way).

In her healing sessions, I've experienced deep releasing of pain through intense sobbing as well as hysterical laughter (and going back and forth between both), losing my breath, seeing visions in my head and everything in between. By the time we are finished, (and she helps you zero in quite quickly, I might add), it will feel like you started off in hell but somehow ended up in a spiritual cathedral. Where I had given away my power to this person for the last 35 years, by the end of the healing session I gained all my power back. Part roller coaster ride, part dumping ground, part sanctuary, Bingz is a safe place to do the most sacred and delicate work your soul is asking you to do.

After the healing sessions with Bingz, I feel elated, light, peaceful, free and most of all I feel my core issues have been resolved and released - not chipped away little but little, but cleared. From working with Bingz, for the time time ever she has helped me reach this feeling of flying in the sky, a blissful freedom that I've never, ever known.

Bingz gently guides you through her 'wonder' statements that help you change the way you access your pain and then ultimately shift them. Her wonder statements, which she crafts on the spot, are potent, depending on the medicine your heart needs at the time.

Her approach is gentle, inquisitive, curious, compassionate, non-judgmental and peaceful. I feel safe going very deep with Bingz. She is the right healer for you if you are ready to knock out your core issues once and for all. She is an important part of my transformation and I highly recommend letting her take care of you and help you transform from pain to peace.

A million thanks and blessings to you Bingz, for doing what you do."

Risks & Challenges

Bingz Healing Hands is a one-woman show, and my absolute first priority will always be in taking good care of my two young boys, so my biggest challenge will be in scheduling enough time to study and practise whatever I have learned in the Instructor level course. I have gone through the first two courses with even less time and babysitting help available to me compared to now, so I am confident that I will conquer this challenge well.

The path to entrepreneurship is often lonely, so in anticipation of this, I have already started to reconnect with my other holistic practitioner colleagues and I am more willing to form new connections through more active participation in local holistic events. I have started building valuable friendships with empaths in a closed Facebook community and feel comfortable sharing my vulnerability whenever new challenges come along.   

I am in the process of unwinding my shy and introverted tendencies and I am gaining the courage to teach group classes.  This is now an exciting challenge that I am becoming capable of. Having a website (http://www.bingzhealinghands.me), blogging and recording healing podcasts has helped me to find my voice on what I believe about healing with gentleness. I will also be leading short group meditations to prepare myself for teaching the group classes. 

Other Ways You Can Help

It's alright if you can't contribute monetarily for now. You can also help by:
  • sharing my link to this campaign on all your social media accounts.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word with grace and ease!

With deep gratitude,

Bingz

I will also be leading short group meditations to prepare myself for teaching the group classes.    Other Ways You Can Help
It's alright if you can't contribute monetarily for now. You can also help by:

sharing my link to this campaign on all your social media accounts.

You can use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word with grace and ease!
   With deep gratitude,Bingz

story:
About this project


Millénaire™ is an app that will revolutionize traditional online shopping. Online shopping is a multi-billion dollar business and we are doing it all wrong! Imagine an app that allows you to bundle your selected items from different online retailers; while also providing you with suggested items based on previous likes and purchases. Millénaire™ is that app!

Features


Team


Jenna Kyle is a young professional who loves fashion and loves to shop.  Growing up, Jenna was a child model and had aspirations of being a fashion designer- decorating the house with pictures of her sketches.  As she got older, her career interests changed but her love for fashion never faded.

In 2013, frustrated with conventional online shopping, Jenna began to think of a solution.  In that moment, the Millénaire™ shopping app was born.  Based on the customer's own favorites, the app provides curated suggestions that allow the user to have a complete shopping experience.  The user is able to purchase items from within the app and bundle shipments.  Gone are the days of searching store after store for one item.  You can favorite an item once and immediately similar items and complimentary outfit pieces will populate on your home screen.

Not only does the app provide customers with the satisfaction of shopping smarter, but it allows retailers the ability to capture more sales.  In 2015, clothing and accessories topped the list of all ecommerce sales, coming in higher than computer hardware!  Retailers will be encouraged to partner with Millenaire to provide suggested items that will show up in a user's feed, tailored to their previously favorited items.  It’s a win-win for consumers and retailers alike! 


Rewards                                        

We are partnering with American Apparel to provide custom Millenaire t-shirts and hoodies!

Timeline


Budget



$15,000 is needed to develop the app for iphone and for perk fulfillment. Stretch Goals will help with an Android version and a more personalized website. Given a successful campaign, any additional funds will be used for outsourcing additional future work/branding opportunities.


Risks and Challenges


We hope to reach our goal. But, in the event that it is not reached, all funds will go towards the creation of an iphone app and any costs associated with development.


FAQ


Q: When will I receive my reward?

A: We will begin shipping as soon as we receive them from our manufacturer, which should be within 30 days of the completion of the campaign.  Barring any unforeseen delays, you should have your reward before the end of August 2016.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, all. I'm Yvonne LeFave, the founder and president of Go Green Trikes, LLC. For close to two years now, I and those that contract with Go Green Trikes have been hauling things for both individuals and companies using heavy duty, electric-assist trikes, bikes, and trailers, managing loads up to 500 pounds!
We here at Go Green Trikes have noticed a need/trend that we'd love to help provide locally. Everyone from the university student to the weekend warrior have expressed a strong desire to be able to do more with their own bike efficiently and cost effectively.  We think we've found the perfect open source solution but need help bringing it to the local community.

Imagine a trailer with its own electric-assist motor that can be hauled behind your bike. With the help of this rented trailer, you could:

+  Do small apartment/dorm room local moves

+ Collect metal or food wastes for recycling/composting

+ Do your own bulk shopping without a car or the bus

+ Bring home purchases too large to fit in your compact car

+ Haul up to 500 pounds behind your existing bike with very little drag thanks to its own electric-assist hub motor

See the trailer in action in this video clip from the designer/engineer and those who used the prototype in their garden coop in Germany:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b2CQG7rqMZM

What We Need & What You Get

I've lined up some folks with welding and green tech credentials and have the open source designs from the engineer at Carla Cargo. What I need now is some funds to help make it happen.  We're estimating the costs per unit at $3,500 and plan to have several of them made and available to rent.  We're currently researching smart locks and ways to have these available 24/7 at a secured location. From the looks of it, this is the part that will cost the most to provide.

Even if we make as little as $7,000 from this campaign, we can still make this happen! There just won't be as many and/or they may not be as available. 

The Impact

If more folks can do more with green technology affordably, we'd not only be helping those individuals, but we'd also be generating fewer greenhouse gases, building another revenue stream for a business within the local economy -- a stream that would benefit other businesses and individuals alike!

Risks & Challenges

We have the CAD drawings, step-by-step plans, and some folks lined up with the necessary skills. They, though, have never built anything quite like this. They think they can do it, but we don't yet have a prototype. That's risk number one. The second risk is within the locking mechanism. Smart locks are fairly new on the market (and rather expensive). Plus, we'd like a way to keep these trailers out of the elements when not in use.  We're working out just how to make that happen, but it's all in the concept phase at this point.

Basically, we're pulling together innovative ideas from around the globe and bringing them together into one local solution. We think it will work -- and have "Plan B" ideas in place should our initial concept not pan out. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't spare any change, you can spur on this change!

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and spread the word!
