------

[Version française]

Aidez-nous à parrainer une famille de réfugiés syriens

Le Canada s’est engagé à accueillir 35 000 réfugiés syriens au Canada, et l’échéance est maintenant reportée à la fin de 2016. Nous voulons que Hania et ses enfants Adnan (25 ans), Nour (20 ans) et Nour Aldeen (10 ans) fassent partie de ce nombre. Nous les parrainons pour qu’ils viennent à Montréal et nous avons besoin de votre aide.

Pour parrainer une famille de réfugiés, nous devons leur fournir un soutien financier complet pendant leur première année au Canada et les aider à s’installer et à s’intégrer à la société québécoise. Le gouvernement du Québec suggère 55 000 $ comme montant nécessaire au soutien d'une famille. Ensemble, nous avons pu réunir 20 000 $. Nous devons donc recueillir 35 000 $ de plus, soit l’objectif de notre campagne Indiegogo.

Nous vous serions infiniment reconnaissants pour votre don, quel qu'en soit le montant. Nous pensons que les membres de cette famille deviendront de grands Canadiens! Voici leur histoire.

L’histoire de Hania et de sa famille

Avant le conflit, la famille Zlikha vivait dans un beau petit appartement à Qaboun, une banlieue de Damas. Hania travaillait comme ingénieure civile pour le service informatique de Syrian Arab Airlines et était chef de famille depuis le décès du père des enfants. Adnan a fini le lycée au troisième rang de tous les étudiants de Syrie. Nour était aussi une des premières de classe l’année où elle a obtenu son diplôme. Les enfants fréquentaient de bonnes écoles et étudiaient fort pour leur avenir.

Tout a changé en 2011. L’aîné, Adnan, étudiait en science informatique à l’Université de Damas, mais a dû cesser ses études lorsque la ville est devenue une zone de guerre. Alors que Nour était en train de faire l’examen final de ses études secondaires, des bombes étaient larguées sur les écoles.

Peu après le début de la guerre, la ville où vivait la famille est devenue très dangereuse. La famille a vu des tanks passer sur des personnes capturées. Ils ont vu des hommes et des femmes abattus et laissés au sol. Ils ont entendu les cris des mères qui avaient perdu leurs enfants et leurs maris. Les bombes tombaient et il y avait des tireurs partout autour de leur immeuble et même à l’intérieur.


Photo : Nik Millard (BBC)

Un jour, ils ont entendu dire que les gens étaient autorisés à quitter leur maison. Ils ont pris leurs documents, leurs ordinateurs, des sacs à dos avec quelques vêtements et des chaussures, et se sont enfuis. Depuis ce jour, ils écoutent les nouvelles chaque jour et entendent parler des combats dans leur ville d’origine. Les images à la télévision montrent qu’ils n’ont plus de maison où retourner.


Photo : Nik Millard (BBC)

La famille a d’abord fui à Damas, puis au Liban, où Hania travaille dans la cuisine d’un restaurant et fait la classe à son plus jeune fils. Nour a dû arrêter ses études et travaille dans un restaurant où elle gagne 300 $ par mois.

Ce sont des gens intelligents, bons et honnêtes, qui aiment tellement les chiffres qu’ils se lancent continuellement le défi d’un problème mathématique afin de voir qui va le résoudre en premier! Ils aiment les activités extérieures. Tous les membres de la famille font de la natation et ont fait beaucoup de randonnée dans les montagnes. Nour et Hania sont très bonnes cuisinières.

Qui sommes-nous

Je m’appelle Heba Zlikha et Hania est ma sœur aînée. Je suis arrivée au Canada avec mes deux enfants il y a 11 ans et je travaille maintenant dans le domaine de l’acupuncture. Mes enfants parlent le français, l’anglais et l’arabe, et nous sommes pleinement intégrés à la société canadienne. Nous adorons vivre ici! Je n’ai pas de famille au Canada et ce serait un rêve d’avoir Hania et ses enfants avec nous. Je reçois de l’aide de mes partenaires commanditaires, mon cher ami Elio, qui est comme ma famille canadienne, et ma nouvelle amie Anna qui est médecin de famille à Montréal.

J’ai lancé une collecte de fonds et, à nous trois, nous avons réussi à recueillir 20 000 $.

Nous avons besoin en tout de 55 000 $ et nous nous engageons à soutenir la famille et à l’aider à s’installer au Canada. Nous vous serions éternellement reconnaissants de toute aide que vous pouvez nous fournir et nous vous demandons de faire connaître notre campagne à vos amis. Voir les liens ci-dessus.

Autres renseignements

Les dons ne sont pas déductibles du revenu imposable; veuillez en tenir compte pour décider du montant que vous voulez donner.

Si vous préférez payer par chèque ou argent comptant, veuillez contacter l'un de nous et il nous fera plaisir de prendre les dispositions nécessaires avec vous.

Tout l’argent amassé grâce à cette campagne sera placé dans un compte en fiducie géré par notre avocate en droit de l'immigration, Miriam McLeod,  jusqu’à ce que la famille arrive et en ait besoin.

Si, par hasard, nous recevons plus d’argent que ce que nous demandons, toute somme supplémentaire servira à payer des études universitaires à Nour et Adnan.

------

[English Version]

Help Us Sponsor a Syrian Refugee Family

Canada has committed to bringing 35 000 Syrian refugees to Canada, now by the end of 2016. We want Hania and her children Adnan (25), Nour (20), and Nour Aldeen (10) to be among them. We are sponsoring them to come to Montreal and we need your help.

Sponsoring a refugee family means that we must completely financially support them for their first year in Canada as well, as help them settle and integrate into Quebec society. The Quebec government suggests $55 000 as the amount needed to support the family. Together, we are able to put in $20 000. Our goal is to raise the other $35 000 through this Indiegogo campaign.

We would be forever grateful for whatever amount you are able to donate. We think they will make great Canadians! Here is their story.

The Story of Hania and her Family

Before the conflict, the Zlikha family was living in a small, cute apartment in Qaboun, a suburb of Damascus. Hania was working as a civil engineer for Syrian Arab Airlines in their IT department and supporting her children, who had lost their father when they were really young. Adnan finished high school with the third highest marks in Syria. Nour was also in the top of her class the year she was graduating. The children were in good schools, studying hard to make a future.

All that changed in 2011. Adnan, the eldest, was studying computer engineering at Damascus University, but had to stop when it became a war zone. Nour did her high school final exam while bombs were falling on schools.

Shortly after the war started, the town where they lived became really dangerous. They saw tanks driving over live captured people. They saw men and women being shot and left on the ground. They heard the screaming of mothers who lost their kids and husbands. Bombs and snipers were everywhere on and around the building they lived in.

Photo : Nik Millard (BBC)

One day they heard that people were being allowed to leave their houses. They took only their documents, their computers, back bags with some clothes and shoes, and fled. They hear on the news every day since then about the battles happening there. Pictures from the television show there is nothing to go home to.

Photo : Nik Millard (BBC)

The family fled first to Damascus and then to Lebanon, where Hania is working in a restaurant kitchen and home schooling her youngest son. Nour has had to stop going to school altogether and works in a restaurant making $300 a month.

They are intelligent, good and honest people, with such a love of numbers they always have a math problem as a challenge between them to see who will solve it first ! They love activities outside. They all swim and did lots of hiking in the mountains. Nour and Hania are really good cooks.

Who we are

My name is Heba Zlikha and Hania is my older sister. I came to Canada with my two children 11 years ago and now work in the field of accupuncture. My children speak French, English and Arabic and we are fully integrated into Canadian life. We love it here! I have no family in Canada and it would be a dream to have Hania and her children with us. Helping me as co­sponsors are my dear friend Elio, who is like my Canadian family and my new friend Anna, who is a Montreal family doctor.

I have been fundraising on my own and between the three of us we are able to put in $20 000.

We need a total of $55 000 and are committed to supporting the family and getting them settled well in Canada. We would be forever grateful for whatever help you can manage and we ask you to please share our campaign with your friends. See the links at the top.

Other Info

Donations are not tax­ deductible so please take this into account when deciding how much you would like to give.

If you prefer to pay by cheque or cash, please contact one of us, and we will gladly organize that with you.

All money raised with this campaign will be placed in the trust account of our immigration lawyer, Miriam McLeod, until such time as the family arrives and it is needed by them.

In the amazing situation that we receive more money than we are asking for, any extra money will be used to pay for university expenses for Nour and Adnan.

Bombs and snipers were everywhere on and around the building they lived in.Photo : Nik Millard (BBC)One day they heard that people were being allowed to leave their houses. They took only their documents, their computers, back bags with some clothes and shoes, and fled. They hear on the news every day since then about the battles happening there. Pictures from the television show there is nothing to go home to.Photo : Nik Millard (BBC)The family fled first to Damascus and then to Lebanon, where Hania is working in a restaurant kitchen and home schooling her youngest son. Nour has had to stop going to school altogether and works in a restaurant making $300 a month.
They are intelligent, good and honest people, with such a love of numbers they always have a math problem as a challenge between them to see who will solve it first ! They love activities outside. They all swim and did lots of hiking in the mountains. Nour and Hania are really good cooks.
Who we are
My name is Heba Zlikha and Hania is my older sister. I came to Canada with my two children 11 years ago and now work in the field of accupuncture. My children speak French, English and Arabic and we are fully integrated into Canadian life. We love it here! I have no family in Canada and it would be a dream to have Hania and her children with us. Helping me as co­sponsors are my dear friend Elio, who is like my Canadian family and my new friend Anna, who is a Montreal family doctor.
I have been fundraising on my own and between the three of us we are able to put in $20 000.
We need a total of $55 000 and are committed to supporting the family and getting them settled well in Canada. We would be forever grateful for whatever help you can manage and we ask you to please share our campaign with your friends. See the links at the top.
Other Info
Donations are not tax­ deductible so please take this into account when deciding how much you would like to give.If you prefer to pay by cheque or cash, please contact one of us, and we will gladly organize that with you.
All money raised with this campaign will be placed in the trust account of our immigration lawyer, Miriam McLeod, until such time as the family arrives and it is needed by them.
In the amazing situation that we receive more money than we are asking for, any extra money will be used to pay for university expenses for Nour and Adnan.

story:
Dear Family and Friends!

We (Chanie Hoelsken and Christopher Campbell, longtime friends and colleagues) are excited to tell you about a wonderful project we initiated in response to the tragic fires that recently happened in our beloved Lake County, California.  Recognizing the profound trauma incurred by thousands of people in the area, we wanted to create the possibility for long-term healing and well-being - not just a one-time "quick fix."  So we launched Valley Fire Healing Services (aka Project Phoenix/Lake County).  We have already established a team of skilled practitioners, held our first Community Healing Circle and Free Clinic in Lake County, and there's more to come.  Please read on to find out what we've been up to, and how you might help us continue this good work.


BEAUTIFUL RESULTS ALREADY

In the last month, we have heard countless tragic stories of lost homes, pets, jobs, devastated lands.  We have witnessed the strain in the faces, hearts, and minds of our friends and community members, of local parents, home and business owners. So many people have experienced loss beyond our imagination.  Even those who did not lose their homes are surrounded by destruction and grief - which all contributes to a deep shock to the system.  Our hearts go out to them - and we wish we had a way to help.

WE DO.

This past month, we were able to serve 350 people (and also some rescue animals!)  -  through events, circles, and clinics in Lake and Napa counties, and in the San Francisco Bay Area.  

Our first Community Healing Circle in Lake County drew a packed room of participants from all sectors of the surrounding community, some of whom had never attended an event like this before!  It was amazing to see the glow on their faces and the relief in their hearts, after having spent just a couple of hours with fellow community members in a healing environment.  Within a day or two, people were asking: "When is the next healing circle?"  Then, last Sunday, we led our first of 12 monthly Free Healing Clinics. We had 9 practitioners and were able to offer 51 - yes FIFTY ONE - free treatments to grateful locals - (some of whom have never even had a massage in their life!)

And the work continues.  We (Chanie and Christopher) are working collaboratively together - and with our team of skilled healers and teachers - to create several Self-Care Seminars and Resiliency Training Programs that we will lead throughout the next year empowering people to carry these healing practices into their homes and families as everyone faces the struggles that undoubtedly lie ahead.


FROM TRAGEDY, HELP US CREATE OPPORTUNITY

Lake County is the second poorest county in California.  Many of these people have lived in impoverished circumstances and would have never otherwise been able to receive the services we are providing - high quality healing treatments, psychotherapy, grief counseling and resiliency coaching.  And, yet, now we are now able to offer them healing and support to heal their pains and grief, discover their own inner strength and creativity, and be part of a community that they never had access to before. What we are capable of doing this next year is immense - and you could be a part of making it happen! 

We are reaching out to ask for your help as we move forward and continue to offer these wonderful services to the community.  By contributing generously to our initiative, you are not just providing for the basic needs of these people on a one-time basis, you are providing them with the ongoing resources of support they will undoubtedly need to navigate the difficulties of this next year - helping them through the challenges of creating a new and better life for themselves.  

Please contribute as generously as you can.  Your contribution will go a long way in supporting us to support these wonderfully deserving folks.

If you cannot offer a financial contribution at this time, perhaps you would be willing to share or promote our campaign on Facebook – or, even better yet, to reach out personally to specific individuals you know who would be in a position to contribute.  Thank you for all your love and support! 


We send our love and gratitude out to you,

Christopher and Chanie


VALLEY FIRE HEALING SERVICES PLANS FOR 2015

Here are the projects that your heart-felt contributions will fund: 

·  Monthly community healing circle

·  Monthly free/donation-based clinic

·  Develop self-care curriculum for fire victims

·  Develop self-care and resiliency training toolkit for healthcare professionals

·  Train Advanced Practitioners to lead community healing circles   

·  Train a team of beginning and intermediate practitioners for assistance in clinics and circles

·       Create and provide Self-Care/Resiliency toolkit training for local Lake County residents – both adults and youth – including mindfulness, communication, and healing practices


ABOUT US:

CHANDRA HOELSKEN, LMFT is a Holistic Healer with a Master of Arts in Psychology and a Master of Science in Criminology. In addition, she is a Certified Addictions Treatment Counselor, certified yoga instructor, make-up artist, Reiki Master, and nutritionist. Chandra has worked in non-profits for 15 years serving homeless, at-risk, and criminal populations. As a social researcher, she is dedicated to using science to help individuals access all resources available to them both socially and psychologically, and has developed training programs at local, regional, and national levels in the fields of relationships, social justice, and addictions.  Chandra believes that health and wellbeing are obtained through a holistic approach. Her passion is working with people to overcome obstacles to being fully actualized and supporting people in their spiritual journey. She listens to each client’s story and what they would like to accomplish then with love and presence helps them to achieve their dreams and destinies. Chandra co-creates an atmosphere in which clients can become aware of their pain bodies and move into them with acceptance, compassion, and presence. Chandra has a deep love and appreciation for life and all that it has to offer us.


CHRISTOPHER CAMPBELL is the Founding Director of Awakening Heart School, and has taught Reiki and mindfulness professionally for 13 years.  Through the school and not-for-profit initiatives like Valley Fire Healing Services, he has provided community circles, clinics, courses, and certification trainings in universities, retreat centers, regional and global conferences, community centers, and alternative healthcare clinics worldwide.  His goal is to inspire and empower people with the capacity to skillfully love and care for themselves and each other in everyday life – and to embody profound resiliency and grace in the midst of challenging times.  To this end, he dedicates his time to training and networking professional service-care providers, and developing programs that support the creation of vibrant, resilient, co-creative youth, adults, families and communities.

story:
Our final -- and super hilarious! -- video by Dodd's Eye Media is below. Over two and a half years have gone into perfecting the recipes that make Unity Jun so yummy & delicious! Have a behind the scenes look at the endless discussion that leads to the perfect flavour you taste each time you have a sip of Unity Jun.


UPDATE: Wondering what's up with the Unity Jun Gun?! Check out the video below from our Jun Gun Fun! day at Ingredients:


Unity Jun is a living elixir full of antioxidants, b-vitamins and probiotics. It’s kombucha’s wild cousin that eats raw honey instead of refined sugar. We craft our delicious Jun with raw local honey, organic teas & herbs, really awesome water, and the Jun SCOBY—a powerful, symbiotic culture of beneficial probiotics.

We're launching this campaign to help spread the culture far and wide! 


In order to truly bring Unity Jun to YOU, we need to bring it to all of the stores, markets and establishments across Coastal BC that you love! We’re ready and willing to increase production and start filling our cute new bottles with fresh, sparkly Jun.

To reach this next level we need YOUR help to acquire new equipment, thousands of bottles and barrels of honey! For more detail on the specific phases of growth your contributions will benefit, scroll down (“Where your contributions are going”).

As a local, grassroots organization, we are committed to funding Unity Jun collectively, from the ground up, rather than appealing to investors who seek to make a profit by sharing ownership. This approach empowers our greater vision of giving back to our collective communities, and allows for an organic growth model.

ABOUT JUN

Unity Jun is a delicious, fizzy drink that consistently inspires smiles of delight! It’s kombucha’s wild cousin that eats raw honey instead of refined sugar. Making Jun requires help from the lovable Jun SCOBY (Symbiotic Culture of Bacteria & Yeast), which looks like a crazy, floating jellyfish mushroom! The Jun culture is rumoured to have come from Tibet, where it was used to bring greater health & vitality to meditating monks.

To craft this living elixir, we start by steeping the finest organic teas in our really awesome water. Then, we add raw, local honey and the magical Jun SCOBY. The goodness of the plants & bees is then transmogrified by the SCOBY into an effervescent tonic full of antioxidants, b-vitamins, digestive enzymes and probiotics. Next, this liquid goodness is infused with flavourful organic herbs & spices before being poured into (possibly) the cutest bottles ever made.


RELATIONSHIPS and the NEW ECONOMY

Crafting Jun wouldn’t be possible without cultivating symbiotic relationships throughout our communities. We source all of our ingredients from producers & suppliers who seek to grow a sustainable local economy. Together, we practice conscious engagement with the earth and new ways of being. Presently, we are in relationship with:

  • Ingredients Cafe & Health Food Store: Our home base, and the first location to have Unity Jun available for public sale. Cindy and the Ingredients team are committed to building & supporting a vibrant local food hub in Victoria, BC. They have been instrumental in providing the space, support, and loving encouragement we need to get Unity Jun up and running.

  • Fredrich’s Honey: 2nd generation beekeepers, consciously gathering wild honey across Vancouver Island, and delivering us pails of their raw, nectary goodness.

  • JagaSilk: purveyors of the finest direct-trade teas. Jared regularly visits farms across the ocean and cultivates personal relationships with the tea farmers.

  • Studio Robazzo: a new, sustainability-focused design studio in Victoria BC; Studio Robazzo is committed to transforming our relationship with all manner of things—away from the disposable consumer economy and toward one that considers the full life cycle of what we produce and use. They have done fantastic work designing our logo, signage, labels and other materials.

  • Over Grow the System, Dodd’s Eye Media, and Anchor Hill: Syd, Andrew & Rich are collectively responsible for our wonderful campaign video & media support. They are all amazing creative geniuses who we feel blessed to work with.

  • Organic Matters: organic wholesalers, based in Nelson, BC, Organic Matters aims to supply the BC community with the most locally- and ethically-sourced organic ingredients they can find, reducing waste & forging healthy relationships in the process. They supply many of our organic herbs & spices.

  • Ancient Futures Clothing: Working out of the Cowichan Valley on Vancouver Island, Ali hand dyes and sews beautifully-cozy and unique articles of clothing using awesome and sustainable materials—like the organic merino wool we use as cloth covers for our SCOBY and Jun barrels!

  • Sunset Labs, Moon Collective, Returning Saturn, Luminosity Project, and other organizers of community events across Coastal BC. Our local arts community is large, healthy and tight-knit—full of great people doing what they love and putting community ahead of profits. Unity Jun will be forever grateful to this community for their endless warmth and support. 


We invite you to explore a reality in which the products we consume (and share) contribute to earth’s vibrant web of life. The mainstream economy is one of finite transactions & debts, and its time for rebirth has come! Imagine instead a network of communities sharing gifts of conscious intention. Help us co-create such a culture: one based on trust, reciprocity, and loving kindness. We envision a future in which we abandon the fear of scarcity and embrace the inevitability of abundance.


CULTURING HEALTHY COMMUNITIES

Unity Jun is committed to enriching our society by Culturing Healthy Communities. This process unfolds on multiple levels: making our beverage involves the nurturing of a living community of organisms, enjoying Jun cultures the body with communities of probiotics, and supporting a network of local creators will help to Culture Healthy Communities throughout Vancouver Island and beyond. We are dedicated to sharing part of Unity Jun’s profits with projects that inspire Life in our local and global commUnities.

By enjoying this elixir and supporting a small, local ‘cooporation’, you are planting a seed: one that will grow in your body and blossom throughout the interwoven layers of community our collective seeks to culture. Together, we are capable of creating powerful cultural shifts, and we invite you to help transform our collective reality.

Oh, and did we mention that Unity Jun will become an open-source business model for people in other regions to begin local Jun production and give back to their communities?

Imagine! You’ll be able to get Jun in every town, just like any widely available beverage... but unlike the case with most commercial drinks, there will be no mass-production, no long-distance transportation, and no concentration of profits in the hands of the few. Instead, Unity Jun will blossom into an opportunity for localized production and the creation of sustainable livelihoods for many.


WHERE YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS ARE GOING

We’d like to be as transparent as possible about how your contributions will physically manifest in the Unity Jun brewing lab. As a small, growing business, we’ve identified 3 stages of growth & investment that are necessary for us to reach our potential for making Unity Jun available throughout Coastal BC. Campaign contributions will be directed toward the following 3 phases, in order, without exception.

  1. Bottles on shelves! We have wonderful new bottles with super cute labels. In order to have bottles of Unity Jun on store shelves at a fair price, we need to order both packaging & ingredients in bulk. This means purchasing multiple pallets of bottles, thousands of labels, barrels of raw honey, and kilos of organic tea and herbs.

  2. Next-level: Brewing in 20L barrels and bottling by hand has been a great start, but in order to be effective as a supplier of Jun, we’re going to need at least six 300-litre fermentation vessels, a drum of local honey (that’s about 300 kilos!), and a bottling machine to reduce spillage and ensure quality & consistency.

  3. Epic Water System: Our last stage of growth is one we are very excited about! Purchasing filtered water by the jug and boiling water for tea by the pot wastes energy across the board. We are going to install a high-volume, reverse-osmosis, charcoal-filtered water system with a direct hot water source. This will ensure that we have the best possible water, of consistently epic quality, on tap for crafting all of our Jun.


WATER

Awesome water is really important to us (which is good, because it happens to be the source of all life on this planet)! Water has been shown to hold energy & intention, so we’ve put this principle to good use in crafting Unity Jun. Our H2O begins its journey with reverse osmosis filtration to remove any impurities. Then, we add a liquid crystal matrix—solé—to infuse structure, minerals & sacred intention.

Our special solé is a culture unto itself, holding our highest ideals of Unity, Peace & Freedom within its molecular structure. We have gathered a collection of sacred waters from around the globe and added living crystal salt to create an ionically-charged saturated saline solution. This magically-mineralized water is home to a large lemurian quartz record-keeper crystal, which has been charged with blessings, songs, and mantras from spiritual traditions across the world. Every drop of Unity Jun is infused with this living ceremonial intention which celebrates the beautiful diversity of our Oneness.


WHO WE ARE

Cierra is a perpetual student and alternative educator who loves to travel, read and practice healing arts. Having spent most of her twenties in China, she has now returned to her hometown of Victoria to co-create vibrant community . After many years spent nourishing and nurturing generations of SCOBYs, Cierra is now the ecstatically joyful mother of baby Lucia!

Dave (dubbed the Universal Switchboard Operator), excels at sensing and activating powerful connections that live unseen. An engineer by training, a chef by passion, and a poet at heart, Dave is only satisfied when all elements and beings feel connected and loved.

Born and raised in Los Angeles, California, Sean T Fox is a global explorer who chose to build home on Vancouver Island. Educated in psychology, herbalism, yoga and the holistic healing arts, this Alchemical Activator is a visionary dreamer with sights set on the larger focus of global Oneness.


HOW WE STARTED

Spring 2013. Victoria, BC. Cierra Dahlquist is relaxing in her backyard when new housemate Sean T knocks on the gate. Fresh from California, Sean has with him a Jun SCOBY—possibly the first on Vancouver Island—and a dream. Cierra is a veteran kombucha maker and has just left her job as a schoolteacher. She’s ready for a new project. Although this is their first in-person meeting, within minutes they are sharing a warm hug and a vision for the future...


Fall 2015. Jun has become a favourite within the local community, and barely a week goes by that we aren’t serving Jun at an event. A sunrise chat on a garry oak bald after one of those same events in 2014 has now finally led Dave Basu Roy, the epicurean mastermind of Simmer Foods, to come on board as our third co-founder. Production has moved out of our living rooms and into a commercial kitchen. Cierra has a baby, Lucia, who has been enjoying Jun since conception. The business is now registered and licensed, and we have begun selling Jun to the public. Unity Jun Magical Potion Co. is born!

In order to have bottles of Unity Jun on store shelves at a fair price, we need to order both packaging & ingredients in bulk. This means purchasing multiple pallets of bottles, thousands of labels, barrels of raw honey, and kilos of organic tea and herbs. 
Next-level: Brewing in 20L barrels and bottling by hand has been a great start, but in order to be effective as a supplier of Jun, we’re going to need at least six 300-litre fermentation vessels, a drum of local honey (that’s about 300 kilos!), and a bottling machine to reduce spillage and ensure quality & consistency.
Epic Water System: Our last stage of growth is one we are very excited about! Purchasing filtered water by the jug and boiling water for tea by the pot wastes energy across the board. We are going to install a high-volume, reverse-osmosis, charcoal-filtered water system with a direct hot water source. This will ensure that we have the best possible water, of consistently epic quality, on tap for crafting all of our Jun.
WATERAwesome water is really important to us (which is good, because it happens to be the source of all life on this planet)! Water has been shown to hold energy & intention, so we’ve put this principle to good use in crafting Unity Jun. Our H2O begins its journey with reverse osmosis filtration to remove any impurities. Then, we add a liquid crystal matrix—solé—to infuse structure, minerals & sacred intention.Our special solé is a culture unto itself, holding our highest ideals of Unity, Peace & Freedom within its molecular structure. We have gathered a collection of sacred waters from around the globe and added living crystal salt to create an ionically-charged saturated saline solution. This magically-mineralized water is home to a large lemurian quartz record-keeper crystal, which has been charged with blessings, songs, and mantras from spiritual traditions across the world. Every drop of Unity Jun is infused with this living ceremonial intention which celebrates the beautiful diversity of our Oneness.WHO WE ARECierra is a perpetual student and alternative educator who loves to travel, read and practice healing arts. Having spent most of her twenties in China, she has now returned to her hometown of Victoria to co-create vibrant community . After many years spent nourishing and nurturing generations of SCOBYs, Cierra is now the ecstatically joyful mother of baby Lucia!Dave (dubbed the Universal Switchboard Operator), excels at sensing and activating powerful connections that live unseen. An engineer by training, a chef by passion, and a poet at heart, Dave is only satisfied when all elements and beings feel connected and loved.Born and raised in Los Angeles, California, Sean T Fox is a global explorer who chose to build home on Vancouver Island. Educated in psychology, herbalism, yoga and the holistic healing arts, this Alchemical Activator is a visionary dreamer with sights set on the larger focus of global Oneness.HOW WE STARTEDSpring 2013. Victoria, BC. Cierra Dahlquist is relaxing in her backyard when new housemate Sean T knocks on the gate. Fresh from California, Sean has with him a Jun SCOBY—possibly the first on Vancouver Island—and a dream. Cierra is a veteran kombucha maker and has just left her job as a schoolteacher. She’s ready for a new project. Although this is their first in-person meeting, within minutes they are sharing a warm hug and a vision for the future...Fall 2015. Jun has become a favourite within the local community, and barely a week goes by that we aren’t serving Jun at an event. A sunrise chat on a garry oak bald after one of those same events in 2014 has now finally led Dave Basu Roy, the epicurean mastermind of Simmer Foods, to come on board as our third co-founder. Production has moved out of our living rooms and into a commercial kitchen. Cierra has a baby, Lucia, who has been enjoying Jun since conception. The business is now registered and licensed, and we have begun selling Jun to the public. Unity Jun Magical Potion Co. is born!

story:
$56,000 Will Provide Startup Revenue
for Bread & Roses Thrift and More. 

Please Donate Now!

In 9 months, federal grants to rural homeless shelters will plummet. Very possibly for Hospitality House they'll disappear altogether. At Hospitality House, we believe that every human being deserves three daily meals, safe shelter at night, access to medical care, and ultimately a home of their own. This campaign is to help us keep turning that belief into powerful action in our community. We cannot and must not leave our homeless neighbors stranded without these services!

Our Vision

The vision of Hospitality House is to empower homeless people with tools to overcome the barriers that prevent them from securing homes.

Our Plan

Bread & Roses Thrift and More will help fulfill this vision by:

  • Contributing substantial support to the shelter and its housing program
  • Training shelter guests in a variety of job skills
  • Providing an outlet for the Hospitality House Culinary Job-Training Class's baked goods
  • Offering a venue where shelter guests can interact in a meaningful, dignified setting with other community members
  • Raising awareness of the problems of homelessness and poverty
  • Offering space for artistic expression, including music (of course!), and educational forums relating to social justice
  • Providing clothing vouchers for homeless county resident

Our Successes

286 People In Permanent Homes of Their Own!

Since 2013 Hospitality House has been phenomenally successful in getting homeless Nevada County residents back on their feet. In the past 2 years alone, Hospitality House has assisted 286 people into permanent homes of their own and provided 2 years of follow-up support to make sure they succeed (we have a 95% rental retention rate). We're proud of their success and of the job we're doing to get homeless people in Nevada County off the streets.
Our year-round shelter also provides:
  • Access to social services
  • Life skills and life enrichment classes
  • Job counseling and job-readiness classes
  • Housing-readiness classes
  • Culinary skills job-training classes
  • On-site mental health counseling
  • On-site AA/NA meetings

Where Will Your Money Go?

The money will go to startup costs for Bread & Roses Thrift and More, including leasing a building; refurbishing the building; purchasing equipment, a vehicle (for picking up furniture), advertising, and insurance; paying initial wages to one full-
time and one part-time manager with thrift store, management, and job-training expertise.

If you care about helping the homeless people in our community get back on their
feet, please contribute to our Bread & Roses Thrift and More campaign to support the vital services at Hospitality House.

LET US SHOW YOU OUR GRATITUDE!
For Helping to Open Bread & Roses Thrift and More, Here Are The Great Perks We've Put Together To Thank You!


The name Bread & Roses comes from a song by that name that Utah Phillips sang. Its lyrics express the universal human desire for a life that satisfies both physical needs and more soulful needs for learning and beauty 
— "a sharing of life's glories." 


Bread & Roses Thrift and More Team

The volunteers who are creating Bread and Roses are all talented artists and thrift store aficionados who will transform our space into a visual experience that will itself be a work of art.

Catherine Allen: painter, poet, writer & radio broadcaster
Sandy Brown: administrator & artist
Laura Jane Coats: graphic & interior designer, marionette theater producer, children's book author & illustrator
Judi Funk: homeless advocate & the queen of thrift stores
Sandy Gold: artist specializing in calligraphy and stained glass

Indiegogo Team

Joanna Robinson: writer & editor | Nina Snegg: writer & editor
Kathy Dotson: graphic design | Catherine Busch: videographer & writer
Tom Durkin: photographer | Mark Triolo: videographer 
Dee Dinelli: photographer | Cheree Boteler: social media consultant

Please listen to these words from the late Utah Phillips and heed the call.

story:
What are we doing? 

Our goal is to create the first ever Haystack Food Truck. It’s purpose is to be used to in public settings (food truck gatherings, events, schools, churches, camp meetings, etc) to promote the SDA food staple, the haystack. Our haystack is a taco salad with a twist: you can stack it or wrap it. Whichever you choose, a meal will be donated to someone in need. 

Why are we doing this?

Food trucks are growing in popularity all across America and thrive on their uniqueness. We are leveraging this "uniqueness" to reach out to the community. We can also use this opportunity to feed those that are hungry and less fortunate. We're taking our passion for haystacks and using it to change the world. 

Funding

If we reach $5000:

(*Phase 1 mock up)

TentTables
Food Containers
Food Prep Items

If we reach $20,000:

(*Phase 2 mock up)

Cart / Design
Kitchenware

If we reach $60,000:

(*Phase 3 mock up)

Foodtruck / Design
Kitchenware
Marketing/Materials
Permit/Insurance/Licensing

Estimated Timeline:

Dec 2015 – Secure Budget
Jan-Mar 2016 – Outfit & Design Cart/Secure Licensing & Permits
Apr 2016 – Test/Community Outreach 
May - Aug 2016 - Haystack Tour


Media: 

Haystack Food Truck Podcast

http://www.thehaystack.tv/why-gchaystack-was-a-success/

http://www.adventistreview.org/1527-36 

http://www.adventistreview.org/haystack-lovers-fall-short-of-clinching-world-record-for-largest-potluck

http://www.nadadventist.org/article/1073742992/news/archived-news-stories/2015-news-archives/7-9-15-haystacktv-attempts-to-break-world-record

Follow the movement:
facebook.com/thehaystack.tv
instagram.com/thehaystacktv

story:
Short Summary

We are a two people, an MBA and a PhD, one-family business called UNITRA (http://unitra.x10host.com). We write business texts, edit and translate business, academic and personal texts. We also coach and guide students of all levels during their thesis/dissertation work.  Between the two of us we have 7 academic degrees from Bachelor to MBA/MSc to PhD in Economics, Business Administration, Finance, Physics, Atmospheric Sciences, Statistics and Hydrology. Between the two of us we write, speak and work in English, French, Spanish, Russian, Dutch, and German. Between the two of us we have over 3 decades of academic and business experience in the leading Universities and multinationals. We have lived, studied and worked in Canada, Mexico, The Netherlands, Russia, also in close ties with USA and South Korea. Our business was launched in 2012. We are based in Toronto, Canada and we work with clients in Canada and all over the world. 

To-date we have successfully helped over 100 students, professionals, companies, entrepreneurs, individuals all over Canada reach their business, academic and personal goals. To further spread the word about our business we need extra money to advertise in Toronto. With your help we will be able to reach out to many more clients in the city who need our services but have not yet found us. With your help our flyers will reach 1,000 business and home addresses in the Greater Toronto Area. With this outreach we hope to increase awareness of our services and how we can help people and businesses reach their goals through a better written expression in English and other languages.

We write, edit and translate any type of academic, business, technical, and personal texts. See examples of what we do below.

We edit, proofread, translate as well as paraphrase, condense, summarize, reference, format any academic material:

Letters of motivation • Admission essays • Letters of recommendation • Research proposals • Thesis/dissertation • Academic articles • Comparison essay • Critical essay • Research essay • Research journal • Research paper • Your request

We also coach, tutor and guide students to research and write the above documents.

We write, edit, paraphrase, condense, summarize, reference, format, and translate any business texts:

Website content • Social media content • Blogging • Product / service description • Manuals • Spec sheets • Press releases • Promo materials • Business plans • Your request

We write, edit, paraphrase, condense, summarize, reference, format, and translate any technical texts:

Technical description of a piece of machinery • A technical manual • A spec sheet • A business proposal with a technical part to it

We write, edit, paraphrase, condense, summarize, reference, format, and translate any personal texts:

An explanatory letter for a visa application • A sponsorship proposal for financing an event • A personal statement for different applications • A petition for different applications

What We Need & What You Get

What we need:

For our flyers to reach out to 1,000 business and home addresses, we need 599.69 CAD which includes  531.59 CAD printing & mailing fee plus 68.10 CAD in taxes. Indiegogo will take 5% and PayPal will take another 3% of this amount, thus our "ask" is 651.84 CAD or roughly 652 CAD.

What you get:

For every contribution we offer you a service equal to the amount you contribute. For example, for 20 CAD we can proofread your 1,000-word text or translate 200 words for you from or to English, French, Spanish, Dutch, German, Russian. For 50 CAD we can write a 500-word text for you or offer you 1 hour consultation for your academic work, thesis or dissertation. For 100 CAD we can write a 1,000-word text for you, translate a 1,000-word text, or offer you a 2 hour consultation for your academic work or your business content writing. In other words we can translate your text at 10 cents/word, edit it at 5 CAD/page of 250 words, write a text for you at 25 CAD/page of 250 words. Just state your goal and we will work with you towards achieving it!

The Impact

If you are writing a content for your business' website, if you are experiencing difficulties writing your thesis/dissertation, if you are writing a book, if you are a professional in need of a written statement for a discipline outside of your area of specialization, if you are looking for someone to look over your write-up, this is where we bring value. If you are in need of a translation service (from/to English, French, Spanish, Russian, Dutch, German) for your business or your personal needs (please note we do not translate driver's license, birth/marriage certificates, diplomas, transcripts), this is where we bring value. If you need the work done fast, hassle-free, high-quality, affordable, and confidential, this is where we bring value. If you need writing, editing, translation services - all in one - this is where we bring value.

To-date, we have worked with over 100 clients, have written and edited close to 1 million words, have translated over 100,000 words and counting. Here are our clients' testimonials:

“I must say that you have been the most professional and honest company that I have spoken with to date.”

“You probably get this a lot but I love you thanks.”

“I am so far loving your service. I will definitely tell my colleagues about you. I am glad I contacted you. Great work!!”

“Thank you so much for your help. I'm so happy with the end result!”

“Thank you so much for your help. I really appreciate it.”

“Looks great Thank you so very much”

“Thank you for all your help. (You are a life saver even in last minute :).”

“Thank you very much”

“I really appreciate your time and your friendliness. I will definitely contact you in the future. Thank you for taking the time and explaining me things you definitely have a future customer.”

“I am sure it will not come as a surprise. Again. Excellent quality work provided by Unitra. Professionals to trust!”

“It looks good and faster than I expected! Thank you so much.”

“Thanks vary much everything looks good.  You guys were great.”

“I'm so happy for the editing. Thank you very much!”

“Thank you. It looks great.”

“This looks great, thank you again for all your help!”

“Thanks alot for your hard work, it looks great”

Check our website to learn more: http://unitra.x10host.com

Risks & Challenges

We are a low-risk and solid-foundation venture. Our business is 100% brain-based, we are using our experience, knowledge and skills polished during over three decades of hard intellectual work. We are now putting this huge mental potential towards solving your issues/problems and helping you achieve your goals in academia, in business and personally. Getting your message across, be understood, call for action and receive the desired result is what our clients value us for.

Our major challenge today is to get the word out about us. With this campaign and other online and offline effort we are making to promote UNITRA, we are trying to get out there and demonstrate how much significant and real value we can and are creating for our clients. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot contribute, we will be happy if you could spread the word about us and our campaign. Visit our website at http://unitra.x10host.com and invite your friends to do the same. Let us write, edit or translate a text for you. No project is too small or too big for us. We can work with you in person or remotely. 

Let UNITRA assist you with your written expression!

UNITRA Founders, Writers, Editors, Translators / Interpreters

Lana Guzman, MBA: Lana holds MBA from HEC Montreal in Montreal, QC. She also holds Bachelor of Business Administration from The Hague University in The Hague, The Netherlands and Bachelor of Finance and Bachelor of Economics from Russian Plekhanov Academy of Economics in Moscow, Russia. She worked for such global brands as Philips Electronics in Amsterdam, The Netherlands and Samsung Electronics in Moscow Russia and in close cooperation with the global HQ in Seoul, South Korea. There Lana was responsible for competitor, consumer and market intelligence, advertising analytics proving to be an innovator and a trend-setter in developing and implementing new data analytics and intelligence techniques. She also worked for a high-tech start-up in Calgary, AB achieving groundbreaking business development results. At UNITRA, Lana specializes in analytical writing, editing and translating. She works in English, Spanish, Russian, Dutch, and German.


Dr. Edgar Guzman: Dr. Guzman holds PhD in Statistical Hydrology from INRS-ETE in Quebec City, QC. He also holds MSc in Meteorology from UQAM in Montreal, QC and BSc in Physics of Solid State from UNAM in Mexico City, Mexico. He has worked in University of Saskatchewan, has been a visiting scientist in Environment Canada as well as worked on projects in NCAR in the United States. Through his research and writing, Dr. Guzman achieved outstanding scientific research results and made a number of discoveries that were implemented by a provincial government and on a nation-wide scale in his area of expertise. He is the primary author of 13 scientific publications and a reviewer in six peer-reviewed scientific journals.

At UNITRA, Dr. Guzman specializes in statistical analysis and writing, and translates scientific and other types of documents. He works in English, French and Spanish.

developing and implementing new data analytics and intelligence 
techniques. She also worked for a high-tech start-up in Calgary, AB 
achieving groundbreaking business development results. 
				At UNITRA, Lana specializes in analytical writing, editing and 
translating. She works in English, Spanish, Russian, Dutch, and German.

Dr. Edgar Guzman:
				Dr. Guzman holds PhD in Statistical Hydrology from INRS-ETE in 
Quebec City, QC. He also holds MSc in Meteorology from UQAM in Montreal,
 QC and BSc in Physics of Solid State from UNAM in Mexico City, Mexico. 
He has worked in University of Saskatchewan, has been a visiting 
scientist in Environment Canada as well as worked on projects in NCAR in
 the United States. Through his research and writing, Dr. Guzman 
achieved outstanding scientific research results and made a number of 
discoveries that were implemented by a provincial government and on a 
nation-wide scale in his area of expertise. He is the primary author of 
13 scientific publications and a reviewer in six peer-reviewed 
scientific journals.
				At UNITRA, Dr. Guzman specializes in statistical analysis and 
writing, and translates scientific and other types of documents. He 
works in English, French and Spanish.

story:
Empowerment Solar Will Energize the Middle East.

Our solar projects will foster energy independence and economic prosperity for individuals and business owners across the Middle East and North Africa, by supplying affordable and easy access to reliable, clean, distributed solar electricity.

I witnessed first-hand the links between energy, prosperity, stability and peace as a U.S. Marine Corps officer, while patrolling the streets of Ramadi, Iraq in 2004. When insurgents cut Ramadi’s power lines, instability and violence proliferated around black markets for generators, their fuel, and water (since the water pumps were run by electricity). Staring at Iraq’s powerful sun, it became clear to me that distributed solar electricity could play an extraordinary role in building a brighter future for the entire region. 

Empowerment Solar is our vision to help the people of the Middle East solve these types of challenges themselves. By designing and installing distributed solar photovoltaic (PV) electricity systems, for small-and-mid-sized Palestinian businesses in the West Bank, we put electric and economic power back into the hands of everyday Palestinians, creating jobs and promoting a more prosperous and stable future. Our dream is to then extend this model of energy empowerment across the Middle East.

Become a part of Empowerment Solar and receive great perks.

With support from contributors like you, we will be able to bring Empowerment Solar to life. 

We need to raise $50,000 to open our doors, train our staff, and develop our first solar project.

There are a number of perks available for your contribution, from your name on the Empowerment Solar website, to your personal sponsorship of your own solar panel, to a tour of the project site once it's complete. 

Every little bit helps!  This is just the start of Empowerment Solar and any amount now helps us put the pieces in place to build sustainable energy solutions for communities throughout the Middle East and North Africa.

Beginning with the Palestinian West Bank

In 2014, Israel provided 99% of the West Bank’s electricity, draining $400-700M from the Palestinian economy. Today, Palestinian firms pay 10.3% more than Israelis and 64.3% more than Americans for electricity despite the fact that Israel’s per capita GDP is 7.3 times that of the Palestinians’ and the U.S.’s is 12.1 times greater.  Palestinians also face an unreliable grid, plagued by brownouts and shortages. Grid reliability and costs will only worsen, as the U.N. predicts that “by 2020 there could be an electricity capacity shortage of ~1000MWp”.  Empowerment Solar will help bring not just electrical, but economic power to Palestinian communities. 

Risks & Challenges

Empowerment Solar is a significant undertaking, in one of the most volatile areas in the world.  This is not an effort we are taking on lightly, so we have diligently worked to reduce risks in our business model, and are building a solid team of capable Americans and Palestinians. 

Please spread the word

In addition to your contribution, you can help us by telling your friends, family and colleagues about Empowerment Solar's campaign.  And be sure to follow us on Facebook and Twitter. Finally, please share and retweet our posts.

story:
Short Summary

We are  pleased to introduce to you Multi variant/Variable Identification code (MVID-CODE). The world's first visual-electronic identification system .MVID-CODE has been developed for a wide range of industrial applications, however, upon its launch, our initial focus will be to cater to the Assisted Reproductive Technology (ART)/ In vitro fertilization (IVF treatment) centers in order to help prevent Embryos and gametes mismatches. MVID-CODE offers cost effectiveness, a positive psychological influence on users and a faster identification process in comparison to already existing competition.

MVID-CODE is a  Product of Tibet Innovations  an SME based in Brussels ,Belgium. Tibet Innovations' Company registration number is BE0600910149

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need an estimated 250,000 euros to help mass produce MVID-CODE at a subsidized rate, in addtion to completing the development of hardware accessories for MVID-CODE which are the MVID-SCANNER and MVID-PRINTER.
  • Our perks include  a Thank you letter, MVID-Tags/wallpapers customised for individual contributors, Branded MVID-CODE T-Shirts, Branded MVID-CODE   USB drive. 
  • We hope to attain our target funding, but in the event that we don't, we will use the funds raised to push  the project forward as we are committed to getting MVID-CODE across to all Laboratories and other business sectors in need of MVID-CODE.

The Impact

There have been some catastrophic mismatch incidents involving embryos or gametes in some IVF Laboratories with extremely devastating effects on the patients and families involved. We want  to help prevent such occurrences at an affordable cost to IVF laboratories who cannot afford the exorbitant costs associated with setting up Identification systems.

Some of the widely noted incidents of Embryo or gamete mix ups include

  • Strassman, M. (2009, Sept. 26). CBS News. Retrieved from http://www.cbsnews.com/news/legal-woes-for-new-orleans-in-vitro-clinic/
  • Carter, H. (2009, June 14). IVF clinic mix-up destroys couple’s last embryo and chance of second child.The Guardian. Retrieved fromhttp://www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle/2009/jun/14/ivf-clinic-embryo-couple-loss
  • Miller, T. (2014, April 15). Woman pregnant with wrong set of twins after mix-up at Italian fertility clinic.Daily News. Retrieved from http://www.nydailynews.com/life-style/health/woman-pregnant-wrong-set-twins-clinic-mix-up-article-1.1756788
  • Thornhill, A.R., Brunetti, Orriols X., Bird, S. (2012, Nov.). Measuring human error in the IVF laboratory using an electronic monitoring system.17th World Congress on Controversies in Obstetrics, Gynecology & Infertility, 101-106.


Risks & Challenges

  • As we progressed on our journey in the development of MVID-CODE, our foremost challenge was the availability of funds. This made the employment of an MVID-CODE software development team an even bigger challenge. 
  • We eventually overcame  this by first building a working prototype of MVID-CODE with a one man software development team. Once the functionality of this prototype was well established, more personal funds were invested into hiring a team of software developers to continue the development of MVID-CODE and preparing it for the market.

As we progressed on our journey in the development of MVID-CODE, our foremost challenge was the availability of funds. This made the employment of an MVID-CODE software development team an even bigger challenge. 


We eventually overcame  this by first building a working prototype of MVID-CODE with a one man software development team. Once the functionality of this prototype was well established, more personal funds were invested into hiring a team of software developers to continue the development of MVID-CODE and preparing it for the market.

story:
Wilson's Green Acres Farm in the picture is the home of the "Transplanter".  After retiring from a great career as a journeyman Machinist with years at CoverGirl, Procter and Gamble, and Unilever, my wife and I carved out our little farm and set to work growing our first crop.That crop of Quinoa was my inspiration.  Faced with a hundred soil pots and seeds the size of a grain of sand, I knew this would not be easy.  I sat down and with a pencil and developed the idea of the Transplanter.  It took a few times, but I finally got a prototype made.My wife Tanya and I took a couple Transplanters to the farmers market.Even on a cold,rainy November day we generated a lot of interest and made some quick cash.

We would like to start production of these and go online working out of our barn.We need a milling machine,cutoff saw and a band saw to get things started.Some odds and ends for tooling and shipping will round out our pledge request.
